campaigns.title: Dawn Corona Recovery Fund
campaigns.description: BACKSTORY  As you may or may not know, my wonderful mother Dawn Corona went into surgery for heart valve replacement March 16th. The surgery was successful but due to other unseen factors and a long time on the operating table my mother became ill. On¬†monday morning(3/19) Dawns family was called to say goodbye because they did not think she could make it. By the grace of God a surgeon was willing to perform an exploratory surgery on her abdomen to determine what was happening.  The cause of my mothers decline in health was properly diagnosed and the doctors began working to fix her and return her to a normal condition. There are a few procedures and surgeries on the horizon we still have yet to conquer but these are hurdles we are glad to face because of  the wonderful and profound beauty¬† my Mom brings to all of our lives.   HOW YOU CAN HELP  Due to unforeseen circumstances Dawns week long stay at the hospital has turned into something that we are not yet sure the length of. Our family has drawn close together so we can help¬† our most precious Dawn . Because of the distance from home, it is getting increasingly harder to maintain a healthy lifestyle. We are in need of funds for groceries, lodging, and transportation uses. $14 a day parking is adding up quite fast, and a number of other issues are beginning to make themselves known.  My main concern is that we are able to be here for my mother, She has directly stated she did not want to be left alone at anytime. This is something we are doing our best to accomplish but there is some difficulty in being 57 miles away from Corona. Having a hotel that family members can rotate through to shower or nap is needed, having gas and parking money will be crucial moving forward as well.¬†  I wish I could explain all of the issues moving forward, but to be honest being at the hospital is our lives right now. We will be facing many more issues once they let us take our dear Dawn home for recovery. We need your help even before getting back to square one.¬†  Let me be clear in stating that my Mothers life is still hanging in the balance. God has protected her for 49 yrs and I think God will continue to do so for many more. We are trusting the doctors and surgeons to have blessed hands. I will Inform everyone of more details as I am given permission for them to be made public, so thank you for your patience and we are grateful for your support, I will be giving you updates as soon as I can

campaigns.title: Help Ivan Breathe
campaigns.description: Hello all and loved ones,   My name is Isabel, and about 3 months ago, my best friend Ivan Heredia and his family received life changing news that has severely impacted their lives.    How We Got Here   As some of you may know, Ivan was in and out of the hospital the past several months, trying to find a diagnosis for his breathing problems. His lungs have suffered irreparable scarring, and inflammation which prevents him from breathing normally, causing his oxygen levels to drop dangerously low (currently, without respiratory equipment, he cannot breathe on his own). The Pulmonary Specialists at UCLA Medical Center have diagnosed him with a rare disease called 'Hermansky-Pudlak Syndrome,' (HPS) which is directly linked to his albinism.    His Current Status   Ivan was initially being treated at Riverside Community Hospital, but due to the rarity of his disease, he is now being treated at UCLA Medical Center, where hehas been cleared to undergo a double lung transplant. Due to the distance from his home in Riverside, he and his family will be forced to temporarily move as close as possible to the transplant center at UCLA to receive the intensive care after the transplant surgery. Part of the evaluation to determine his diagnosis of HPS included genetic testing, which is not covered by his health insurance, and will need to be paid out of pocket.  Currently, Ivan's wife Leticia, is faced with going back and forth between UCLA, work, and taking care of their two young children (Israel, 10 years and Emmilia, 17 months).   What Now?   Double lung transplants are expensive.  The pre and post transplant care is, as you can imagine, complex and critical. The medications, routine doctor visits, and costs for housing near the transplant center post-transplant surgery add up immensely.  I am reaching out to everyone who may or may not personally know Ivan, because I want to help raise funds for him and his family to cover direct expenses that are not covered by his health insurance. My goal is to give them a peace of mind, at least financially, throughout the process to a healthy recovery.  If you could please support my friend and his family by making a financial donation, and subsequently share it with your network, it would be most appreciated. Asking for money is difficult, but even the smallest amount of help can make a difference to help Ivan and his family at this time.¬†  Please feel free to reach out to me, or Ivan's siblings (Jonathan  jonathan.heredia@gmail.com  and Johanna  joredia@gmail.com  ) if you have any questions, or feel more comfortable donating in a different way.   Let's Help Ivan Breathe.

campaigns.title: My nephew's cancer story
campaigns.description: On Saturday, April 14th, we took my nephew to the emergency room because he was feeling sick. ¬†Little did we know that this emergency visit would change our entire lives.  My nephew was immediately admitted to the Pediatric Cancer Care unit. For that entire week my nephew was in and out of labs: x-ray, CT scan, PET scan, MRI, and biopsies. On Wednesday, April 18th, he was diagnosed with Ewing‚Äôs Sarcoma Cancer at his short age of 14.  Nothing is scarier than waiting for days in the hospital for answers, and then being told that my nephew has cancer. My entire family was rapidly swamped with medical terminology, life-threatening risks, and long and complex words we have never heard of, especially not a child. Yet we were expected to make immediate, crucial decisions that would drastically impact my nephew‚Äôs life and future.  Doctors began his chemotherapy the next day after his diagnosis. Due to the fact that the tumor was too big to be removed via surgery he had to immediately begin chemotherapy.  A cancer diagnosis is not the end; it is only the beginning. My nephew will undergo chemo for approximately 12 weeks, followed by a surgery, radiation, and months of medication and hospital visits. With every appointment, procedure, and treatment comes a cost. A cost, that I believe no family is ever prepared for.  My sister will be out of work to care for him throughout his entire treatment. All donations raised will help offset costs associated with this diagnosis, treatment and care. He will not fight this battle alone. Any help (prayer, donation or share) that you can give him will be greatly appreciated and will help him overcome the most important hurdle of his young life.  If you have ever seen a child fight cancer it will change you outlook on life forever! Anything you can donate will be truly appreciated. We look forward in seeing my nephew grow, graduate high school and one day college.  THE TRUTH BEHIND THE NUMBERS: Ewing‚Äôs Sarcoma is a rare type of cancer that usually occurs in children and young adults between the ages of 10 and 20. ¬†It is highly malignant and can metastasize (spread) rapidly to other areas of the body. Unfortunately, childhood cancer is underfunded for many reasons. For more information on childhood cancer, please visit:   https://www.acco.org/research/  .¬†  Again, we appreciate your time, help and support.  God bless you.     El s√°bado 14 de abril llevamos a mi sobrino a la sala de emergencias porque se sent√≠a enfermo. Poco sab√≠amos que esta visita de emergencia cambiar√≠a nuestras vidas enteras.  Mi sobrino fue admitido de inmediato en la unidad de atenci√≥n pedi√°trica contra el c√°ncer. Durante toda esa semana, mi sobrino entr√≥ y sali√≥ de los laboratorios: rayos X, tomograf√≠a computarizada, tomograf√≠a por emisi√≥n de positrones, resonancia magn√©tica y biopsias. El mi√©rcoles 18 de abril, le diagnosticaron c√°ncer de sarcoma de Ewing a su corta edad de 14 a√±os.  Nada es m√°s aterrador que esperar d√≠as en el hospital para obtener respuestas, y luego nos digan que mi sobrino tiene c√°ncer. Toda mi familia fue inundada r√°pidamente con terminolog√≠a m√©dica, riesgos que amenazan la vida y palabras largas y complejas de las que nunca hemos o√≠do, especialmente ningun ni√±o. Sin embargo, se esperaba que tom√°ramos decisiones inmediatas y cruciales que impactaran dr√°sticamente la vida y el futuro de mi sobrino.  Los m√©dicos comenzaron su quimioterapia al d√≠a siguiente despu√©s de su diagn√≥stico. Debido al hecho de que el tumor era demasiado grande para extraerlo mediante cirug√≠a, tuvo que comenzar inmediatamente con la quimioterapia.  Un diagn√≥stico de c√°ncer no es el final; Es solo el principio. Mi sobrino se someter√° a quimioterapia durante aproximadamente 12 semanas, seguido de una cirug√≠a, radiaci√≥n y meses de medicamentos y visitas al hospital. Con cada cita, procedimiento y tratamiento hay un costo. Un costo, que creo que ninguna familia est√° preparada.  Mi hermana estar√° sin trabajo para cuidarlo durante todo su tratamiento. Todas las donaciones recaudadas ayudar√°n a compensar los costos asociados con este diagn√≥stico, tratamiento y cuidado. √âl no pelear√° esta batalla solo. Cualquier ayuda (oraci√≥n, donaci√≥n o compartir) que pueda darle ser√° muy apreciada y lo ayudar√° a superar el obst√°culo m√°s dificil de su corta vida.  Si alguna vez has visto a un ni√±o luchar contra el c√°ncer, ¬°te cambiar√° la perspectiva de la vida para siempre! Todo lo que pueda donar ser√° realmente apreciado. Esperamos ver crecer a mi sobrino saludablemente, graduarce de la escuela secundaria y un d√≠a ir a la universidad.¬†  LA VERDAD DETR√ÅS DE LOS N√öMEROS: El sarcoma de Ewing es un tipo raro de c√°ncer que generalmente ocurre en ni√±os y adultos j√≥venes entre las edades de 10 y 20. Es altamente maligno y puede hacer met√°stasis (propagarse) r√°pidamente a otras √°reas del cuerpo. Desafortunadamente, el c√°ncer infantil no cuenta con fondos suficientes por muchas razones. Para obtener m√°s informaci√≥n sobre el c√°ncer infantil, visite:   https://www.acco.org/research/  ¬†.  Nuevamente, apreciamos su tiempo, ayuda y apoyo.  Dios lo bendiga.

campaigns.title: Support Baby Xiomara
campaigns.description: Diana and David Corona gave birth to their first child, Xiomara Corona, on April 10th, 2018. As first time parents, they¬†were both excited and nervous to begin this new chapter in their lives. Unfortunately, Xiomara has yet to see the outside of a hospital. She¬†was diagnosed with a rare medical condition called congenital hyperinsulinism, a condition that affects only 1 in every¬†50,000 newborns. Medication proved unsuccesful¬†and now¬†Xiomara has been¬†flown from Arizona to Texas where she is ¬†facing the prospect¬†¬†of surgery at just four weeks of age.  Few of us will ever experience the emotional rollercoaster Diana and David have been on recently, so we want to help them by lessening their financial burden. Diana is currently¬†on¬†maternity leave and does not know if and when she can return to her fourth grade teaching position. David has also taken time off of work and will continue to do so to remain by his daughter's side during this trying time. Therefore, all donated funds will go directly to the Corona family to help alleviate the financial stress incurred from the hospital stays, ambulance rides, and helicopter flights.  Diana, David, and Xiomara need your love and support. Please¬†use this page to donate or reach out to Daisy if you would like to help in another way. No donation is too small.¬† Every dollar donated is greatly appreciated and will go a long way in helping the Coronas successfully begin this next chapter in their lives.¬†   Please share this page with all of your social networks.   Thank you!  Daisy and Mariana Sandoval

campaigns.title: Corona del Sol Grad Night
campaigns.description: Corona del Sol has always had a ‚Äúgrad night‚Äù lock-in at Kiwanis Park the night of graduation. It is a fun and safe way for the seniors to celebrate their graduation. This year due to a number of circumstances it was a cancelled. This is the GoFundMe effort to raise funds to get this night back for our seniors. If you feel like you can contribute to this CDS tradition and keep grad night safe and fun please do!!! This is NOT for registering students to attend. This is for people who want to donate money to offset some of the costs of planning the event on short notice.  Because I work in the tech sector,¬† I offered by IT and technical skills as part of the leadership committee for the "grassroots" parent movement to save Corona del Sol Grad Night for the Class of 2018. I personally felt moved to start this GoFundMe campaign because of my son and his classmates (many whom I know in the community) deserve a fun and safe place to celebrate their graduation night.¬†  The funds from this GoFundMe allowed the grassroots parent team to pay some of the costs to secure the Kiwanis Recreation Center Venue for May 24-25 rental.¬†¬†   Save Corona Grad Night

campaigns.title: COVID-19 support for single mom
campaigns.description:
UPDATE: The reason this GoFundMe orginally started is written below. Along with her divorce still pending and now put to the side as courthouses have closed also during this time, both her jobs have closed(shes applied for assurance other places, but isnt sure on amounts and if or when those will be available. She's been forced out of work, her children are home from school and with social distancing child care is hard to find and limited for her to go apply at other places currently. I'm hoping by switching this fund to COVID-19 support for the time being the community can help supplement some til she's able to get back to work to help her maintain the essentials for her and her children during this time. She's wanting to leave food banks and meal handouts to those who are in worse shape than herself currently. Thanks to anyone who takes the time to read,share and donate. Stay safe and healthy out there , to read more about her story just scroll down to continue reading. Thanks Again!



***************************************
Orginal Story


Hello everyone! My name is Susan and im here on behalf of my friend (who for various reasons we have left anonymous). She is a single mother and currently going through a divorce.¬†


This is an updated story to shortened whats happened¬† and currently going on. If youve visited before and donated thank you! If you are here reading and plan to donate thank you also. Please feel to share this also on facebook to help spread her story.¬†


She has 2 children and has been separated from husband, during which hes given minimal aide to her, while the children have been living with her and visiting him on occasional¬† weekends, some holidays¬† and some extra time here and there pending on him. She juggles working multiple jobs, school for the kids, their homework and projects also their extracurricular activities which keep them on the go alot.¬†¬†


Due to her attempts to end the divorce quickly, cheaply and peacefully hes decided to go the other route in which now unfortunately the children may be stuck in the middle of it despite her efforts to avoid that.¬†


I started¬† this page¬† awhile ago when i found out he stopped helping with support all together to help her with bills,¬† she only¬† used it for awhile and i restarted it once things got moving¬† in the court system and he was running up her legal fees. Now months later with still no end in sight and the holidays¬† approaching i wanted to put it out there again to give her some aide to help with bills and hopefully allow her to make this holiday season a nice one for her children with everything going on.¬†



Thank you again for your help, your consideration in helping and if you share this link to help spread her story to possibly allow further aide from others. Tis the season.... right?



Happy Holidays Everyone!

campaigns.title: Covid-19 Quarantine
campaigns.description:
On August 14, 2018, I received a complete heart transplant at Strong Memorial Hospital in Rochester, NY.
Health wise, it was a complete blessing. I'm finally feeling better than I ever have. I am, however, on immunosuppressants. It's now dangerous for me to go anywhere. Post transplant, I receive Social Security Disability as I've been deemed unfit to work. Along with SSD, they have assigned me to use Medicare for my health insurance. My cost for health insurance comes right out of my SSD, and my medication copay has nearly tripled.
Any help provided will help offset medication cost, and help in obtaining life supplies through mail order, as I must stay in place until this virus situation is resolved. Thank you in advance for your time and support.

campaigns.title: Guillermina Corona Santana

Para aquellos que no lo saben, el 23 de mayo de 2018, perdimos a una amiga cari√±osa, hija, hermana, madre, prima y t√≠a Guillermina Corona.  (English 1)Hello family ,friends, of we are organizing this Gofundme in light of a heartbreaking and unfortunate occurrence.For those who don't already know May 23 2018 we lost a loving friend,daughter,sister,mother ,cousin,and aunt Guillermina Corona   (Spanish 2 Guillermina era una madre soltera que trabajaba arduamente. Ella hizo todo lo posible para darle a su hijo todo lo que necesitaba. Era una amable y cari√±osa miembro de la familia. Siempre pens√≥ en los dem√°s antes que en ella misma. Nunca le dese√≥ nada malo a otra persona. En su peor momento momentos en que siempre ten√≠a una sonrisa en su rostro y estaba lista para enfrentar sus miedos, nunca la vi rendirse. Despu√©s de conocer a Guillermina Corona, creemos que es f√°cil decir que toc√≥ todos los corazones y almas que conoci√≥. realmente un modelo a seguir, alguien a quien honestamente admiraba.  (English 2) Guillermina was a hard working single mother.She did anything possible to give her son anything he needed.She was a kind and loving family member.She always thought about others before herself.Never did she ever wish bad upon someone else.At her worst moments she always had a smile on her face and was ready to face her fears, never did i ever see her give up.Having met Guillermina Corona , we believe it is easy to say that she touched every heart and soul she met.She was truly a role model someone who i honestly looked up to .   (Spanish 3). Guillermina se encontr√≥ con muchas formas de adversidad a lo largo de su vida, pero a trav√©s de su familia, amigos Ella se esfuerza por convertirse en un gran modelo a seguir como madre, hermana, hija, primo,  y t√≠a  (English 3)  Guillermina encountered many forms of adversity throughout her life but through her family,friends She strives to become a great role model as a mother,sister,daughter,cousin,aunt ¬† (Spanish 4) La tarea de recaudar fondos entre familiares y amigos es extremadamente dif√≠cil y lidiar con la p√©rdida de un ser querido es insoportable: por lo tanto, genuinamente nos contactamos con sus amigos y familiares de Guillermina Corona para ayudar a donar. Si resulta ser eso en En este momento no puede brindar ayuda, es completamente comprensible, esperamos que pueda participar en el sistema de apoyo de alguien. Gracias ¬† (English 4) The task to Fundraise in between family and friends is extremely difficult and dealing with the loss of such a loved one is unbearable: therefore we genuinely reach out to you her friends and family of Guillermina Corona to help donate .If it happens to be that at this moment you are not able to provide help,it is completely understandable,we hope you can partake in being apart of someones support system . Thank you  (Spanish 5) Gracias por su amor y apoyo, nosotros, la familia y amigos de Guillermina Corona, estamos solemnemente agradecidos por sus generosas donaciones y su forma de apoyo.   (English 5) Thank you for your love and support ,we the family and friends of Guillermina Corona are solemnly grateful for your generous donations and form of support.  (Spanish 6) Descansa en paz Guillermina Corona, estar√°s por siempre en nuestros corazones y recordado como una bendici√≥n para cada vida que hayas tocado.   (English 6) Rest in peace Guillermina Corona you will forever be in our hearts and remembered as a blessing to every life you touched.

campaigns.title: In Memory of Jonathan Corona
campaigns.description: In loving memory of my brave brother that fought cancer for long 10 years like a warrior. He was always very optimistic and positive spirit. One strong boy that care for his family no matter what his condition was. Jonathan a silly boy who would always spend he's birthdays at the hospital and never gave up his happiness and was happy for life no matter How hard it was! Even at he's worst times he would crack jokes and try to make us laugh. We lost a champion. He‚Äôs smile alway full of dreams! ¬†  En memoria de mi hermano tan valiente que pele√≥ contra el c√°ncer por 10 largos a√±os y nunca se dio por vencido! Siempre fue tan optimista y positivo. Venci√≥ el cancer varias veces hasta q su cuerpo no pudo m√°s. Un muchachito con el esp√≠ritu tan fuerte que siempre ve√≠a por su familia y los dem√°s. Jonathan a pesar de estar internado siempre daba por contar sus chistes y hacernos re√≠r su sonrisa siempre llena de ilusiones.¬†  Any help is welcome we highly appreciate.¬†  Cualquier ayuda es importante hasta un d√≥lar muchas gracias!

campaigns.title: Delenny's Funeral Fund
campaigns.description: What was supposed to be a day of joy and happiness turned into a day of mourning. My sister-in-law and my brother were expecting to come home with their beautiful baby girl Delenny today, but are now left with discussing funeral arrangements. I am making this goFundme to help them cover the cost of a funeral and burial to lay Delenny to rest. Anything helps... if you can't donate then please keep her in your prayers. Thank you..

campaigns.title: Surgery for Prostate Cancer
campaigns.description: Hey everyone. I want to thank you for taking the time to click on this link. For about 6 months, my dad was having excruciating pain in his groin, and eventually, we were told it is prostate cancer. Luckily, it is in its early stages, and it has not spread. ¬†My dad‚Äôs surgery was originally scheduled for June 29th, but was moved to the end of July because of my dad‚Äôs weight. He has been working hard for a couple months and has been doing great, but our doctor wants him to lose more for his own safety, and for the procesures chances of working to increase.¬†While we are thankful for the early stage cancer, we are struggling financially. My family has never been crazy rich, but we also don‚Äôt survive off off every paycheck. My dad is self-employed, which means he has to work to make money, and doesn‚Äôt have a given ‚Äúsalary‚Äù each year- it all depends on his amount of work done. My mom works with the school system, so we are down paychecks until school starts up again. My parents are both incredibly hard-working people who always put us, her kids, before them. Always. My parents don‚Äôt ask for other people‚Äôs help, but lately, the vibes in the house rough. We are tight on food and also have very very many animals to take care of (16 to be exact). We would really appreciate any donations, we need every bit that we can get right now. Please share this link to everyone you know. Thank you so much for taking the time to read this; I appreciate it!

campaigns.title: Graciela
campaigns.description: Gracie a mother of 3, has devoted her life to fighting for the rights of others. Now, she's in the fight for her own. Gracie doesn‚Äôt think she‚Äôs a hero, but to me and us she is. She‚Äôs using her director and leadership skills for good by creating programs for women and families. Gracie, your generosity and humility inspires our entire team. It‚Äôs people like you who are changing the world, one small act of kindness at a time. Gracie is fighting the biggest battle of her life.¬† She is staying positive with prayers and Gods blessing. ¬†    Gracie es una excelente madre de 3 jovencitos. Ella a dedicado su vida a la lucha por los derechos de otros. Ahora dolorosamente esta luchando por si misma.¬† Gracie no cree que es una heroe, pero para mi y nosotros lo es, ya que¬†con su liderazgo, crea programas gratis por la union entre mujeres,¬† familias y ninos.¬† Gracie, tu¬† generocidad pero sobre todo tu HUMILDAD nos ha a inspirado a las que formamos parte de este equipo, a ser mejores Directoras y seres Humanos. Sin duda Gracie, personas como TU son quienes estan cambiando el mundo con cada acto de generocidad por pequeno que sea.¬† Gracie dolorosamente para quien la amamos hoy est√° peleando la batalla m√°s grande de su vida, y aunque Ella se mantiene positiva, necesita de nuestro apoyo emocional, espiritual y economico, asi que pido no sesen nuestras oraciones y apoyo, para que¬† logre una pronta recuperacion y hacer de estos momentos tan dificiles para su familia lo menos pesado posible.

campaigns.title: Support fund for Marilou
campaigns.description: As many of you may know, Marilou Corona-Wullstein was in a serious rollover accident earlier this week while she and her son, Mitchell, were in Texas on July 5, 2018.¬† The man who witnessed the accident said the car was headed straight for a pole and, by God's grace, the car avoided the pole which would have been much more serious for both Marilou and Mitch.¬† Mitch was not hurt during the accident (thank God) but Marilou had to be airlifted to a hospital where she underwent multiple surgeries for an open fracture of her arm with gross contamination and tissue loss, broken back and other injuries and had a multiple-day ICU stay.¬† Unfortunately, the expense of the transportation and treatment Marilou received were not covered fully under her insurance and is praying for some assistance to help with the substantial medical bills.¬† Marilou will be released from treatment on July 11 and is blessed to have a friend who will transport her to Colorado, stopping every hour during the drive to minimize risk of blood clots.  Marilou is an incredible inspiration to those around her. She is a recent breast cancer survivor and, through all of the treatments, she remains positive and grateful for the blessings she continues to receive daily.¬† Those that know Marilou know she is giving and full of grace and shares her spirit constantly with those around her.¬† She is in need of all of our help now, so please consider supporting Marilou.¬† All funds raised through this effort will be used to pay bills not covered by insurance. Please pray for a full recovery for Marilou!¬† Thank you for your support!¬† May God bless you!

campaigns.title: The Red Pears Vinyls
campaigns.description: Hi! We're a band from El Monte, CA. Unfortunately, sometimes being a band that does everything DIY comes with a price. We have been trying to get vinyls made, but we do not have the sufficient funds to do so. We were debating about posting this, but honestly, this goal can not be accomplished by ourselves any time soon. We are doing this in a way of a pre sale, where any 20 dollar donation gets you a vinyl, and any 30 dollar donation gets you a personally signed vinyl with extra merch. Above is a picture of our friend Luis who created the art for the vinyl with a prototype of it. Any donation would really help, and even sharing this would be really helpful. Any money raised will go directly to the making of the vinyl for, "For Today, For Tomorrow, For What Is, For What Could've Been". Thank you all once again for all of your and support! And thank you for taking the time to read this! Have a great day!

campaigns.title: Lets Make EROCK plumbing A Reality
campaigns.description: Hello everybody! As I‚Äôve been updating pics and my work status on social media I‚Äôm sure you have figured that I am no longer with my previous employer. I started off at that franchise 11 1/2 years ago with the intentions of never really leaving and working my way up the ranks. ¬†At the time I was hired, I started in the office as a customer service representative. ¬†No positions were available in the field so I figured that I would make it out eventually. I worked my way up through the company as planned through out the years from data entry, scheduling appointments, and managing the Hawaii branch remotely from Orange County. ¬†I was finally given the chance to be a technicians helper in the field after 5 long years of office work. This is when the hard work started and I figured out plumbing would be my life long career. I started by assisting in locating and repairing leaks on pool/spa systems. ¬†After a couple of years assisting in pools, I moved on to my apprenticeship in residential leak locating and repairs. I was given the opportunity to run my own truck as a technician after all the training. Within 2 years I hit the ceiling and became Orange County‚Äôs top producing technician but I didn‚Äôt feel satisfied with the limited knowledge of plumbing that I had gained.   My next step was to move on to another company which was much more versed in all aspects of plumbing from residential, commercial, industrial, service plumbing, repairs, remodels, and new construction. The pace was so fast and the days were so long that it felt as though I learned 5 years worth of plumbing within a 1 years span that I was with this 2nd company. ¬†  After some hardship due to the limited amount of time I had with my family, I decided I needed to go back to my original employer in order to slow the pace down again and figure out my next move. ¬†When I got back to my old employer I realized that the skill sets that I acquired throughout my career no longer fit in with the companies structure. ¬†I was being used to train others such as helpers and senior technicians as to what I had learned without being compensated. ¬†The company let me go because I didn‚Äôt agree to work for free. ¬†Now suddenly I was left jobless and with a family of 5 daughters and a wife to provide for. ¬†I took this as a sign and the opportunity to begin my own plumbing empire. ¬†During this time it not only humbled me but gave me the drive to pursue my dream. ¬†This is when EROCK Plumbing and Repipe went from being a dream to something I need to achieve.   The name EROCK Plumbing and Repipe is dedicated to my best friend Erik Ortiz that passed in a tragic accident in 2014. Knowing that he had always wanted to be a boss but never got the chance to do so, this is my way of fulfilling his dream as well.   Since I‚Äôve been unemployed I have continued with submitting all my legal documents to register my business name,license,and tax i.d. # with the state. I have enrolled in school to gain my plumbing license so that once the legal documents are processed I can take my test to then become a legitimate company.   I intend on using my platform in the community to also support awareness of Substance abuse, depression awareness, and breast cancer awareness. ¬† I‚Äôm asking asking for your help. I‚Äôm asking for donations to fund the purchase of a used utility truck, any more business fees that may need to be paid, equipment purchases, and create a home office. ¬†  My wife will be the manager/ co owner and I also intend on bringing more family on board to create EROCK Plumbing. ¬†  Any amount of donation will be greatly appreciated and will be utilized towards the final goal of this business start up. You have all been very supportive in my mission to become a Plumbing entrepreneur and I want to thank you for being a part of my journey. You are all considered a part of the EROCK Plumbing family by donating.   This is definitely out of my character to ask for help but it definitely needed. Thank You!¬† ¬†  Miguel Ortega

campaigns.title: Shane Corona's Funeral Service
campaigns.description: Everyone who knew Shane knows that he had a heart¬†of gold. A rare person that would truly go out of his way for the ones he cared about. A father, uncle, friend, teamster, and free spirit who will live on in all of our memories. Please help contribute to raising money for his funeral services. Anything that goes over the costs will be donated to his daughter 12-year-old daughter, Maia Corona, in the form of a college fund account. Thank you.

campaigns.title: Lori‚Äôs cancer treatment
campaigns.description: Lori was diagnosed with Brain Cancer in May 2018. Since then she and her family have been working tirelessly to educate themselves on the management of such a hefty foe. This management includes medical costs that are not covered by health insurance. With several stints in the hospital this past year, Lori has moments that are reassuring and at other times severe relapses. Through it all, they have kept optimistic.   Lori and husband Tim, both veteran firefighters have managed to stay strong through this ordeal; however the financial burden is becoming heavier with Lori unable to work and Tim, currently a Paramedic serving San Bernardino County has had to take family leave to care for Lori full time. Their son Sammy has been a trooper in all this, helping where he can and truly being the glue that helps to keep this loving family together.  As family friends, we ask that you consider making a donation to the Korioth Family. Every contribution, big or small helps to keep Lori, Tim and Sammy fighting and moving forward. We thank you from the bottom of our hearts for any and all the help that may come our way during¬† this emotionally and financially stressful time.

campaigns.title: In Memory of Jeff Murdock
campaigns.description: In response to the outpouring of requests from people wanting to help, we've set up this fund. Your support will help cover memorial and other expenses incurred by Jeff‚Äôs family.

campaigns.title: Help 2 Families Stay in Corona, QNS
campaigns.description: *****[En espa√±ol abajo]*****  Help Two Immigrant Families Stay In Their Neighborhood of Corona, Queens  We are a group of anti-gentrification activists and tenant organizers in Queens and we are trying to prevent the displacement of two immigrant families from their long-time neighborhood of Corona, Queens.¬†¬†We need your help to make sure they are able to stay in Corona.  The two families are related and have lived above the space occupied by IMI Corona for the past 11 years.¬†¬†IMI Corona, a valued community center and refuge for immigrant families, recently received word that they have to leave the space where they have built a strong connection to the surrounding community.¬†¬†Just like IMI Corona, the two families above the space also suddenly received notices that stated they had until August 31st¬†to move out or face going to housing court.  IMI Corona and the two families are being evicted by the same landlord, Robert Gans, who has a 17 building real-estate portfolio that includes Metropolitan Lumber   Hardware, the old Scores strip club and a dozen other commercial buildings in Corona and Astoria, one of which houses a senior center that is also being evicted.¬†  With August 31st¬†fast approaching, the two families have been searching for affordable apartments to move into.¬†¬†This has been made difficult by the wave of gentrification that has swept Western Queens and has caused rents in Corona to soar.¬†¬†The donations collected through this campaign will help the two families pay for part of their security deposits or brokers‚Äô fees‚Äîthe total being split between the two families.  You can read IMI Corona‚Äôs public statement on the news they have to move out of their current space by clicking on this link:   IMI Corona public statement ¬†  Thank you and please share this with others so that we can meet our goal.  In solidarity.  ----------------------------------------------  Evitemos que el aburguesamiento expulse a las familias de Corona -- Necesitamos su ayuda!  Nosotros somos un grupo de activistas en Queens y estamos luchando en contra del desplazamiento con fines de mantener a estas dos familias en Corona. Estas familias inmigrantes han vivido en Corona por 11 a√±os y est√°n siendo expulsadas por su due√±o de casa. Necesitamos de urguencia recaudir fondos.¬†¬†  IMI Corona es un espacio muy valorado en Queens y sirve como un centro communitario e un refugio para inmigrantes. Hace poco IMI Corona fue notificado que tendr√° quedesalojar del espacio muy pronto. Tal como a IMI Corona a las familias tambien le dieron una fecha del 31 de Agosto para desalojarse o ir al tribunal de viviendas.¬†  IMI Corona y las dos familias est√°n siendo desalojadas por el mismo due√±o de casa, Robert Gans, quien es due√±o de 17 edificios incluyendo¬†Metropolitan Lumber   Hardware, un strip club Scores NY, y otra docena de edificios comerciales en Corona y Astoria. Uno de esos edificios es un asilo de la tercera edad lo cual tambien esta siendo desalojado.¬†  Con el 31 de Agosto en unos cuantos dias las familias han estado desesperadamente buscando departamentos asequibles sin suerte. En si esta busqueda por viviendas asequibles en Queens es parte de una ola de aburguesamiento que esta arrasando con la ciudad de Nueva York. Las donaciones seran colectadas a medio de esta campagna virtual lo cual sera compartido entre las dos familias. La plata recaudida ira a pagar el deposito de seguro y para un "brokers' fee".¬†  Usted puede leer el testimonio de IMI Corona acerca de la situacion aqui:   Testimonio p√∫blica de IMI Corona ¬†  Se le agradece mucho! Favor de compartir esta campagna con su redes para llegar a nuestra meta de $2,000.¬†  Siempre en la lucha y en la solidaridad !

campaigns.title: Diamer Basha and Mohmand Dam Fund
campaigns.description: Prime Minister Imran Khan spoke to the nation in a brief televised address on Friday evening to appeal for donations to the dams fund set up by the Supreme Court.  "There is no question that we are faced with several significant problems," the prime minister said as he began the address. "Our debt today stands at Rs30,000 billion but the biggest problem we currently face is the water crisis.

campaigns.title: Send 6 Local Leaders to UWDCongress
campaigns.description: Somos Seattle is requesting community support to help send six local LGBTQ immigrants rights leaders to the United We Dream Congress, October 5-7! Because after all, LGBTQ rights are immigrant rights.   UWD Congress is the largest immigrant youth led gathering where leaders come together to craft the national and local agenda for immigrant rights. DACA (Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals) is one of the major victories achieved from UWD Congress.¬†  Given the current administration, we need WA State and our leaders to be present, trained, and energized! You can support local, on-the-ground immigration efforts by making a donation today.   ----- Somos is an organization for LGBTQ Latinx folks. Our goal is to build an active community, share resources, and foster spaces for learning   growth. Your contribution is tax-deductible through our fiscal sponsor, Rainier Valley Corps whose EIN is 47-4257834."

campaigns.title: In-Vitro Fertilization Support
campaigns.description:
Hello!¬†  You may know me online as "Javanshir" or "beiua", but if you were around even further in the past you'd know that my actual name is Edgar Corona.
 

 I have been with my wife Gabrielle since October of 2007, and we have been married since August of 2012. We recently bought our first home in Southern Oregon; a 3-bedroom home that I have been actively remodeling the interior myself, with aspirations of starting a family. However, it has been evident that we are unable to naturally start our own family...
 

 In 2014, my wife Gabrielle had an ectopic pregnancy. That is, a pregnancy that begins within the fallopian tubes instead of the uterus. This resulted in a very early-stage miscarriage. In 2015, she had an additional ectopic pregnancy, however this pregnancy resulted in the need for emergency surgery. This surgery was when we discovered she had the said miscarriage in 2014---and now both fallopian tubes are scarred shut, and we have been told attempts to "repair" the fallopian tubes is infeasible. She is no longer fertile.
 

 That said, we have been looking at the other options. We spent a weekend taking state-required classes for foster and/or adoption. We looked into adopting an international child. But in the end we still dream of the idea of conceiving our own children... however these are still a fallback plan, just in case.   This is where the "In-Vitro" process comes into play. For those who don't know what In-Vitro is, the simplest way I can describe it is a petri dish baby that is eventually injected for potential implantation. 
 

 ...if only it were that easy! We recently received our In-Vitro Fertilization schedule, so the ball is now rolling, and it is a daunting process of costly drugs, carefully scheduled to be used for weeks on end along with regular medical consultations at an office that is hours away. We are only able to afford a small handful of these costs, along with the inevitable cost of driving to and from the clinic and missing time from work. I work for Anheuser-Busch and my health insurance does not cover infertility procedures. My wife works in the banking industry and her insurance only covers the consultations.¬†
 

 The nature of using the drugs needed in the In-Vitro process is already scary enough... and to see the costs is even worse! We are both scared but very hopeful. The chances of In-Vitro working as intended is very slim and often requires repeated attempts... but the repeated attempts means higher cost. There may be a point when we run out of funds to try again and simply become hopeless.
 

 I'm not sure how to say this, but we need help. From anyone. Any amount of donations would be beneficial for us, no matter how small. I am reaching out to anyone because we have done everything we can so far. We have a home, careers, family, but no financial assistance for In-Vitro Fertilization procedures.
 

 If anyone can help us in this matter we will be eternally grateful. Our goal is $12,000 because that is the initial quoted amount for a single attempt. Repeated attempts are said to cost less but we are hopeful on a first attempt being successful! But again any amount helps us more than you can imagine. Any questions are welcomed.
 

 Thank you for reading!¬†
 

 ¬†
 

 [edit 8/5: We learned our insurance covers some of the basic medications such as the birth control required to put her on a more controlled menstrual cycle, and antibiotics we both need to take prior to September. For this among other reasons, the initial quoted amount has been reduced]

campaigns.title: Raul Corrales
campaigns.description: This morning, we woke up not knowing it would be the last day i would see my grandfather alive. He was a caring, loving, hard working person that i can honestly say did not have a bad bone in his body. He was murdered today on 10/09/18 in a drive by shooting on the west side of long beach. He was an innocent bystander hit by a stray bullet. He was watering his lawn and was simply taken from us, an innocent life cut short. Never in a million years would our family have thought that this would occur to us. We are caught between walls here because our grandmothers diabetes treatment is expensive and we did not expect this to occur. He leaves behind family and friends who have not a bad memory of him, a hard working, honest man who achieved the american dream. Rest in piece TATA. All donations are greatly appreciated,thank you we cant express it enough.

campaigns.title: Martha Aranda
campaigns.description: Amigos, con el coraz√≥n pezado les damos la noticia de que nuestra adorada Martha Aranda se nos ha adelantado al cielo para estar al lado de Dios, dejando atr√°s a sus tres hijos Martha, Cathy, y George y a muchos seres queridos. El d√≠a S√°bado 13 de Octubre fue el tr√°gico d√≠a en que sucedi√≥ un horrible accidente automovil√≠stico en el que Martha Aranda fue atropellada y el cual le quit√≥ la vida. No hay palabras para describir lo que sentimos en estos momentos pero queremos pedirles a todos un poquito de su ayuda. El √öltimo dese√≥ de Martha fue ser enterrada junto a sus padres en Ahuisculco, Jalisco y que no le llor√°ramos mucho si no que le celebr√°ramos su vida y alegria con una buena banda sonando. Les pedimos su ayuda en esto, para poder tener los recursos de cumplirle su sue√±o y que sea puesta a descansar en su tierra natal. Cualquier sea su aporte ser√° agradecidamente recibido y le ayudara infinitamente a la familia Aranda.¬†  Friends, it is with a heavy heart that we bear the news of Martha Aranda‚Äôs passing. On Saturday October 13th, tragedy struck our family when Martha Aranda was involved in a pedestrian accident which ultimately ended her life too soon. She has gone to heaven way too soon and has left behind her three loving children Martha, Cathy, and George. There are no words to express the pain that we all feel during these hard times and we want to ask for a little of your support. Martha Aranda‚Äôs last wish was to be laid to rest next to her parents in her hometown of Ahuisculco, Jalisco. She would have liked to see us all celebrate her life with the same joy that she lived it with. We ask you all for your help in accomplishing this last wish of hers. Any little bit helps and will be greatly appreciated.

campaigns.title: Help Piper march in the Rose Parade
campaigns.description: I hate to ask for help but here is our story. Piper is crazy talented in this thing called color guard!! She just got a spot in the Tournament of Rose Honor Band and Color Guard. She is the first out of state student to be marching with this amazing organization in it‚Äôs 90 year history. But along will that comes a price. Piper will be receiving college credit for this but because she is out of state we have to pay out of state tuition which isn‚Äôt cheap. I have never been one to spoil my kids I know how to say no but one thing I will not say no to is her education and following her dreams, especially when I see her talent. I work almost 6 days a week and when I‚Äôm not working I‚Äôm volunteering my time with school color guard just to be involved in her life. And I hate to say it but her father has pretty much turned his back on her and we get no help from him. I do all I can to make sure she can live her dreams, even putting off my back surgery. See I already lived my dreams and now I want to see her live hers!!! Piper and I work as a team, we have sold about 10 boxes of chocolates together to pay off her fall season fees and travel fees, so trust me we don‚Äôt sit around just asking for donations and money. They say always ask, the worst that happens is someone says no and there‚Äôs no better support then from your family and friends. So please find it in your heart, not for me but for Piper to support her dreams even if it‚Äôs just $1. We both truly appreciate your kindness and generosity from the bottom of our hearts‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è Thank You!!!!!

Your donation keeps us running, it fuels our bus, it keep us legal on the street where we can make a difference. It pays our gas and electric this allows us to cook and buy the extras we serve up to the guys ever week, over 150 are having bellies filled. We do homedrops every week to those who get into accomodation but having spent months or years on the street they often have ilness ormalnourished. We give between ¬£40-¬£50 in good food and even provide TV's and Radios...we are all volunteers we are all commited to bringing support and change to Homeless   Rough Sleeper.........but only with your help.  And some info on what we have provided in our last year   11000 meals, 1300 food parcels, 2 ton pf food per week most of which is waste or close to sell by date, 4000 beds for the night given to 350 men, 27 women, 19 victims of abuse/violence 7 on the night, Police brought or referred 16 people,.  Streetvets service for Homeless Dogs part of our Sunday Street Kitchen. ., 39 active Vets/Volunteers. They have seen   registered 131 dogs in the city.

campaigns.title: Carmela and Jayden
campaigns.description: On Wednesday, November 14, 2018, our dear friends, Carmela and her son, Jayden, were victims of a collision that took place near their home at Keele Street and Finch Street in Toronto, Ontario.  They were standing at the corner of Four Winds Drive¬†and Keele Street, when they were struck and pinned under a full-sized cargo van.¬†    https://www.cp24.com/news/woman-child-struck-after-collision-in-north-york-1.4176543  ¬†  Luckily, quick-acting bystanders were able to lift the cargo van and free both Carmela and Jayden, as First-Responders arrived at the scene. They both suffered severe injuries, but we are extremely thankful and fortunate to still have them with us. Sadly, they will have a long and painful recovery ahead.¬†  Carmela is a devoted mom and wife who delights in providing Jayden with a healthy, positive, loving childhood.¬† Jayden is a kind-hearted young boy with much liveliness and charisma. They were inseparable before the accident. Now, due to the severity of their injuries, they are receiving the best care possible, but in hospitals at opposite corners of the city of Toronto.¬†  The family is doing their best to alternate their time between Carmela and Jayden. ¬†Carmela‚Äôs husband is doing his best to split his time between his wife and son.¬† As one can only imagine, his life was turned upside-down upon learning of his loved-ones‚Äô accident.¬†  ¬†Carmela and her husband are self-employed business owners. Now, with Carmela‚Äôs hospitalization and her husband‚Äôs time spent in travel and visitation, their retail business is temporarily on-hold.  Both Carmela and Jayden‚Äôs recoveries will demand a long hospital stay and require several surgeries and intense emotional, mental and physical therapies.  We ask for your prayers for a speedy recovery, and any monetary support that you can give. All funds received will be allocated to pay for medical expenses, logistic expenses, and lost income.  From the bottom of our hearts we thank you for your prayers and support. Please post and share; your invaluable support is very much appreciated.

campaigns.title: Father seeking to reunite with son
campaigns.description: To whom may read this,  First, thank you so much for taking the time to read my message.   This all begins with me meeting Kristina towards the end of 2010 online ( we met on MySpace, I believe). We started dating and not long into it, 3 weeks or so, she gets arrested for child neglect ( see link )  http://archive.tcpalm.com/news/fort-pierce-mom-arrested-after-tot-found-alone-on-street-home-filthyep-388567336-345582252.html/  . I decided to take the police report and news reports with a grain of salt and kept the relationship going while she was in jail. When she got out of jail (about 2 months later) she moved in with me since her mother moved during the time of her incarceration. Due to failure to show progress to the court, her case worker, and to myself not only had she lost her daughter to the father living another state away, she lost a boyfriend who had seen her disregard for what happened.    It was Nov of 2011 when I bought her a bus ticket to live with her mother in TN (Crossville), about 5 months later I get a phone call from an unknown number that happens to be her on the other end saying I ruined her life and that she's pregnant. Given the amount of time we had gone without seeing each other I asked for proof like a picture of herself pregnant. She refused and I didn't hear from her after that. 2 months later she ends back up in Fort Pierce, FL, my home town. I notice she actually is pregnant and the time line fits. To make sure they both are OK I agree to take her to appointments, buy her food etc.. but I wouldn't buy anything for the baby or give her money without a paternity test. In short I suggested that she save all the necessary receipts and I'd gladly pay what I owe. Upset that I didn't want a relationship, she began telling me things in spite, i.e " He won't have your last name, I'm going to name him after your ex's new bf. I will admit that she managed to make me upset, to the point where I did tell her that if he is mine I will take him away. From there she leaves to a state unknown to me to have the baby.  Fast forward 6 months: she reaches out with an alias and a picture of a little boy that looks just like me. I get a couple pictures and short dialogue before she ask me for money. I told her we need this done right so I want to go through court and establish paternity and get her set up with child support. With that said the cycle repeats itself and now she is completely under the radar.    It has been 6 years since and during that time I've contacted IRS, DCF, CPI, everyone short of a private investigator to let them know a woman is claiming I have a son with her and I want to find him. No one would help me unless she filed for state services and since she could be anywhere there was no way to know where to begin. Nevertheless the search began, although no one I could reach knew where she was or who she was with. I could only hope she would pop up, and I left every social media outlet available to me open with full contact information in case she ever wanted to try contacting me again.   In July of this year, through Facebook friend suggestion algorithm , I noticed a woman that resembled Kristina. I click on the page and sure enough, it was her! I reach out to her with full understanding she could delete her account and disappear again. This time, that wasn't the case. She was actually willing to talk, saying that he (my son) already has a dad and my son is very well off. That he has a grandmother now and a family. I was OK with everything she was saying, I just wanted to know he was doing well and wanted to build rapport with her again. A month goes by and she tells me after talking to her fiance they agreed to introduce me to Daniel and explain to him I'm his father. Danny and I had a few face to face video calls, it was great! he even got to meet one of his sisters on video and luckily I was able to screen shot them talking for the first time! After about a week of finally getting to that point things started to unfold with her situation. She began asking if I could take her in for a while because her fiance is mean to my son and grandmother is equally as mean and she can't take it anymore so I told her to let me think it over.    ¬† (The first time Danny and Destiny were met)  Out of nowhere I got a phone call from a number in Pennsylvania. My roommate is also from PA so I thought it was for him and answered the phone. An elder woman asks if I'm Mynor to which I replied I was.   She says " I'm Katie and I'm the person your son has been calling grandma". We get well acquainted and she started emailing me photos of Daniel which was heaven sent, but was shocked when I heard what she had to say, which in summary, was she is retired from school administration, a Sunday school assistant and her husband Lee is retired NYPD. She had been looking into me and came to the conclusion the person Kristina was describing Danny's father to be was very much untrue, that she believed Daniel was not in the best of care with her (Katie's) son and Kristina ( now Chelsea) and began telling me all the ways she felt he was being mistreated. How prior to Kristina moving to PA she was living in a drug home that had just got busted according to her son, that she called Lancaster child and youth services, and welfare fraud to report her for what she called " neglect of Daniels well being and abuse of government assistance". Since Kristina found out what Katie had done after the visit from a case worker she sent Daniel away on which she called it a vacation and she followed shortly there after but not before blocking me from contact. Since reconnecting with her son, Katie was able to have her son open up about things and he felt guilty about what happened so he's trying to help with information. With the information I have obtained I hired a private investigator to track them down. With amazingly quick results I now know she is back in TN and has a brand new fiance and a new alias ( now Michelle) on social media after less than a month from leaving PA and ex Fiance. With this I now have her address and I have to have documents served.   This is where you come in. I have exhausted all other resources at my disposal. My ultimate goal is to get full custody. This little boy, my son, has sisters, aunts, uncles, a big family and support system waiting for him. He would have all the attention a growing boy needs and many willing to help me provide guidance for him as he grows but the longer I wait the possibility grows she'll find out and once again leave and would have to start the search again.   I'm begging you, the reader to understand this is not for me. This is for Daniel. His future. The money donated to this cause will go towards legal fees, and anything needed/related that would help Daniel and his family reunite.    Your patience for reading this, understanding of the situation, and contribution is greatly appreciated from the bottom of my heart and thank you for your consideration. If any questions, concerns or words of advice feel free to reach out to me.  Mynor Corona

campaigns.title: Final Arrangement Expenses For Dianne
campaigns.description: On Friday, November 16th we lost our beloved Dianne Akers unexpectedly, due to complications of a car accident.¬†Dianne was loved by so many people. She was born in Ohio and came to live in Hemet, CA for the past 20 or so years. She is survived by 1 daughter; Cheryl, 3 sons; Dennis, Dwayne, and son Daniel(who proceeded her in death), grandchildren, great grandchildren, and great-great grandchildren.   She did not have any pre-death arrangements and no life insurance or funds put aside for end of life expenses. With this being said, the last thing that we want for the family to worry or deal with at this time is¬†any financial burdens.¬†The funds raised will go directly to Dianne‚Äôs final arrangement expenses.¬†  With her sudden death, we are asking for any support you can give to help cover her cremation/final arrangement costs. We understand that this time of year is hard for everyone with the holidays, but on behalf of Dianne, any assistance financially or service you can provide to honor her would be greatly appreciated.   We appreciate your thoughtfulness, support and prayers during this difficult time.

campaigns.title: Yetty nos necesita!!
campaigns.description: Les contare un poco sobre mi.  Mi nombre es Georgette, pero mi familia y amigos me conocen como Yetty. Yo y mi esposo Ricardo tenemos 3 maravillosos hijos, Fer, Gerry y Sofi. Recientemente recibimos una noticia que nos tomo por sorpresa y totalmente desprevenidos.¬†  El d√≠a 05 de Octubre, fui diagnosticada con C√°ncer de Am√≠gdalas (Tonsil Cancer). Los doctores indicaron que debo iniciar con quimioterapias de inmediato.       En este momento, mi esposo no cuenta con los recursos econ√≥micos suficientes para un tratamiento tan costoso, y lamentablemente yo no cuento con un SGMM que me cubra dicha enfermedad y tratamiento. Es por esto que nos vemos en la necesidad de pedir la ayuda de todos ustedes. Como todos saben el c√°ncer es una enfermedad agresiva y muy r√°pida. Por lo que el tratamiento es muy urgente.  Yo y mi familia estaremos eternamente agradecidos con todas las personas que nos puedan apoyar en esta causa, que por mucho ha sido la batalla mas grande que hayamos enfrentado. No importa cuan grande o peque√±a sea su aportaci√≥n, estar√°n en nuestros corazones el resto de nuestras vidas.

campaigns.title: JACOB STRONG
campaigns.description:
Updated July 2019*
 He relapsed and we continued this original go fund me from 2018.
We weren't able to reset amount but half the amount shown was raised the 1st time he fought and beat it. he is currently fighting a relapse.
see halfway down for more info on relapse.
Hi everyone, I am one of the room parents in Jacobs class and with the permission of his mother I am creating this account on her behalf.¬† Jacob is a 6 year old boy and kindergarten student at St. Maria Goretti School in Schiller Park, Illinois. Just days before his birthday on January 18, 2018 he became gravely ill and was absent from school. Shortly after his birthday, his physician sent Jacob to Lurie Children's Hospital in Chicago for further testing and it was discovered that he had cancer in his blood. The diagnosis was Childhood Leukemia. This was devastating to hear for Ms. Corona, Jacob's mom, as she is a single parent. Originally from Mexico, Ms. Corona came to this country to seek a better life. She has a wonderful son who she considers a blessing. She is naturally distraught at the prospect of having to take a leave of absence from work to provide round the clock care for Jacob. Her employer issued insurance will run out when the sick leave ends as the treatment for Jacob will take three (3) years. Ms. Corona is fearful that not having any income at the moment she will not be able to pay her rent and bills. Any donations you are able to contribute will be greatly appreciated. These donations will help her manage the expense of driving into downtown Chicago for his weekly treatments, purchase the medical supplies and prescription medicines that he needs, and make it possible for Ms. Corona to purchase groceries to keep up with the dietary needs of her son. Thank you for your prayers and donations. The road to recovery is long and the aggressive chemotherapy and blood transfusions are going to take their toll on little Jacob. But with your prayers and support, we hope to make it a little easier for the Corona Family to deal with the financial hardship they are beginning to endure. *******************
JULY 16 2019 JACOB HAS RELAPSED AND WE ARE STARTING HIS FUNDRAISING EFFORTS ALL OVER. UNFORTUNATELY THERE IS NO WAY TO RESET THE AMOUNT TO ZERO SO IT IS STILL SHOWING THE $5,400 WE THANKFULLY RAISED FOR THE FAMILY WITH HIS FIRST BATTLE BUT AS WE KNOW THE LIVING EXPENSES, PARKING EXPENSES, ETC. ENDURED THE 1ST TIME AROUND USED UP THE ENTIRE AMOUNT RAISED. WE DO APPRECIATE ANY AND ALL DONATIONS WE CAN RAISE FOR THIS SECOND BATTLE THE CORONA FAMILY IS ABOUT TO ENDURE. JACOB'S mom had to once again quit her Job after just returning a few months ago when he went into remission, however a few months back when Mrs.Corona was told he was in remission and his treatments would be less frequent and she got the OK to put him in Daycare she did and quickly returned to work! She is a very hardworking mom but unfortunately now that he has relapsed and is having weekly chemotherapy and weekly bloodwork and this is just the beginning of another much more aggressive treatment her priority is being at Jacob's side, so she had to resign from her job. The Unity In Community is supporting a fundraiser hosted by The American Legion for Jacob on 8/30/2019, you can find more information on his FB page and you can check for future event or other future fundraisers, it's Jacob Strong - Jacob Corona. We are extremely grateful to everyone for past and future donations! He is scheduled for his 3rd Chemotherapy treatment for the relapse on 8/19/2019.
Update March 2020
Jacob has continued with Chemotherapy, since the relapse he's done 3 different chemotherapies each bonemarrow biopsy shows they've helped but bot enough to where he qualifies for a bonemarrow transplant. 
The best and only option at this time is getting Stem cells from his original donor in Hope's to bring the cancer percentage down enough to qualify him for a transplant or wipe it out completely. Jacob is currently scheduled to start a 6 days chemotherapy treatment on March 11th to prepare him to receive the cells that his very amazing donor has agreed to give him. He is due to get the cells on March 17th. This is will be tough on Jacob but he is a resilient child and very strong we have faith that he will be ok.

campaigns.title: Maria (Concha) Corona
campaigns.description: ¬† ¬†Only the Best for the Gates of Heaven    ¬† ¬† When we lose a loved one, we are often left with the why questions. ¬†As well as the woulda, coulda, shoulda's. One might take solace in knowing that our dearly departed is with the lord and that others, who have preceded them in death, will be there to greet them. However, there is a special peace that comes with the notion that the Lord takes only the best first. Sometimes it might be true and others we simply only see the best. ¬†For those good memories, are what keeps the departed alive in our hearts. ¬†For, Maria Conception Corona, that notion is the absolute truth. ¬†    ¬† ¬† On Saturday morning, January 12, 2019, Concha, as family and friends called her, lost her life and everything that represented her and her memory to a tragic house fire. ¬†As the matriarch in her family, she leaves behind 4 children, 12 grandchildren and 3 great grandchildren.    ¬† ¬† We are reaching out to anyone who can help the family with funeral expenses. ¬†In addition, her husband and youngest son, Michael, who made it out of the fire are in need of basic items. ¬†The fire was so overwhelming, it consumed all they owned.    ¬† ¬† Mario and Michael Corona, wish only to have Concha back. ¬†On their behalf, we humbly ask that anyone who has any clothing, underwear, shoes, socks, jackets, new or used , would please donate, them. ¬†You may contact the person whom is responsible for your awareness of the situation or the family directly. ¬†Anna Corona at (480) 888-5629 or Roy Corona at (919) 423-0156.    ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†The irony? While the family only wants her back, without thought of material items, Concha, the nurturer that she was, would be¬†asking for help to take care of her family if she could. ¬†    When you leave a donation, you can leave a message for the family. This will help in their greeving process. Any donation is greatl appreciated.     -Thank you¬†   Solo lo mejor para las puertas del cielo  Cuando perdemos a un ser querido, nos queramos con el ¬øpor qu√©? As√≠ como lo habr√≠a, podr√≠a o deber√≠a haber echo. Uno puede sentirse aliviado al saber que nuestros queridos difuntos est√°n con el se√±or y otros que han fallecido y que quiz√°s est√©n all√≠ para saludarlos. Sin embargo, hay una paz especial que viene con la noci√≥n de que el Se√±or solo toma lo mejor primero. ¬†A veces puede ser verdad y otras solo vemos lo mejor, porque esos buenos recuerdos son lo que mantiene a alguien vivo en nuestros corazones. Para Maria Concepci√≥n Corona, es la verdad absoluta. Una matriarca en su familia,¬†tiene¬†4 hijos, 12 nietos y 3 bisnietos.  El s√°bado por la ma√±ana, 12 de enero de 2019, Concha, como la llamaban sus familiares y amigos, perdi√≥ la vida y todo lo que la representaba a ella y su memoria en un tr√°gico incendio en su casa.  Nos estamos acercando a cualquier persona que pueda ayudar a la familia no solo con los gastos del funeral, sino a su esposo y su hijo menor, quienes lograron salir del fuego, solo para encontrarse ansiosamente haciendo intentos peligrosos, para volver a entrar a la casa para salvar ¬†querida he‚Äôs posa y mama. campaigns.title: Jai's Gender Affirming Surgery
campaigns.description: My name is Jai Lola Corona and I'm a Transgender Mexican femme. I'm 33 years old and have suffered from gender dysphoria ever since I was 14 years old. I was always afraid of becoming who I felt inside because I live in a world that doesn't give visibility to people like me. Transgender women are constantly being harassed or killed for being different. Our current president wants to make trans people invisible by taking away our rights. We're living in a very tense gender climate.   I came out as transgender last year because I needed to live my truth. I suffer from depression and anxiety all because of gender. Unfortunately, I still have masculine features that prevent me from showing my true colors. When I'm in public spaces, I have the most anxiety about my gender and how people perceive me. Many times, I'm mistaken for a boy. These moments of anxiety are disabling and I often stay in bed fearing being misgendered in public.I've been on hormone replacement therapy for 6 months. This does not affect some features testosterone has done, so I'm stuck feeling gender dysphoria when I'm presenting femme in public.   I'm starting this campaign to fund a very life changing procedure called "facial feminization" as well as laser hair removal. This 10hr procedure will create softer feminine facial features, making my face recognizable feminine. The procedures are: rhinoplasty, trachea shave, brow lift, hairline lowering, brow bossing, jaw/chin contouring. These all might seem like cosmetic procedures, but this is meant to help my mental health around my gender presentation.   Many of you know I'm an independent hairstylist and have to pay rent for my chair on top of paying rent to live in my apartment. There's a 2 week recovery before I can get back to work. Part of the cost of this campaign will help me pay for my rent while I'm recovering from my surgeries.

campaigns.title: Dogs of Puerto Rico
campaigns.description: My birthday is coming up. April 20th, and if you know me, you know I don‚Äôt care to ever ask for birthday wishes or gifts from anybody, but this year I am. This year I am Kindly asking for donations to help save and rescue dogs of Puerto Rico. So if you‚Äôre thinking of buying me a coffee, taking me out for dinner, or buying me a little gift, I ask that you not. I urge you, instead, to make a donation to an angel sent from heaven to help the dogs of Puerto Rico in need. This angel is Nilsa Delgado. She is a dedicated, round the clock, rescuer. She is a police officer during the day and a guardian angel to these dogs at all times.¬†  Nilsa rescues abandoned, neglected and abused dogs. She funds their vet care and nurses them back to health with little to no donations or support. Nilsa then makes sure these dogs find their forever home either through private adoption or through shelters. This means that airfare must be also paid for.¬†  Nilsa has teamed up with various rescued throughout the USA to help homes for some of these dogs, some of these include New York Bully Crew, Almost Home Animal Rescue in NY, Lost Dog and Cat Rescue in Virginia, Blue Ridge Bull terrier Club in DE, and many more.¬†  I need your help.¬† I need you to support me in my effort to help Nilsa continue her vital work with these animals.¬† Will you help me improve the lives of countless homeless animals?¬† Will you please consider making a small donation. Lets make a difference together.  By the way if you are considering in getting a dog, Nilsa has many looking for homes, puppies, adults and seniors! I have attached a link to Nilsa‚Äôs Instagram where you may find many stories of rescued animals from running in the streets of Puerto Rico emaciated to the endless cuddles by their forever humans!¬†     Instagram: @Crayola_Lia_  You may also make a direct donation to Nilsa on:  PayPal: NilsaDelgado1120@Gmail.com  Amazon: www.Amazon.com/GP/registry/wishlist/3QU35Y5CDSFOB   Nilsa's Instagram: full of rescued dogs that need your help.

campaigns.description: Thank you for taking the time to visit our GoFundMe page!¬† I am a middle school history teacher at Cesar Chavez Academy in Corona, CA and director of the annual 8th grade Washington DC trip.¬† As you can imagine, this trip does come with some cost that is out of reach for some families.¬† My goal is to help about 30 kids make this trip more affordable.¬† This trip has been call "the best trip ever" and it really is.¬† To be able to walk through our nation's capitol, Gettysburg, Williamsburg, Charlottseville and Jamestown, students get to see how our history unfolded.¬† Please assist us in making this trip become a reality for several of my students.¬† Thank you!
