campaigns.title: Help my family through a  tough time
campaigns.description: Hey guys. So, if you haven't yet heard, my mother had a stroke a few days ago. This was her third stroke and the worst one yet. By the grace of God, she is still alive and able to move much of her body. She is currently in Cedar Crest Hospital in Allentown undergoing treatment and being monitored by the doctors as she heals. She is currently unable to talk and unable to mover her right arm. The doctors hope that these capabilities will come back in due time but they are unsure. They seem to think that she will be put in a rehab facility for quite some time following her discharge from the hospital. The road to recovery is going to be a long one and I pray that God supplies her with much strength and comfort.¬† On top of all of that, while she is in the hospital, the doctors are doing some tests to determine if she has uterine cancer. The symptoms that she is displaying are characteristic of it but there is nothing confirmed yet. I will keep you all updated as to the status of those tests.  My mother is one of the most important people in my life. She has sacrificed so much for me over the years and is one of the strongest people I know. I love her more than I can say and seeing her in this state has completely destroyed me for these past few days. My dad is struggling very much as well. We feel a huge void without her in the house. The most important thing we can ask for is prayer right now.  We are also having some pretty intense financial difficulties through this entire ordeal. My mom was the main one to take care of finances before she had her stroke and I did not realize just how far behind we were on a lot of bills. Before my mom went into the hospital, the bank was already threatening to foreclose on our house if we did not start catching up on payments. In addition, we are behind on many other bills including: electricity, water, and internet. I am working as much as I can while attending college full-time. I am applying for more part-time jobs and am hoping something comes through as well. My dad is also working but without my mom's income, it is going to be even harder to make ends meet now. We are also applying for government aid and disability for my mother but these will take time to get approved and to start coming in steadily. Anything you can give is helpful during this time of extreme difficulty for my family. Even if you can't give anything, I would very much appreciate sharing of the campaign and more than anything prayers. No matter what happens, I know God will provide for us and I trust Him to work everything out in the best way possible. Thank you to everyone who has already prayed, gave support, or even just listened while I break down. I cannot express how grateful I am for all of the friends and family I have during one of the hardest times in my life.

campaigns.title: Jose Rangel
campaigns.description: Dear family and friends,  As you all may know we suddenly lost someone very special and dear to our hearts. We lost a beloved Brother, Father, and the best Tio anyone can ask for. After much discussion with the family we have come to the conclusion that what he wanted the most was to be buried with his beloved mother (Jesse Ubina). My mother Marina and I are fortunate enough to be able to cover his cremation and viewing, but we are not able to cover the cost of burying him with his mother. Our family has had to grieve two losses within a week and has had to cover two funeral services. We are hoping with the help of our family and friends that we can lay my Tio to rest where he has so desperately wanted to be, with his mother. We are asking for any donations to help assist us in giving my Tio his final wishes and resting place . Our family would like to thank you in advance for all your support, well wishes and love that people have shown us.  With much love and gratitude,  The Rangel, Corona and Valenzuela family.

campaigns.title: Corona del Mar Best Buddies
campaigns.description: There is nothing more important than friendship. When I began my journey at Corona Del Mar High school it was difficult to find great friends who would be with me for the following four years. High school is tough.  But, these high school trials and tribulations are even more prevalent in individuals with an intellectual, developmental, or physical disability. Through our Best Buddies High school Friendship Program, we form one to one relationships that can help students with or without a disability make friendships to last a lifetime.   As I soon leave Best Buddies and High school behind with my many amazing friends by my side, I have a favor to ask of our community, friends, and family.   In order for our Club Chapter to continue under the Best Buddies organization we need to raise at least $500. This cost helps us to continue to be covered by all the resources the international organization offers, allows us to pay for activities and games for our meetings, and allows us to continue forming friendships at Corona Del Mar High School.   Any donation or other Newport Beach community partnerships would be extremely appreciated in helping us reach this goal!   Thank you!  Grace Dearmin  Corona Del Mar Best Buddies President

campaigns.title: In need of a Riding lawn mower
campaigns.description: We recently made a big move to Indiana after leaving the military.¬† Recently my third daughter, Madeline being born has made things tight financially. With Spring  approaching quickly we are in need of a riding lawn mower since we are renting a house with alot of land. We have been searching for a used lawn mower but have had no luck unfortunately. So here's a shot in the dark to see if I can get just a little bit of help in buying a new one.¬†

campaigns.title: Supporting Brandy and Parents
campaigns.description: Brandy Lino-Corona ¬† ¬† ¬†  On September 20th of 2018, driving back from my Rowan University I fell down a small hill near the blueberry farm in Hamilton Township. I thank God I only suffered a couple of bruises and a huge headache. It was truly a miracle I was able to climb out the car with no major injuries. At that moment the only thing I wanted to do was call my dad. The lady who helped me get out the vehicle lend me her cell phone. I did not know that making that one phone call would change our lives completely. While I was being taken to the hospital, I overheard on the ambulance radio that there were multiple collisions with people in critical condition near the location where my accident occurred. It never crossed my mind that my sister and father were involved in that accident. I found out hours later when my uncle arrived at the ER. My father and I made it out from our accidents with no major injuries, but my sister Brandy was hit the hardest during the impact. She suffered a severe traumatic brain injury. She was fighting for her life in the ICU. Brandy had to get multiple surgeries due to her brain constantly swelling. She is now considered a stable patient at an inpatient rehabilitation hospital. My sister who just turned sixteen in August and I share a wonderful sibling relationship. She is my best friend and my sunshine. Watching her in the condition she is in upsets everyone who knows her because there is not one day you do not see her with a big smile on her face, laughing and making jokes. We would always go for ice coffee runs and sing every day at home. We had made plans to visit her dream school, travel for winter break, go to prom, train for softball and so much more. The last thing I told her before leaving that morning was that I loved her and the last thing she texted me minutes before their accident was, ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt be scared. I love you..‚Äù My family and I have been trying to raise money to help my parents and sister with any expenses they have to make. Even though you don‚Äôt know my sister, I promise you that you would love to be around her. This will be a long journey for us but as a family, we are taking it day by day. Thank you for your support.

campaigns.title: NYC Chorale trip
campaigns.description: I‚Äôm raising money to be able to go to New York with my choir in April. Which is next month! And need help! Please donate! Even $5 will help! ‚ù§Ô∏è

campaigns.title: Tony Corona‚Äôs Funeral Arrangement
campaigns.description: We are saddened by the untimely death of Tony Corona our beloved son, brother , uncle and friend. A simple man who had a huge heart. ¬†He was devoted to his family especially his nieces and newphews.¬† Due to this tragedy it has left his parents with unexpected expenses.¬† Juan and Ana Lucia Corona will appreciate any donations and help with the proceedings.

campaigns.title: Loving Dad in need of help. Immigration  expenses.
campaigns.description: We have a family emergency due to something that happened on the 31st of March. Our dad was arrested for being involved in a car accident, now he's being held by Immigration, and unfortunately he's the breadwinner of the household so now we're faced with trying to pull together funds for his legal fees and trying to pay our bills and utilities. I'm not very familiar with this page or with fundraising things, but was pointed to it because well, we need the help. We've got no other way to pull this money together so every penny is appreciated.

campaigns.title: Fighting for Hiro and Brago
campaigns.description: Hello everyone, we started to love our kittens since the first day we saw them behind the glass wall of Petsmart. At the time they were only 5 months old, and even if we only wanted 1 kitten, we could not separate a brother from a sister, so we decided to take responsibility for the both of them. We named them  Hiro , the male and shy one, and  Brago , the female and playful one.¬†  We started to notice that these kittens had chronic diarrhea and puke, although we went numerous times to different vets they always said that they were healthy and since they are kitten it was normal and it would go away with time. We tried different medications, all of them very expensive, and we couldn't get insurance because they were sick from day 1. We tried contacting the place where we got them from, but they didnt help us, instead they blamed it in the rescue company they got the kittens from. We also called them, but again they blame it on somebody else. Nobody helped us, financially and emotionally.  Finally, after a couple of months, we saved some money and decided to do a more serious and complete check up. That's when we discovered that they both had 3 different rate viruses: - tritrichomonas foetus/blagburni¬†   -feline coronavirus   -C. Perfringens alpha toxin¬†   The vet himself couldn't believe it, and told us he has never seen all these disease in one cat at the same time. The feline coronavirus is a  very serious desease,  to explain in human terms it can be compared to cancer. The other 2 illness are rare and treatments are expensive.¬†  Unfortunately, we do not have the finances to support them, but we do love our kittens so much, they always sparkle our days. We want to give them justice, they haven't even been an year old yet, we want them to be healthy and to live a long happy life. They did not deserve the way they were treated from these institutions (which I will not name because we are tired of all the fights through phones and emails).¬†  Any sort of help will make a difference. I will thank each and every one of you till my days for your contribution. Thank you for taking time out of your day to read this. Let's fight this together for Hiro and Brago, who cant defend and speak for themselves, and so we'll do it.

campaigns.title: Family in sudden crisis; help a loving mother
campaigns.description: I write to you all today on behalf of my mother, Sandra. My hero, an extraordinary mother, wife, friend, and employee. I am starting a "GoFundMe" page to help her during this time of need. My mother was admitted to the hospital on Tuesday, April 30th, 2019 after enduring bouts of severe abdominal pain and fever. Upon admission, they gathered lab work, she underwent a pelvic ultrasound, a CT scan, and further examinations. The physicians at Banner Hospital were able to identify a ruptured cyst on her left ovary, a tubo-ovarian abscess of her left fallopian tube and further infection that had spread to her organs. They tried multiple strong antibiotics and a drain to help the infection, this failed to improve her condition. On Wednesday, May 1st, momma underwent surgery and had her left fallopian tube, left ovary and appendix removed. As I write this on the 5th of May, my mother remains in critical condition. The doctors suspect the infection is widespread and she will most likely need additional surgery. I plead that you all help us in our time of need. My mother and father, the breadwinners, are currently not working due to the nature of my mother's situation. Me, their eldest daughter, I am currently recovering from a recent Rottweiler attack to the face and my youngest sister is currently recovering from right hip surgery. We have had quite a tough few weeks. We just need the support of our friends, family and our community to get through this. My mother does have medical insurance, unfortunately, she has quite a large deductible. If we can raise this money, we would be able to cover her medical expenses and their lost wages for this week. We hope she will recover soon and I will update the page to keep you all posted. Thank you in advance for all of your help. All donations matter and are greatly appreciated.    We are a strong family unit and we just want to get past this and be able to return to our lives as normal.¬†  -Brenda Corona

His 8 Grandchildren were his world. We love him endlessly and may he rest in peace‚ù§Ô∏è¬†  Francisco pedro Corona (Padoo) April 2, 1959-May 5, 2019

We all know the path he took and the mistakes he made. I was so heartbroken that I had to let go. It was the single, most difficult decision I ever had to make in my life to walk away and let fate decide his future.  I can thankfully say today, three years later, that Shane has become the son that I can be proud of. He has held a steady job for the past three years and has led a clean and sober life. Every time I see him, the tears well up in my eyes at my pride in this young man.  The reason I‚Äôm writing this is that Shane is planning on getting married this July 22. It is not going to be an extravagant wedding, it will be held in the backyard of a family member, in the afternoon, after he‚Äôs done working.  It pains me that I‚Äôm not financially able to help out. I would so like to make this a special occasion for him. So, hat in hand, I‚Äôm beseeching friends and family to help out, whatever you can afford, be it one dollar, or some sort of decoration or such thing. I‚Äôm trying to do an island wedding and am working with what little funds I have.  I am doing a fundraising and the link is listed below. No hard feelings, whatever you can donate will be much appreciated.  Please¬† donate‚Ä¶thank you! And God Bless!

campaigns.title: Celebrating Janina Vera
campaigns.description: To all our loved ones,   On May 13th, surrounded by love and care, Janina took her last breath on earth and her first in eternity. She battled 10 years of Huntington‚Äôs Disease which attacked her brain and nervous system. Although we are sad to say goodbye, we know she is no longer suffering and is in the presence of her Heavenly Father. She leaves behind two sons, her oldest being Johnny (19 years old) and her youngest ¬†Joshua (8 years old). Janina valued family and most of all: faith. Through her long trial she had so much joy and peace, knowing who was carrying her. She never failed to bring laughter, love and life to others. She hugged you, even if you were a stranger, because she knew the importance of love. She would joke with you, always remembering her purple Cadillac and was always down to earth. Janina was given grace, was grateful, and therefore graceful.   As we put together a day to celebrate who God shaped Janina to be, from beginning to the end of her life, please support us with whatever you can. Donations will also be going to her two sons who will continue to be supported by our friends and family.

campaigns.title: Help For Baby Richie
campaigns.description: Hello, This is Richies story, he was born 7 weeks early. Mom went through California testing and everything seemed good with baby and no reason to worry besides a little fluid in his kidneys. Mom was monitored weekly and the issue seemed to be resolving itself.  When Richie was prematurely born, they told us the issue was still there along with 3 other defects. Since our baby had so many issues all together at once, they called in a geneticist and took blood samples. We were interrogated and asked a series of questions, after 3 weeks of emotional torture finally they had a result for us. The doctors said Richie has a very rare syndrome with only 300 cases reported in the world. By definition individuals with this rare syndrome have difficulty eating, so automatically all efforts to teach my premature baby to eat by the nurses were diminished. They put a tube in his nose and my son was barely given a chance. Doctors insisted that we would have to leave the NICU with a Gtube in order to successfully feed Richie.  After weeks of arguing with rude nurses and being there for our son, we proved to them that he didn‚Äôt need a tube in his stomach. We spent 7 weeks in an understaffed hospital with no bedside manner and gossipy nurses. They fed my baby cold breast milk and they also relied heavily on sugar water packets to calm down babies. It was a horrible experience and now my baby is suffering from all of it on top of the syndrome. He was repeatedly pricked on the hands and feet, he was around nurses and doctors who lost hope in him but he will prevail.  I know Richie will move mountains and I will help him along the way. I want to be able to get Richie the best help possible but my insurance unfortunately does not cover the physical therapy my son requires for his age along with other services he needs. We visit several specialists, he has started treatment for his surgery, we have several copays and medications and as much as I would like to be able to cover this myself it has become a little bit hard. We need help for Richies pediatric therapies and surgery but above all we need your prayers for our little boy. Thank you for time and support, any help we receive is greatly appreciated.

campaigns.title: Help Corona Beat Cancer!
campaigns.description:
UPDATE: 
 

 Yesterday I went to get Corona a check up at the oncologist, unfortunately I was given bad news...
 

 Coronas cancer has come back and progressed. Its been approximately 6.5 months post operation, and the news feels worse than the first time around...¬†
 

 After shaving her stomach (after all her hair finally grew back from the operation site), we found a large 5 cm growth on the lower part of her abdomen.
 

 I dont know what I should do next, the oncologist recommends that I switch to IV form of chemo (I have been doing oral for the last few months). However, this change of treatment comes with a much higher price tag. If you could, I hope you would consider donating even a little to help me cover the costs of changing over to the new treatment plan (per session it costs approximately $900). The oncologists believes that if we do this, there will be a great chance of slowing down or reducing the size of the cancer, and stopping its spread.¬†
 

 I hope you will considering helping support Corona through her battle with her transitional cell carcinoma cancer.¬†
 

 I thought that if the cancer came back that this time around it would be easier to face and deal with, but after so many months of feeling 'in the clear' (regardless of the complications that presented like kidney infections, troublesome UTI complications, etc) its hard to come to terms that I'll see her suffer and watch her health degrade aagain...¬†
 

 ¬†
 

 Thank you all for your continued support.    
 

 ¬†
 

  __________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________  ¬†  
 

  This is Corona, she is the love of my life.¬† 
 

 Corona is a 7-year-old¬†Chow Chow. She was diagnosed two weeks ago with¬† Transitional cell¬†carcinoma , which is a  bladder cancer . When I first heard of her diagnosis, my heart dropped. In my eyes, she was the healthiest dog in the world.   I wasn't¬†very optimistic at the time because after doing some reading online, I learned that this cancer is very aggressive and animals generally do not live very long... All vets I saw were convinced the tumor had diffused throughout the entire bladder, meaning it was one of the bad cases.
 

  Some GOOD NEWS  was given to me yesterday! After running some more tests, it turns out that what the doctors had thought, was not the case. Her tumor was in the "good area" and had not been diffused and is not located by the urethra.  Her tumor is in an area that makes surgery and removing possible!   However, my¬†oncologist said I have to move quickly and have the surgery within the next 2 weeks before the cancer¬†starts spreading to other organs, and her kidneys look like they'll be the next place it will spread to.¬†   This surgery is more complicated than other tumor removing surgeries because of the location within the bladder. The surgery alone is estimated to be within $4,000-$5,000 and chemotherapy is a must for after the surgery because of the aggressive nature of this type of cancer. Chemotherapy ends up being about $700 every 3 weeks.¬†
 

 I have come to GoFundMe in hopes that Corona will be able to have enough money to get her surgery. If I'm able to generate even a little funds to help me cover the bill, it will help me pick the best course of action for my girl.¬† The funds generated from this campaign would go towards Corona's tumor-removing surgery and chemotherapy treatments.¬†The doctors think Corona has a chance to beat this cancer, a chance that most dogs with this cancer don't¬†have!¬†
 

 Being a student has made it hard for me to cover all the costs associated with getting her the care she needs. Up until this point I've spent over $5,000 on costs incurred along the way to this diagnosis. The doctors initially thought she had a stubborn UTI. She was treated for 3 months, then they thought she had bladder stones (costing me $1,200 in surgery) to then find out it was cancer :( During this time, due to extreme discomfort she was experiencing, she broke her canine teeth biting at the wall, which resulted in having to do emergency dental work   getting root canals costing another $3,000 on top of the treatments and tests for what they thought was a UTI. Currently, I am extremely financially strained but I really want to do everything I can to make sure Corona will recover! She means so much to me and I made a commitment to her when I rescued her!  If you can help in ANY WAY it would mean so much to both of us! 
 

 If you don't know Corona, I want to share with you her story (well, Corona and I's love story).¬† My mother and I rescued Corona from a farm in Wisconsin, she had been chained up outside and left with a very little amount of food during the winter months. Luckily she's a chow chow and has a warm coat.¬†
 

 When we first met Corona she was WILD, she had become a scavenger and eating all the local's farm animals. Even though she was like this, the moment she and I met, we had a bond. She came right up to me and sat at my feet. I had never once in my life had an animal react to me like this before, the pets my family had growing up usually favorited someone else in my family. She didn't bark or growl at me as she did to the other people around.  That's when I knew I found the love of my life. ¬†
 

 It's been about 5 years since we first met,  she's gone from living wild on a farm in Wisconsin to moving to Canada and being a city girl in Montreal . There's no other way I can describe our relationship other than what I've said previously, that she's the love of my life and I believe¬†I am that to her as well.¬†  If you are able to help me out in any way (even with just advice or your experience if you've had a dog go through this cancer), any contribution is greatly appreciated!¬†¬†  If you are or have gone through cancer with a pet, I am so sorry. It's such a hard and confusing thing to go through.     Corona and her friend Sabrina!

campaigns.title: CSU T-shirt for RMC Auction
campaigns.description: Want to join me in making a difference? Colorado State University Meat Science Department is raising money to benefit student activities within the American Meat Science Association (AMSA), specifically to support the Education Foundation. Any donation will help make an impact!¬† AMSA is a leading agricultural organization that is involved in shaping the youth of today into the leaders of tomorrow.   This year, the shirt theme is "Pioneering the Way"; to support this, our shirt reflects the journey west that pioneers made to establish the state of Colorado and our land-grant institution, CSU. It is a reference to the popular computer game, Oregon Trail. For a donation of only $25 or more, you will receive a shirt as a thank-you gift for your contribution! Shirts will be available at the information booth on the Monfort Quad at CSU on Tuesday of RMC.  Thank you in advance for your contribution to this cause that means so much to myself, CSU and an industry that fights to provide a safe and healthy product from farm to table.       More information about American Meat Science Association: AMSA is a broad-reaching organization of individuals that develops and disseminates its collective food and animal science knowledge to provide meat science education and professional development. The AMSA Educational Foundation is a set of endowed funds within AMSA that are used to support educational programs and scholarships for students and scientists in meat science.

campaigns.title: Victims Of The Horrific Corona Costco Shooting
campaigns.description: On June 14th, 2019 our family‚Äôs life was forever changed. Uncle Russell, Auntie Paola and their eldest son Kenneth French made one of their regular trips to Costco to prepare for a Father‚Äôs Day BBQ at their home. Little did we know Kenneth was never going to spend another holiday with our family again. This is the most horrific tragedy of our lives. This doesn‚Äôt even feel real. This is the kind of thing you see in movies. Kenneth was unarmed and was shot multiple times and now he is gone forever. Paola and Russell were also shot and are in critical condition. They will have a long road to recovery. Please help us to support Uncle Russell, Auntie Paola, Kevin and more importantly our angel Kenneth. This tragedy has destroyed their lives. Thank you in advance for the well wishes.   The outpouring of love and support for our family is amazing.

campaigns.title: Keeping The Love Of My Life!

The morning of February 25, 2019 I started my morning like an other day not knowing the tragic news I'll be receiving hours later. Around 9 in the morning I received a call from my wife Maria with her totally broken down. She informed me that she had been detained by ICE. I clasped in tears not knowing what to do. We are now in June and I can gladly say I have her by my side.¬† The storm is not ever just yet we still have legal fees and long journey ahead of us to safely say she is staying with me forever.¬† I'm here today to ask for help to keep my wife and my future family together. I will appreciate it with all my heart any donation that comes forth. Thank you for having the time to read this and my God Bless you all.

campaigns.title: Seeds For Future Memories: Make It Rain $60k!
campaigns.description: Seeds For Future Memories: Make It Rain $60k!   #60KforCentro ¬†#MonstritxsALaObra   Right now is a crucial moment for Centro Corona, and we are calling on our people to support us in meeting our fundraising goal of $60,000 by June 20th, the minimum amount needed to cover our rent and the maintenance of our building for the full year. Centro Corona is a community center with a long history since 2011 in Corona, Queens, an intergenerational space that builds from the experience, leadership, and knowledge of working-class and immigrant communities to build a self-determined, collectively-imagined future. In late 2018, unexpectedly we lost our first home base for eight years. In December 2018 we were able to relocate to a lovely new building that is quickly becoming home. Our monthly rent jumped from $1800 a month to $3800, and we need your support to keep our space.   Share our fundraiser and encourage your folks to donate something. Doesn‚Äôt matter the amount, as long as they donate.  ‚òÜ YOU CAN READ MORE ABOUT THIS CAMPAIGN AND OUR WORK BELOW ‚òÜ  ***  Seeds For Future Memories: Make It Rain $60k!   #60KforCentro ¬†#MonstritxsALaObra   Frequencies. Transmissions.  They said ‚Äúancestors, listen.‚Äù, and they were talking to us. Lighting candles. ‚ÄòTaita, Mama, we are your wildest dream‚Äô we heard them say. They spoke with lights. ‚ÄúWe have abandoned cages. No borders, the land is back in our hands, breathing. The people are resting, and allowed.‚Äù  Affirmations. We are building the path, and bringing them into existence. We feel it, resonating within our bones.  Affirmations. We are sowing them. Into existence.  Frequencies. Transmissions. Messages from a liberated future.   Do you feel these messages too?  We are calling on our people who felt it and have witnessed it. Who witnessed how sharing a space, groundless and precarious, can begin to be enough for conversations to happen, for answers to arrive, and for future memories to foment. If you felt them too, then you have witnessed what can happen when people share a place with purpose. When we are in community with each other, we begin to take things back. We begin to give to each other. We create, lead, and defend. We transform ways of justice and solidarity that can be replicated in more homes, in more neighborhoods. We sow seeds for a liberated future. Our descendents are speaking to us, and we are listening.  If you heard these messages too, we are calling on your help now, to build and sustain Centro Corona for the long haul, autonomously. The work that we do often does not align with funding mandates. This does not concern us. We know that to continue our work, we must rely on the people who love Centro the most, who will feel these transmissions from the future and recognize their own voices, just as they imagined they could be.    Where are they coming from?  We believe they are coming from Corona, many generations from now. The voices of our children‚Äôs grandchildren, who are now leading the healing, and sustaining the earth. Perhaps, in this very same building.  The messages are from those who have carried on the work that is already happening today. Our community-led work from the past 8 years: education justice, homework help and la Monstrita Justiciera; gender justice and Soy Yo: Sex Ed Camp for Families; community defense and political theater production ‚ÄúPor la Justicia y los Sorbetes.‚Äù Our work that centers key practices and methodologies using arts and culture, popular education, accompaniment, generational leadership development, and creates intergenerational and bilingual spaces for collective decision and art-making. The messages are from futures we have begun growing, from seeds that have already been planted, and we must continue to grow fiercely.     Why are we receiving them now?  This is a crucial moment for Centro. In late 2018, we lost the space that made so much of this work possible. With immense challenge, in December we were able to relocate to a lovely new building that is quickly becoming home. Yet we are met with the realities of how the land is treated as a commodity, as our monthly rent jumped from $1800 a month to $3800, with a $7,200 deposit on our new lease. Our neighborhood is being gentrified, and the people and places that make our community beautiful are being forced out. Today, we are about to sign a lease to remain in our neighborhood, and soon to become an independent organization. However, as we stand right now, we do not have the funds to stay past 3 or 4 months. ¬†  At Centro Corona we have made a community where lives of creativity and independence can be lived with joy. For eight years we have confronted the cultural and economic oppression facing working-class and immigrant communities. For eight years we have created safe spaces within our neighborhoods for people to rehearse a liberated future. We have turned violence into art, education, activism and, over time, slowly yet crucially, liberation. ¬†  We are made to believe that our future is uncertain, but we heard them speak to us. We feel new frequencies resonating inside us. They are transmissions from our liberated future, sometimes vivid, and sometimes faded, never gone, but never complete, the voices strange, yet familiar. They have never been stronger than they are now. It is up to us to make them true.    How do we honor them?  We accept their messages, and believe they are real. We accept their affirmations that we are working towards freedom, so we start sowing freedom now. Our struggles now bring great opportunity to stabilize Centro, in this place, as a permanent part of our future.  We decided on a raising goal of $60,000, because it is the minimum amount needed for rent and maintenance of our building for the next year. We chose to do this large amount via people‚Äôs fundraising, because it will support our agency to continue to create spaces of collective decision-making and action-taking with autonomy. We are committed to maintaining a space that is free and accessible by and for our people.  If you witnessed and believe in this future, help us materialize all this into reality now, by supporting this people-organized campaign. We have taught each other how to get to this point, and have had lots of community advice and support. We hold no degrees on fundraising, but we hold a trust in our people who will helps us get there!   We need your support! Email your friends, make sure they donate something. Anything, as long as they donate. Share widely. Ask us about how to become a monthly sustainer. Ask us about one-time large donations. Share knowledge with us. Support our self-taught processes, all very DIC type of work (Do it in Community). Invest in our future memories!   ###  Centro Corona is an intergenerational community center that builds from the experience, leadership, and knowledge of working-class and immigrant communities from Corona and nearby Queens neighborhoods to build a self-determined, collectively-imagined future. We see our community organizing work as a living, ongoing process of building leadership and re-imagining what organizing could be: deeply intimate, emergent, organic and relational organizing grounded in arts and culture. DRUM (Desis Rising Up and Moving) is our fiscal sponsor.

campaigns.title: Ayuda para Ayde
campaigns.description: Hola mi nombre es Ayde, tengo 42 a√±os soy madre de 2 hijos y la mayor de una familia de 3 hermanas. Hace 9 a√±os fui diagnosticada por primera vez con cancer de seno, pase por quimioterapia, ¬†radioterapia y mastectomia radical de mama; ahora me encuentro con la sorpresa de que nuevamente se encuentra en mi cuerpo cancer pero ahora en el pulmon. Sinceramente y con el corazon en la mano no pregunto a Dios, porque? Sino para que? Que se me esta olvidando aprender? Que estoy dejando de hacer? Pues solo quiero ver crecer a mis hijos y poder ver envejecer a mis padres y ayudarles en esa etapa de su vida acaso es mucho pedir, no quiero dinero, lujos, joyas no, solo quiero tiempo, solo tiempo Dios.Pues cada dia que amanece lucho, amo, admiro y suspiro por un poco de salud para poder hacer y tener sue√±os para poder vivir para alcanzarlos, cada dia abrazo la vida como los arboles extienden sus ramas tratando de alcanzar el sol, solo tengo ¬†esperanza y fe de poder lograrlo pero creo que mis fuerzas no me van alcanzar. No estoy derrotada estoy mas viva que nunca y el cancer me ha ense√±ado que las cosas y sucesos malos tambien tienen cosas buenas y ense√±anzas de vida. Me falta mucho como a todos por lograr pero primero Dios y solo el sabra. Les doy infinitas gracias por su apoyo y pido mil bendiciones que dios les de mas y les multiplique. Attentamente Su amiga Ayde  Hello my name is Ayde and I am 42 years old. I am a mother of 2 amazing kids and part of a loving family of 3 sisters. 9 years ago I was diagnosed with breast cancer for the first time. I went through all available treatments like chemo and a full mastectomy. Now, I find myself in this situation again but this time the cancer has developed in my lungs.¬†  I sincerely and and with all the pain in heart ask God why? Why me again? What do I need to learn? What am I doing wrong? I just want to serve you and watch my kids grow up, is this too much to ask for? I don't need money or luxuries I just want time.¬† Every day when I wake up I fight, I love and I pray for health to live and reach my dreams of being with my kids, to hug, kiss and hear them laugh. I just want the opportunity to do so, I will fight and endure what is necessary to beat this disease.¬† My doctors are not giving me much hope and tell me that the process is very costly and painful but I refuse to give up hope.¬†I have not¬† given up and I am more determined then ever to survive. If there is one thing I have learned that for every bad thing that happens something good comes and there is always something to learn from the experience. I put my faith in God and I will not lose hope until my last breath. I thank you in advance and ask God bless you for your attention and any help you can give! My family and I will always be in your debt and you will be in our prayers. Sincerely, Ayde.

One that ended his young life far too short.¬†¬†  This go fund me is to raise the funds needed to properly honour and commemorate AJ. The life he lived and all the lives he touched with his kind heart. Anything you can donate for AJ's funeral is greatly appreciated.  All funds will be directed to Angela Companioni Chirono for funeral/memorial expenses. Mother of Adan Jose Corona. We thank you for your donations and sharing this GoFundMe with your friends and family.  Rest in peace Adan Jose Corona.

campaigns.title: Judy Corona
campaigns.description: In May of this year, Judy Corona was diagnosed with CUP ‚Äì Cancer of Unknown Primary. This is a rare condition in which cancer cells are found in the body but, the place of the cancer began is not known. The Primary Cancer can spread to other parts of the body. This type of cancer is terminal. At the time of her diagnosis, she was informed that the cancer had spread to Pancreas, Liver, Stomach and Hip.   Unfortunately, there is no specific treatment that can treat this type of Cancer. Since her diagnose, she has been hospitalizing several time for various medical conditions. Recently, Judy was re-admitted due to stroke (brain) and is under observation.  With this medical condition, Judy had to discontinue her work and is now bed-ridden. This condition has forced Judy to be provided with a Nurse by her at all times. Those of you that know Judy, she is a strong woman but she is now in the fight of her life. She has such a positive attitude even with the diagnosis she faces. Please keep her in your prayers.  Judy does have immediate family to take care of her; however, she is fighting this battle all by herself and needs support from friends and family. That alone is difficult, but this will also create a financial hardship. I am hoping that we can provide a little support by trying to get her a private care and help her with the medical expenses that are not covered. With Judy‚Äôs determination and our help, we should be able to kicking cancer's butt and getting her healthy again.  The money will go directly to Judy to help with her medical expenses and basic needs as she is no longer working. Please consider donating if you are able to, every bit helps.  We thank you in advance for your donation. Your thoughts, prayers and donations are truly appreciated.

campaigns.title: Christina's All-American Rome Tour
campaigns.description: Hello Family, Friends, and Supporters,  My name is Christina Corona. This upcoming 2019-2020 school year I will be a Senior at Vintage High School. It will also be my 4th year on the Vintage High School Cheer and Dance Team. While at Vintage High School I have managed to be apart of the Cheer and Dance Team, keep a 4.0 G.P.A, and participate in numerous school activities.   This¬†past weekend my team and I were fortunate enough to attend a 3 day NDA dance camp in Rocklin, CA. At camp I was nominated and selected to be on the All-American team. With this selection I was also invited to perform in a New years day parade in Rome, Italy! I am more than grateful to have been given this opportunity and would love to be able to attend.¬†  Since I was little girl I have always loved to dance. It all started when I was 5 years old dancing tap at Pepperettes Baton and Dance Club. This sparked a fire in me, a passion. Tap drew to me joining a Ballet Folklorico dance club at my elementary school, Napa Valley Language Academy. I was involved in the dance club from Kindergarten all the way to the Fifth grade and I can definitely say It kept my feet moving. I would have practices after school and perform at different school events. This only made my passion for dance grow stronger. ¬†After dancing for a few years, I decided to try my luck with gymnastics at The Gymnastic Zone in Napa. And let me say, this changed everything for me. I realized I not only wanted to dance but I also wanted to have gymnastics play a role in the way I danced.   My mom finally realized how much I enjoyed dancing and gymnastics and decided to look into cheerleading. She signed me up to join The Napa Raiders Football and Cheer Youth Club, and this is the best thing my mom has ever done for me. I will admit at first I was quite nervous, I had never done cheerleading or even tried to mix both dancing and gymnastics. But after practicing everyday after school, having games on Saturdays in the scorching sun and competing on a stage in front of hundreds of people, I realized I had fallen in love with the sport of cheerleading. I continued this journey with being apart of The Napa Bears and The Napa Valley Jets cheer teams. In total I was apart of youth cheerleading for 5-6 years and knew for a fact I wanted to continue this passion in high school.¬†  I had always looked at the Vintage Cheer and Dance team as a dream. I knew one day I would be given the chance to try-out but didn't have much confidence in myself. ¬†When my freshman year finally rolled around I was overwhelmed with jitters and excitement. I stepped into the try-out barely knowing anyone or what to expect. I gave it my everything on all 3 days of try-outs. On the last day we were to find out who was going to make the team. I can still remember all the emotions of knowing wether or not I had a chance. My phone had rigged later that day, that the coaches had just posted the list of the 2016-2017 team. ¬†I opened the page to see my name! I was beyond happy that my dream of being on this team was finally coming true. Since then I have loved my experience. This team has opened many doors for me, taught me many things and helped me create lifelong friendships. ¬† This trip to Rome is something I could have never imagined to be offered to me and it is a once in a lifetime opportunity. With that said, it also carries a large cost to attend. Which is why I am reaching out to everyone I can for the help. I love what I am doing with cheerleading and dance and would be more than fortunate to be able to represent not only my team but my town outside of the U.S. .  Thank you to anyone and everyone who donates, I am so appreciative for everything I am given and hope to snap a couple selfies in the historic streets of Rome, Italy!  XOXO, Christina Corona

campaigns.title: Marta Corona
campaigns.description: En septiembre de 2018 diagnosticar√≥n a mi mam√° con Cancer de H√≠gado y Pancre√°s iniciando su primer tratamiento de quimioterapia el 26 de diciembre de 2018 el c√∫al consisti√≥ de tres d√≠as de tratamiento. Desp√∫es de 9 meses y 12 tratamientos nos dan la mala noticia que el cancer se acostumbr√≥ al medicamento y el resultado fue que no hab√≠a surtido ning√∫n efecto causando que el cancer se esparciera a su costilla. ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†¬†¬†¬†  ¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Desp√∫es,¬† empez√≥ con los tratamientos de radiaci√≥n por 2 semanas causando que su h√≠gado y pancre√°s se inflamaran y que a su vez el cancer se esparciera hacia su matriz y pulmones. A√∫n con este diagnostico mi madre es una guerrera y quiere seguir luchando; esta semana estaremos llev√°ndola a el hospital MD Anderson en la ciudad de Houston, Texas; en donde estan los mejores doctores especializados en cancer. ¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Los costos de los tratamientos han sido muy altos y el costo de ir a Houston es a√∫n m√°s, es por eso que pedimos ayuda con lo que ustedes nos puedan ayudar a seguir luchando por la vida de mi mam√°.¬† De antemano gracias a todos, sabemos que Dios est√° con ella y creyendo lo que no vemos como si fuese sanidad total sobre su cuerpo.¬†¬†  ¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Bendiciones,¬† Familia Corona.   ¬†¬†¬†¬† In September 2019 my mom got diagnosed with Liver and Pancreas Cancer. Her first Chemo began December 26, 2018 consisting in 3 days of treatment.¬† After 9 months and 12 treatments the Doctor gives us the bad news that the cancer became accustomed to the treatment and it had no positive effect, causing the cancer to spread to her rib. After that she begins with radiation for 2 weeks causing her liver and pancreas to become inflamed, furthermore spreading to her uterus and her lungs. Even though she‚Äôs had bad diagnostics, my mom is a warrior and she really wants to keep fighting. This week we will be taking my mom to MD Anderson Hospital in Houston, Tx where they have the best cancer doctors. The cost of the treatments have been high and the cost to go to Houston will be even higher, which is why I‚Äôm asking for help. Any help you can give to my mom to¬† keep on fighting. Thank you, beforehand!! We know that God is with her ‚Äúthe God who gives life to the dead and calls into being things that were not.‚Äù Blessings, Corona Family

campaigns.title: For Robin Graham
campaigns.description: Help for Robin Graham's Family   As many of you know, our very good friend, Robin Graham, has been going through a very difficult time.¬† On July 13, 2019 Robin‚Äôs former daughter-in-law, Aubree Corona, went missing on a camping trip with her children (Colin age 7 and Charlotte age 3) and friends in Wyoming.¬† She left the campsite to run a few errands, but on her way back, sent text messages that she was lost.¬† She never returned to the campsite.¬† ¬†  The children went to stay with their father (Robin‚Äôs son Scott) while a massive search was launched by friends and family to find Aubree after the Sheriff called off the official search after 3 days.¬† Robin travelled from her home in Montana to assist in the search and watch the children.¬†   If that weren‚Äôt enough, on August 12, 2019, Scott was arrested on charges he vehemently denies.¬† Robin again traveled to Wyoming to take care of the children at Scott‚Äôs request.¬† But no sooner had Scott been arrested than estranged members of Aubree‚Äôs family made a play to obtain temporary guardianship of the children despite Scott‚Äôs instructions that he wanted Robin to take custody of the children in his absence.¬†   On August 18, 2019 Aubree‚Äôs disabled truck was found on an untraveled road in a remote area about 25 miles from the campsite at the same time a judge was awarding guardianship of Aubree and Scott‚Äôs children to her brother.¬† Two days later, Aubree‚Äôs body was found about a mile from where her truck was found.¬† The cause of Aubree‚Äôs death will not be released until an autopsy has been completed and may never be known for certain.¬†   The whole experience has been devastating to Robin both emotionally and financially and she now needs our help to get her family back.¬† Robin remains in Wyoming trying to get her son out of jail in time for Aubree‚Äôs funeral and clearing the charges against him, while fighting for custody of Colin and Charlotte.¬† Scott‚Äôs bond alone is $5,000 and the family lawyer she spoke to requires a $4,000 retainer to represent her and/or Scott in a child custody case.¬† If Scott remains in jail, additional funds will be needed for the children‚Äôs care.¬†   We are setting an initial goal of $10,000 to cover bail, legal fees and some of Robin‚Äôs expenses while she‚Äôs in Wyoming.¬†  Robin has been a true friend to so many of us. ¬†We‚Äôre asking your help her in her time of need.¬† If you can spare a few dollars, it would mean a lot.¬† Robin has been reluctant to ask for money for herself, but has authorized us to start this GoFundMe on her behalf. ¬†All funds received will be delivered directly to Robin.

campaigns.title: Abundance Farm
campaigns.description: By understanding the wisdom of Nature, we can heal the earth, and in doing so, we heal ourselves.  ¬† We are Alejandro Corona (Alex) and Audrey Thomas (Kali). Our passion for the environment and farming has led us to establish Farming for Abundance, an initiative whose mission is¬†to accelerate the transition towards regenerative agroforestry. We believe we can heal the earth through smart ecological farming practices.  In 2015, we started Abundance Farm in Raglan, Victoria, Australia. We are in the process of turning 97 acres of weathered sheep pasture into a diverse, chemical free and regenerative farm using agroforestry and mixed animal systems. This has been the biggest adventure of our lives.   Kali and Alex storing hay for the cows, with the help of Shanti and the cheeky chooks (Photo by Beatriz Corona)  ¬†   What we've accomplished in the past three and a half years   So far, we have fenced and planted a forest along the creeks and boundary areas. We also removed old fencing that was a risk of injury to wildlife.  With volunteers and friends‚Äô help, we planted 3500 native trees and shrubs that will provide wildlife refuge, improve the waterways and reverse erosion. ¬† Alex and Kali planting trees in 2016   We are grazing a small flock of laying hens on pasture. They live in mobile houses with lots of space to roam.   They eat vegetables that were rejected due to their shape or colour. By diverting them from landfill, we avoid the methane pollution it would create. We also cook and ferment grains, herbs, spices and minerals to keep our hens healthy and happy so they can provide people with delicious and healthy eggs.   The chooks upcycling unwanted pumpkins (Photo by Alejandro Corona)   We started grazing a small herd of Angus cattle as well, which we move regularly with the principles of rotational grazing. The cows eat the tall grass promoting the growth of fresh green grass for the hens, as well as providing them with fresh and yummy cow patties that the hens scratch and spread looking for insects, mycelium and undigested grass seeds‚Ä¶  We have recently started providing beef that is ethical and regenerative as an alternative for conscious omnivores.  Our rotational grazing mixed animal system helps maintain the pastures and forest healthy by cycling organic matter which feeds the soil micro-organisms and sequesters carbon. ¬† Our complementary animal system:¬†cows and chickens roaming the land¬† (Photo¬† by Marianne Khol)  ¬† We have been working on drought proofing the farm as much as possible by investing in small dams, rain water tanks and pipes that reach the whole farm.  We have also applied regenerative earthworks that increase water infiltration in the soil and stop erosion.   One of the little dams that we built as part of our orchard system,¬† enjoyed by farm and wild animals alike. (Photo by Kali)  ¬† We have planted an apple orchard that is maintained and fertilised by geese and ducks. We wish to extend the orchard throughout the farm with various other fruit trees to provide people with healthy fruit from many rare heritage varieties.   We've planted more than 80 apple trees from 18 heritage varieties (Photo by Kali)   And we are just getting started‚Ä¶     The next step   We are currently building facilities comprised of two shipping containers and a shed which will allow us to wash and pack eggs, fruits and vegetables and store them with refrigeration.  The shed will help us more efficiently organise the farm resources and divert valuable food waste from landfill. The facilities will provide a space that can serve as a resource hub and empower other farmers in the western districts of Victoria. ¬† Kali packing eggs in the 'work-in-progress' shipping container facility (Photo by Alejandro Corona) ¬†  We are planning on increasing the size of our flock of hens in a very near future, so we can provide more eggs.  We are confident that we will achieve all our goals with hard work and thoughtful planning, but with your help it would accelerate our project and allow us to have a greater impact, faster.   One of our hens enjoying her mobile home (Photo by Sofie Holt) ¬†    What we need to achieve our goals   We are asking for your help to advance our project and inspire others in our region and the rest of the world.  Here is what we need:  1. If we raise 6,000 AUD, we can afford to build our own mobile brooding facilities. Brooding our own hens will allow us to:  ¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Raise healthy chickens on pasture from the day they are born ¬∑¬† ¬† ¬† Increase our free range layer flock so we can be profitable ¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Breed heritage dual-purpose poultry  2. If we raise 30,000 AUD, we can also afford one more mobile free range house for 500 hens. This will increase our income and achieve financial viability for our project.  3. If we raise 39,500 AUD, we can also finish the farm facilities. This will allow us to:   ¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Pack and distribute farm produce and eggs more efficiently ¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Manage farm resources ¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Upcycle more food waste ¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Offer our facilities and resources to help other regenerative farms  4. If we raise 57,500 AUD, we can also afford a solar system to operate our facilities off grid and limit the use of a generator to a backup situation only.  ¬† Summary:  1. Mobile brooding house for raising 500 hens: $ 6,000  2. Mobile chicken house for 500 laying hens: $ 24,000  3. Shed roof, refrigeration and permits: $ 9,500  4. Solar panel array 7.28kv, batteries, inverter and generator: $ 18,000  Total needed: $ 57,500 ¬†   With your help we can have more happy and healthy hens roaming our land¬† (Photo by Sofie Holt)     Come have a taste of the farm   If you are a farm supporter of $150 or more, you will receive a full Abundance Farm experience with a guided tour where you will have the opportunity to meet our feathered and furry friends and learn about regenerative agriculture.  Join us and other farm supporters while we enjoy a feast made with local and farm produce, as well as home made pizzas. ¬†We will watch the sun set behind scenic Mount Cole while we enthusiastically taste our 2017 Shiraz wine, made with local organic grapes cared for and picked by us.  There will be many dates available on Saturdays. You are also welcome to spend the night camping on the farm BYO. There is also the option to book luxury accommodation at Mount Cole Cottages, which is only few kilometres away from the farm.  If you are unable to come to the farm, we can arrange to deliver a farm gift pack within our delivery areas.   If you donate $100 or more, you will receive a farm calendar and a t-shirt*.  If you donate $60 or more, you can choose between a farm Calendar or a t-shirt*.  If you donate $30 or more, we will plant and dedicate a tree in your honour.   There are many challenges faced by small scale farming. With your help, we can achieve our goals and make a difference in the way we think about our food systems. Thank you for taking the time to read and share.  ‚ÄúThe time has come to reclaim the stolen harvest and celebrate the growing and giving of good food as the highest gift and the most revolutionary act.‚Äù  Vandana Shiva    *for international or interstate orders, postage fees may apply.

campaigns.title: Corona's Heart Surgery
campaigns.description: My baby girl was born with a rare heart condition called mitral valve stenosis, which is a type of heart defect. Although she has been able to tolerate it most her life, defect recently started showing signs, which led us to the discovery of it. Because of her heart dealing with this all her life, it caused her heart to become enlarged and unable to function properly. This also lead to a really rapid heart rate, called atrial fibrillation. So now she is suffering from congestive heart failure and is in need of surgery to improve her health. Without the surgery, she will only have about a month; however, the surgery would enable her to live a longer, comfortable life so she can keep receiving all the love and attention she deserves

campaigns.title: Hilltop Middle School Robotics & Wood Shop
campaigns.description: I keep seeing that the workforce in the trades is dwindling. Being someone that has worked my entire career in building materials this saddens me. I know so many great carpenters, woodworkers, cabinet makers, plumbers, electricians, etc. I'm sure most of them got their start in middle school woodshop, metal shop, auto class. My son Lucas is currently in a robotics class at Hilltop Middle School. It's taught by Ms Young who also teaches woodshop at the school.¬† I met with her this week to discuss some tool donations from my work. In talking to her she explained that she doesn't know if she'll have enough lumber, safety glasses, ear plugs, consumables (sandpaper, drill bits, saw blades) etc. She purchases what she can out of her own pocket and relies on donations for what she can't buy on her own.¬† I thought to myself, "I wish I could do more" Well, alone I can't but together we can. I decided to reach out to my friends and connections to pull together and help this program. I'm not asking for a lot, a couple of bucks from a lot of people adds up quick. Let help these kids develop a love for working with their hands. Any amount is appreciated.

campaigns.title: Dog Attack Medical Bills + Reconstructive Surgery
campaigns.description: I was attacked by a dog a little under 3 months ago. The dog bit me, completely unprovoked, and tore off a portion of my top lip and my nose. I had to rush to the emergency room to reattach the lip to my face and got stitches on my nose as well.   I now need help paying for the medical bills as the owners of the dog have ignored my messages asking them to cover the medical costs. Along with stitches, I had to get a series of post-exposure rabies shots as the owner had told the doctors that the dog had all of its shots, but I soon came to find out that the dog had not been up to date on his rabies shots. Unfortunately I am not able to pursue a legal case at this time, as the owners do not have insurance.   My medical bills are slightly less than $3000 but I am hoping to get reconstructive surgery in the near future. I am not looking for sympathy, and publicly asking for money is not something I am proud of. This attack has caused me intense emotional trauma and has negatively impacted my mental health, but I am slowly coming to terms with things. I would appreciate any help you may be able to contribute, whether it be emotional, monetary, or just by simply sharing this post, and I wish you all a great day.   Thank you!

campaigns.title: Community Recycling trailer
campaigns.description: Guffey is a small community that is located in the heart of Colorado and its members are passionate about recycling and reuse, and being responsible humans on our planet. Unfortunately no waste company will bring recycling dumpsters to our community because we are so far out and the surrounding communities (25+ miles) will charge for dropping of recycling goods.¬†  We have found a recycling facility that does not charge for the drop off of materials (approximately 35 miles), and have some people willing to drive to that facility but we need a trailer for separated items for the recycling. We have found a trailer ($4250) that will allow residents to drop recycling materials at a single location 24/7, and will allow us to take these materials to the recycling facility. The trailer for sale is in another state on a for sale site from a truck company and there is major interest in it. We are putting a deposit on it to hold it for us, but they will only hold it for a few weeks and are offering to deliver the trailer to Denver CO (about 2 hrs away) for an additional $500. We would like to get the trailer by the end of September 2019.  We are wanting to create this program for our community, as well as wanting to get our local community charter school (40 students) involved in recycling since they are the future of this planet and we ALL need to do what we can to help it.

campaigns.title: Send Me to Australia!
campaigns.description:
Hi, my name is Blaine. I am a senior in High School, working on becoming a Firefighter. I would love the opportunity to go to Australia for a semester in the spring of 2020. 

Ever since I was a little kid I had always wanted to go abroad and of course, Australia has always been at the top of my list. I would like to shadow and intern at the Sydney Fire Department to gain on the job experience. Plus, how cool would it be to say that I fought the fire down under? 

When I am there, the first things that I would like to see are the Great Barrier Reef, the Great Ocean Road, and The Sydney Opera House. 

I am planning to go through the CIEE Foreign Exchange program and the trip fees will cost around 13,750 USD. The application is due on the 15th of October, and my school district has agreed to potentially make up the difference for the amount that I will still need afterwards. 

Overall, I have been planning this semester trip for a long time and I cannot wait for it to become a reality. Thank you to everyone helping me make my dreams come true! 

- Blaine

campaigns.title: Single Mom, Domestic Violence Victim Starting Over
campaigns.description: I am raising money for my friend who is a single mother and recently escaped a domestic violence relationship. Both her and her daughter have gone through an extremely traumatic past few months. Scars that will unfortunately last forever. For obvious reasons, I am keeping her name and image private. I am asking for a small donation that will go a long way in rebuilding her life brick by brick.  I've helped as much as I am financially capable of. They literally left with the clothes on their back, a carry on bag and her daughters blanket.¬† She is currently staying with a friend and actively looking for employment. However, the basic costs of relocating, obtaining a new state ID (required to enroll her daughter in school), food, public transportation fees to seek employment, etc. quickly adds up.¬† She also needs to protect her identity due to the severity of the situation, hence, applying for a name change is on her short list.  The funds will be used for the following: $65 for new state ID (required to enroll her daughter in school) $100 will go towards a new interview outfit $200 will go towards new work clothes $200 will go toward more school schools and new shoes for her daughter $200 will go towards food for 1 month Remaining funds will be saved for emergency funding until she secures employment.  She does not know I have up this Go Fund Me, as I would like to surprise her but I know she will be extremely grateful for the help she receives.¬† She is very frugal and I'm confident she will be a good steward of the financial help she receives. This is my first time trying a crowdfunding platform and am hopeful this story will reach someone's heart.  Thank you for taking the time to read my Go Fund Me story.

campaigns.title: Single Father in need
campaigns.description: I've recently gained custody of my two sons. Their mother became homeless and is need of severe mental and dental help. I have been caring for our boys since she is not mentally stable to do so. I work full time, but cannot keep up with the bills not just to my rent, food, gas, clothing, and lawyer, but now to my own medical condition worsening. In my attempts to keep my children safe, fed, housed and well educated, I have been enduring nerve damage to my right eye and BPPV(vertigo) in the right side of my head. I am in constant pain all day. I work as a subcontractor for the navy, as I was enlisted from 2005 to 2009. I cannot get VA assistance because of my OTH discharge. I served four years but have not been able to overturn my discharge after testing positive THC. Right before I was about to be processed out my late uncle passed away and I was grieving at the time I self medicated. I was placed on restriction during a garbage disposal curtailment. The nightshift left me too tired to meet the restriction muster demands, which left me in the brig for three days with only bread and water. Ultimately I sacrificed my leave time, GI Bill, discharge of service and peace of mind. I am still in the process of getting my discharge upgraded. The VA is reluctantly helping me find housing for me and my children. As of now, I am in dire straits.

They also protect against solid and liquid aerosols.¬†FFP3 masks¬†protect against materials in concentrations up to 50x OEL or 20x APF.¬†FFP3 masks¬†are suitable for handling hazardous powders, such as those found in the pharmaceutical industry. campaigns.title: Warming The Streets: COVID-19
campaigns.description: Warming The Streets is a project run by young adults, aiming to reach out to rough sleepers in London by providing warmth, food and conversation in an attempt to brighten up their winter.  Warming The Streets was started because of the very visible issue in the streets of London, which is homelessness.¬† The number of people seen rough sleeping in London increased by 1,371 in the past year, and is now well over 8,000 people. Figures from the Office for National Statistics show that an estimated 726 homeless people died in England and Wales in 2018. We see people struggling on the streets of London everyday and want to make a change, in whatever way we can, to make it a little less unbearable.  Warming The Streets aims to provide short term comfort to those experiencing homelessness in 3 simple and direct ways:  1) Food - Our packages will contain essential food and drink such as bottles of water, granola bars, fruit   veg, sandwiches and dog food. 2) Clothes - Our packages will contain essential warm clothing such as hats, scarves, socks, blankets and raincoats/anoraks. 3) Conversation - People experiencing homelessness are just that - people. They have the same need for interaction as anyone else; so our volunteers will aim to engage in conversation with the recipients and talk to them about anything that they deem appropriate. During this time we can also hand out optional extras such as maps to local services, tooth brushes/paste and cleansing wipes.  Our objective is to be as direct as possible. We hope to receive donations in the form of items, clothing and money and assemble our care packages. Our volunteers will deliver them straight to those experiencing homelessness.  100% of the donations will be going towards the assembling and distribution of the care packages, and with your help, we can bring a little warmth to those experiencing homelessness this winter.  Thank you so much,  Warming The Streets

campaigns.title: raising money for the family of Jose Corona
campaigns.description: We are asking for donations to be able to lay our beloved Jose Corona Galvan to rest. Jose who was only 18 years old had his whole life ahead of him. He was supposed to be starting his new job in a few days, and had dreams that were suddenly cut short. As many know he had a bright future because he was trying to turn his life around. He was working with F.L.Y and the New Hope for Youth program. These programs work with at risk youth to help them turn their life around and they were helping Jose get his life back on track. He had also signed up to go back to school to get his last few credits and graduate high school. His counselors described him as self motivated, respectful, and a hard worker. He has lost his life in terrible way because he was stabbed on October, 6th, 2019 as he exited Mexico Bakery on Alum Rock. He had gone to the bakery to get some bread for his mom and was never able to return home. He was only four blocks away from his house this should have never happened to him or his family. His family needs your help for his funeral services and to be able to lay him to rest. Anything helps, god bless.

campaigns.title: Brandon's Christmas blanket drive
campaigns.description: Hi my name is Brandon! This would be my 3rd year that i came up with the idea to ask for blankets or collect $10 (or even a $1) -and buy as many as I can so I can go give out to the homeless. I was able to collect and buy a total of 91 last year. My goal this year is to be able to give out 50 or more! We are very lucky to be able to spend Christmas in our nice warm house, but many people have no choice but to sleep outside in the cold. Please help me by donating whatever you can or calling my mom so she can pick up the blankets for me. I will be giving them out in December. Thank you very much for helping keep some homeless people warm this year.¬†  Hola mi nombre es Brandon! Este seria mi tercer a√±o que tube la idea de pedir cobijas o colectar $10 (o $1) - y comprar las que pudiera para repartir a los desamparados. Pude colectar y comprar un total de 91 el a√±o pasado. My meta para este a√±o es poder repartir 50 mas! Somos muy afortunados de poder pasar la navidad en un hogar calientito pero mucha gente no tiene esa opcion y duerme afuera en el frio. Porfavor ayudame en donar lo que puedas o en hablarle a mi mama para que recoja cobijas por mi. Las estare repartiendo en Diciembre. Muchas gracias por ayudarme a no dejar que mas gente pase frio este a√±o.

campaigns.title: Please help us give Ruth Jones a proper burial
campaigns.description:
Yesterday(Tuesday 11/5) morning my grandmother unexpectedly passed away. None of us are prepared. We are unaware if she had a life insurance policy. My siblings and I are looking for donations so we can give my grandmother, ¬†the woman who raised us, a proper funeral. The total cost for the funeral is $8700. Before the funeral home can even bury her, or proceed with the funeral, we have to have the whole $8700 up front. Any little thing will help us at this point.¬†


 



 Thank you


 

Hello everyone.
 As everyone may know, Nanny went home early Tuesday morning. She's been sick lately and struggling with her health and we weren't prepared and she didn't ever tell us which direction to go or what to do in the case of her leaving. She tried to prepare us for life but we never expected this. I hate having to do this but please if anyone can help, even if it's a little, it will help us get closer to putting her in her final resting spot next to my brother Nate. I know alot of people don't trust GoFundMes but this helped Nate and it was our last resort so if anyone doesn't feel comfortable with GoFundMe you could even call Geo. J Carroll funeral home and put money toward her funeral. It's a tough situation losing the woman who raised us and loved us so so unconditionally who was our guidance in life and now having to figure this out without her.. we don't know what to do.
From the bottom of our hearts, thank you.
We love you Nanny.

campaigns.title: April Follies: COVID-19
campaigns.description: Would you like to join us in making a difference?   We are raising money to benefit April Follies, the largest and longest running queer partner dance competition in North America. It ¬†takes place in Oakland, Ca. the last Saturday in April every year. This event stands as a beacon of joy and celebration and began as a direct result of mainstream ¬†ban on same-sex couples in competition.¬†  Our goal WAS to raise $8,000 towards the costs of the event.¬† However, since we have had to cancel our 2020 event due to COVID-19, we are now asking for your help to recover our losses.¬† e.g.¬† we are losing our $2000 deposit on our venue and we have spent a similarly large sum on publicity.¬† We have no paid staff.¬† We are all volunteer.  Your donation is tax deductible and with your help we will recover and be back bigger and better in¬† 2021 (most likely April 24). ¬† Thank you in advance for any contribution big or small that you can make to this cause that means so much to our community at large!   https://www.aprilfollies.com/   To glimpse the world of queer ballroom check out¬†   https://www.hottotrotfilm.com/    All the competitors featured have competed in April Follies.  And this!¬†    https://abc7news.com/entertainment/same-sex-ballroom-dancing-popular-in-bay-area/1317834/

campaigns.title: Viva la Rasa
campaigns.description: My dear family of friends,  San Francisco is on lock down due to the COVID19 and the virus is affecting our dear City and community like nothing ever before. These are perilous times and we have yet to know when this will end, but it will. To deter the progress of the virus, the SF Bay Area govt has cancelled and banned events and ask for extreme health and precautions in public places. It is advised to stay in your homes as to not contribute to the problem but eliminate this incredible monster. The time it will take is yet to be known.¬† As a professional musician, performer and artist for events in San Francisco and around the world, 100 percent of my work as of February 21 and beyond has been cancelled without any available action to receive cancellation fees. My very survival is at risk. I need to be able to be able to pay for transportation, cleaning and emergency supplies for daily living and disaster preparedness as well as healthy foods!¬† I am happy to say I am blessed with a place to stay at this time but I have zero income! Lovers and supporters of the arts¬† pleases love and care at this very concerning dire time. If our federal   local governments won‚Äôt give us Medicare-for-all or relief for lost wages, it‚Äôs up to us to help each other!!¬† Other ways to support: Venmo: @rasa vitalia PayPal:  rasa@rasavitalia.com  Patreon:   http:///rasawww.Patreon.comvitalia   Thank you all so very much for your blessed help. Please, by the grace of God, may¬† you, your friends, family and all be safe, healthy and blessed, always.
