campaigns.title: Russell Baca's Recovery
campaigns.description: On Friday, August 23rd, 2019, Russell Baca was involved in a freak accident in his home.¬† He was rushed to the hospital in extreme pain in his neck with no movement in his hands, arms, or shoulders.¬† The EMT's mistakenly sat Mr. Baca up, instead of following proper protocol for a neck injury,¬† possibly making it worse.¬† After two MRI's,¬† it was determined that he broke his neck.¬† On Saturday, Russ was operated on to repair the damage.¬† He is still in ICU as a precaution and in a great deal of pain. As far as we know, the doctor felt like the surgery was a success.¬† It is unknown as to what his prognosis will be long term and recovery will look like.¬† If he continues to do well, he should be moved to a Physical Therapy facility this week.¬† The truth is he has a long recovery ahead of him and so does his family.¬†  ¬† We are asking for assistance in a few different areas at this time.¬† First and foremost, they need prayer.¬† This entire family needs to be covered in prayer.¬† Russell and Susan are the proud parents to two teenage daughters.¬† Russell is the leader of his family¬† and Co-Owner of TriPlumb Plumbing LLC.¬† Right now he is down but not out. Susan is his helper and his beautiful wife.¬† Right now she needs people to come along side her to help her help. They really are a beautiful team. They also have family and friends that march along side of them. Please pray for them all daily.¬† Our God is big and mighty.¬† He is the Healer and Comforter.¬† Let's watch him move mountains together. Let Him use us all well to love on this family.¬†¬†  ¬† We are also asking for financial donations.¬† We do not know how much all of this is going to cost so this is just a base for getting started.¬† As hard as this all is, regardless of how unexpected it all is, the truth is bills do not care.¬† Mr. Baca is a small business owner.¬† He works hard everyday to take care of his family.¬† Susan also works very hard to help her husband.¬† With Russ being down, this is not enough to keep the family afloat.¬† There are still mortgage, utilities, food, gas, phones, and many other day to day expenses this family will continue to have.¬† That does not even yet account the Co-payments and astronomic hospital bills that will we showing their ugly faces soon.¬†¬†  ¬† We are asking friends and family to come along side the Baca's in big ways.¬† Please "Share" this campaign and ask your friends to share it as well.¬† You may not be able to give right at this moment. But maybe someone else can.¬† You can lift them up in prayer. You can "Share" this information.¬† The Baca's have come along side of many of us in some of these same ways.¬† They are in the trenches right now. Please join them by supporting them in the fashions listed above.¬† We all get to go home to our comfy beds, in our comfy homes, but our brothers and sisters are hurting.¬† They need help.¬† Please be the hands and feet of Jesus during this time.¬† Carry one another's burdens by loving your neighbor as yourselves.¬† We thank you for anyone who can help in any way.¬† God Bless!

campaigns.title: COVID-19 Direct Relief Fund for colorado hurry pls
campaigns.description: anthony is organizing this fundraiser on behalf of colorado Foundation.¬†¬†Donations are 100% tax deductible. Created 10 hours ago Community   Neighbor and BRONCO PLAYERS we don't want them getting sick Hi, I‚Äôm¬† anthony, the co-founder of lunchdebt.org. I‚Äôm a father in colorado, and I‚Äôm concerned about the impact of COVID-19 on our state and country.¬†  A few years ago, I raised money to help kids across our state by eliminating their school lunch debt. I took action because I saw a need. Collectively, I knew we could do something about it. And we did: We wiped out lunch debt in schools across the state of Washington.¬†  Today, we‚Äôre facing a bigger challenge. The coronavirus is hitting Washington hard. Unfortunately, 29 people have died and 366 people have tested positive, according to the Washington State Department of Health. Government officials warn it could reach 64,000 in a few months if our leaders do not take the steps necessary to stop the spread of the virus.¬†  We hope and encourage our government officials to do all they can to test, treat, and prevent the spread of the coronavirus.¬†  People need immediate help. During this crisis, those with the least suffer the most. Some folks can‚Äôt go to the doctor because they don‚Äôt have healthcare. Public schools are closed for at least two weeks and some people can‚Äôt afford to take off work because they don‚Äôt have paid sick leave. Some parents have to choose between paying the rent and feeding their kids.¬†  This will get worse before it gets better. But the good news is that there‚Äôs a path forward.we don't have it here in colorado this is just in case and as things are going if theres any money left over we will give it to the lunchprograms for schools¬†  You may wonder, like I have, if there‚Äôs anything we can do to help. We don‚Äôt have to sit idly by waiting for someone else to solve the problem. We can take action. We need to come together and lift up the folks that need a helping hand.¬†  ¬†Foundation‚Äôs COVID-19 Response Fund. The colorado Foundation is an important organization providing direct relief to those that need it most. They will provide money to ‚Äúresidents without health insurance and/or access to sick days, people with limited English language proficiency, healthcare and gig economy workers, and communities of color, among others.‚Äù The Fund is working closely with King County‚Äôs Pandemic Community Advisory Group to identify organizations currently providing or receiving requests for support and will use the money raised on our campaign to assist with these efforts.  I will not have access to the funds. Every dollar donated will be transferred directly to the colorado Foundation. Your donation is tax-deductible.¬†  Please join me in becoming part of the solution. Donate $5, $10, or $25 bucks. Every contribution counts. Let your voice be heard and let the people know that we have their backs.¬† https://www.gofundme.com/manage/ww89br-healthy-living-need-to-walk-my-dog-again

campaigns.title: Fear That COVID-19 Will Prolong My Unemployment!
campaigns.description:
I am legitimately, undeniably depressed. I wonder if anyone who really knows me can say that I am a lazy person and that is why I have not worked since the beginning of october.

I am suffering from a very real and severe mental illness. Everyday I'm out of work it seems worse. In the past I've was diagnosed with bi-polar disorder, suffering hyper mania or manic depression.

It's not easy dealing with life when the rug gets pulled out from under me. When I'm working, everything in the world is amazing. When a job ends, I start to suffer from the side effects of my mental illness and I become temporarily disabled.

I don't feel the government properly supports people with invisible problems. I've tried so many times to get psychiatric help and medication, though it never seems to work out. Often, I just want to end it all.

When these times come, I hope that I can count on my family, friends and community to help.

I'm just trying to make do, keep up with bills and feel comfortable enough to leave my bed more than twice a week.

Please help if you can and be a blessing until I can find my strength again. Thank you to everyone in advance and God bless you!

campaigns.title: Nostalgie Cafe Neviges Corona Gutschein
campaigns.description:
Sehr geehrte G√§ste,

wir alle durchleben gerade eine turbulente und schwere Zeit. F√ºr uns Gastronomen und vor allem unsere Angestellten ist es ganz besonders erschreckend.

Ich wei√ü, dass auch andere Branchen genau so schwer unter der aktuellen Lage zu leiden haben wie wir, jedoch bin ich zun√§chst einmal darauf bedacht, meinen Angestellten und Ihren Familien weiterhin eine Lebensgrundlage bieten zu k√∂nnen.

Da wir im Moment vor√ºbergehend durch die beh√∂rdlichen Ma√ünahmen f√ºr vorerst einen Monat geschlossen haben, belaufen sich die Einnahmen z.Zt. auf 0,- ‚Ç¨

Wir haben bis jetzt auf etwas Hilfe von der Bundes- oder Landesregierung gehofft, mussten jedoch ern√ºchternd feststellen, dass die neu beschlossenen Soforthilfen nur f√ºr Unternehmen bis zu 10 Angestellten gelten.

Alles was dar√ºber liegt, soll aller Voraussicht tats√§chlich auf Kredite zur√ºckgreifen. Nur wie sollen wir diese Kredite zur√ºck bezahlen, wenn wir kein Einkommen haben?

Da wir in diesem Jahr mit dem Nostalgie Cafe   Restaurant umgezogen sind, und erst im Februar die Neuer√∂ffnung stattfand, ist es f√ºr mich noch schwerer da mein ganzes privates Geld in das neue Projekt geflossen ist.

Aus diesem Grund habe ich mich zu diesem Schritt entschlossen.

Aber wir wollen auch etwas daf√ºr zur√ºck geben.

Wir m√∂chten f√ºr alle diejenigen die Spenden einen Gutschein √ºber die gleiche Summe des Spendenbetrages ausstellen.

Wir werden nach der Aktion alle Namen sammeln und f√ºr jeden einen dementsprechenden Gutschein zum Abholen bereithalten. Gerne auch per E-Mail unter Bekanntgabe Ihrer Mail-Adresse.

Sollte jemand eine zu weite Anreise haben, werden wir den Gutschein auch verschicken. Hierzu bitte eine Nachricht auf Facebook oder per Mail.

F√ºr alle Velberter, Bitte holen Sie den Gutschein unter Vorlage des Ausweises und der Spendenquittung bei uns ab, sobald wir das Cafe-Restaurant wieder ge√∂ffnet haben.

Der Gutschein kann nur ausgegeben werden, wenn Sie bei Ihrer Spende den Namen angeben. 

Ich danke Ihnen von ganzen Herzen und hoffe, dass wir uns bald wieder in unserem Nostalgie Cafe   Restaurant sehen. 

Ihr Lars Jesert und das gesamte Nostalgie Cafe   Restaurant Team

campaigns.title: Home Solution
campaigns.description: This page will help my dad, Step-mom, sister and brother in Nayarit, Mexico.   The funds will be used to build a secure and enclosed room for them to sleep in.   I will be flying down December 1st through the end of February and would like to help out with labor as much as I can but I need your help to make this possible for them as a gift of generosity.  For those who knew my dad while living in Oregon, know that he‚Äôs a really hard worker. For the last 8 years, he has been protecting and fighting for native family land from illegal government and family actions that have held him back from progressing.   Being on the farm means constantly feeding the animals, watering the crops, cleaning the property, and taking the kids to and from school while providing the means for food and daily necessities.         Meaning, he takes any small jobs that allow him to still work his farm schedule, for example selling a barrel of mangos for $5, a basket of eggs for $3 or cleaning reusable bags for crops.¬†     My dad has had multiple hospitalizations from scorpions since he is the one constantly working the fields. They all have to avoid the mosquitos and no seams.¬†      This room means they can end their hard working day and rest their heads in a safe, closed, and secure room.     I know without a doubt that if these illegal government and family circumstances were not holding him back, he would be in better living conditions.¬†  My dad is a very giving man and anyone who knew/know him personally would have positive things to say about him. He is constantly helping with my siblings schools by volunteering and helping them with improvements whenever he can. His pigs even have a better foundation than his current room. Also giving back to his community members when they possibility is there.¬†    During this season of gifts and giving, please consider my family. Thank you so much and bless your heart of generosity towards them!¬†     Much love,¬†  Dayana

campaigns.title: Corona Cancer Fight Continues
campaigns.description: We, the Corona's have been going through a very hard time this season   I know there is no way I can do anything on my own so after reaching out to some of my fellow sisters in Christ   the GoFundMe account was present   so here we are. My husband [Eric] has been battling cancer this year while in prison and has been granted parole, so he should be home by April 2020.¬† Early in the year he had multiple seizures; triggered by his asthma, bronchitis   pneumonia. In May they went in   found a tumor  ¬† removed it from the left side of his chest. Three days after surgery he had a¬† stroke   than 2 days later surgery to remove ulcers in his throat In August they said 2 more tumors had grew on the opposite side Scheduled surgery for Oct 1, they went in and removed the larger tumor, due to the size it was removed in pieces. When they did that, they found another one hiding. Oct 4, the one hiding busted I bvb his chest,¬† he began hemorrhaging   was rushed to the hospital¬† Oct 7, the removal of the other tumor was completed Nov 1, he had another stroke Nov 16, they found 2 tumors in his brain   he was swelling up that's why he was having headaches Nov 25, he began to bleed from his nose   head was swelling, it began to turn purple Dec 1, his brain was swollen   he began to bleed from his head   nose Dec 2, Dr's did a procedure to remove fluid from his brain   release some of the pressure. The final surgery for the 2 tumors is pending at this moment.¬†  In addition;¬† I'm unable to return to work at this time.  Nov 13, I was followed home from the corner store   sexually assaulted in my home. I've completed the Crime Victim's Program forms through Texas Attorney Generals Office   awaiting approval. I am starting counseling with Houston Area Women's Center   Memorial Assistant Ministries, I also have Dr Appointments scheduled   having difficulties in crowds   around any place there are a lot of men. I cry a lot   shake uncontrollably at any given moment, it has lasted for 24 hours   so it is a challenge stepping out of the house for too long. I changed my locks but unable to rest at night, so I cat nap throughout the day.   I'm a survivor of 30 years of multiple types of abuse; including childhood sexual abuse, rape, captivity, torture, teen dating abuse   domestic violence... so I know eventually I'll get stronger but right now, I have no idea how the rent, bills or Eric's financial needs will be met .  So this request is to cover basic needs   expenses for us both at this time.¬† We aren't worried about the Holiday's as life itself is what we both are grateful for   focused on.  We thank you from the bottom of our hearts   greatly appreciate any help possible. God bless you   please keep us both in prayer for a full healing   rapid recovery.¬†

campaigns.title: MTC COVID-19 Relief Fund
campaigns.description: The Millennial Theatre Company, an official 501(c)3 Nonprofit Organization founded in 2016, works to bridge the gap between youth and adult community theater opportunities for young adults ages 18-35 (Millennials). The organization aims to create theatrical experiences that speak to both actors and audiences of the Millennial generation, although all generations will appreciate the generation-relevant content that the organization seeks to provide  The company has recently found its new home at the newly restored Robins Theatre in Warren, Ohio and has just launched their 2020 season. The company's next season will consist of Shrek the Musical, Heathers the Musical (5 year anniversary show), a yet-to-be-released Summer Musical, The Rocky Horror Show, and Hairspray.¬†  The goal of this campaign is to secure funds to offset expenses for a rehearsal/storage space for the company, due to the theatre being used all year long for other performances.  How Your Donation Can Help ¬†Many members of the Millennial Generation have found a difficult time getting involved in theatrical leadership roles, most of which are almost always exclusively reserved for older members of the community. The Millennial Theatre Company seeks to provide an outlet for Millennials to take on these leadership roles, while also providing audiences with theatrical experiences that reflect and speak to the generation's experiences, interests, and values. This can be evidenced in the company's mission statement; "Producing quality theatrical experiences with, for, and of a generation".  The Millennial Theatre Company is also hoping to extend its reach beyond the traditional staging of a musical. The company also hosts educational workshops, geared towards the Millennial Generation, to help prepare actors for the stage. Although programming is designed with Millennials in mind, individuals of all ages are welcome and encouraged to attend all Millennial Theatre Company events. The company is also working with young artists to produce locally written work, written exclusively by members of the Millennial Generation.  By having our own rehearsal space, we will be able to get many members of the Millennial Generation involved. We currently jump from spaces in Girard and Poland, but would like to have a consistent space that we can build sets, rehearse, and develop MTC year-round.¬†  Other Ways You Can Help Help us get out the word about Millennial Theatre Company.  ‚Äî Sharing our Facebook posts and Twitter announcements.  ‚Äî Sharing this campaign with friends and family.  ‚Äî Attend future Millennial Theatre Company events.  ‚ÄîPurchase season tickets.

campaigns.title: Heal to Live, Live to Heal --> BECAUSE of COVID-19
campaigns.description: My Hebrew name is Rafael ( ◊®÷∏◊§÷∏◊ê÷µ◊ú -- after the healing archangel ) and my living situation is urgently being challenged by recent disabilities caused by a rare immune disease and its treatment that include leg and foot damage and COPD. ¬†I started this campaign because I believe I can earn my expenses and make a profit with the internet business of promoting and selling quality alternative health products through "affiliate marketing"--despite these challenges and COVID-19.¬† ¬†It is extra urgent as I have no income now as I used to set face-to-face meeting between real estate agents and property owners part time and only have a reserve of about 2-3 months before I'm all out.  My underlying autoimmune disease, putting me in the COVID-19 high risk group, is called  EGPA ¬† and causes severe daily sinus and lung infections--but¬† after researching and employing an alternative treatment using ozone gas infused into water and oil, I was able to completely stop them and heal my tissues.¬† ¬†I also have progressive cardiomyopathy and COPD with lungs operating at 40%.¬† My disease ulcerates the arterial lining within organs and can make them fail and has attacked my colon, retina, middle ear (causing profound hearing loss) lungs, and heart along with side effects of the steroids which weaken my muscle skeletal system resulting in ruptures of tendons and breaking of bones.  I now feel that I have not only been given a new lease on life but a compelling mission to help others who, with standard medical practices, might not be making good progress and who are loosing hope .¬†   Since 1981, when I was lucky to be diagnosed properly, I have prevailed despite the constant aggressive onslaught of this disease that has included 31 restorative, corrective surgeries, or procedures to keep me functioning. I know that by remaining persistent, focused, and full of faith and gratitude, there is little that I can‚Äôt accomplish, with your help. B‚ÄùH  Any amount would go towards a suggested working ad budget used during a course I am taking, that I already purchased with savings, created by a top performer in this field who was written up in Forbes Magazine in 2015.¬† It will be also used to float me with paying expenses during the time it takes to hit financial independence which is about $1800/mo--my total personal expenses.¬†   I have had a very rough time during the last promotion of my campaign through January where I had to overcome 2 bouts of lung infections so I need a budget again to launch this business.¬† I deeply appreciate the growing community that supports me. ¬†Together, we can do this. ¬†$18 and multiples thereof receive a special blessing as it stands for life.¬†¬†  L'Chaim with Rabbi Yossi.     Studying and reading Torah after Shacharit with my dear friend, Gil.

campaigns.title: Feed The Homeless For The Holidays
campaigns.description:
My name is Oiram Corona im 19 years old and im from los angeles california. For the most part of my life i always had everything i needed and even more that was unneeded but wanted. One day me my mother and my 4 sisters were left on the streets with no place to go but our car. It changed my view on life how you can have it all and it can go away in a second. Lucky for us God put it in the heart of a christian family that new nothing about us to let us live in their living room rent free until we got back up on our feet. Ever since then ive wanted to help out others just like i was given an opportunity. The reason i made this page was for everyone who wants to help out but dont have the chance or time to go out and give back to the community. 
I want to go out on new years eve and with whatever money i have plus the money that we raise will go directly to buying food and water and giving it to people on the streets who are less fortunate. 
Whatever you feel is right in your heart plz do so God will forever return the blessing.

campaigns.title: Ayuda el coraz√≥n de Victor a seguir latiendo
campaigns.description: Mi nombre es V√≠ctor Daniel Molero,¬† mi pap√°, V√≠ctor Raul Molero de 71 a√±os de edad, residenciado en Maracaibo Venezuela, padece una severa obstrucci√≥n coronaria,¬† por lo que requiere de manera urgente de una Angioplastia para mejorar su condici√≥n y calidad de vida. Sin √©sta intervenci√≥n su vida corre grave peligro y empeora con el paso de los d√≠as. Mi hermana y yo acudimos a la buena voluntad, de todo aquel que pueda aportar un granito de arena para ayudarnos a solventar esta dif√≠cil situaci√≥n. Les estaremos eternamente¬† agradecidos colaboraci√≥n, en la forma en que nos la puedan brindar para ayudar a nuestro padre.   A causa de la grave crisis humanitaria y del colapso del sistema de salud Venezolano, ha sido sumamente dif√≠cil conseguir y adquirir los insumos m√©dicos necesarios. Los fondos de esta campa√±a ser√°n utilizados para la adquisici√≥n de tres (3) stents medicados, adem√°s de 2 gu√≠as y 2 balones para angioplastia coronaria, m√°s 1 kit para angioplastia coronaria, a trav√©s la Corporaci√≥n Industrial Quifoven II CA y Angiotec.   Esta campa√±a es administrada por Abraham Corona, sobrino de Victor Raul Molero, y todos los recursos se tranferir√°n directamente a las empresas en EE.UU que suministrar√°n los insumos para la intervenci√≥n.¬†      My name is V√≠ctor Daniel Molero, my dad, 71-year-old Victor Hugo Molero, who lives in Maracaibo, Venezuela, suffers from a severe coronary obstruction, so he urgently requires an angioplasty to improve his condition and quality of life. Without this intervention, his life is in serious danger and worsens over the days. My sister and I appeal to the goodwill of anyone who can contribute in any way to help us solve this difficult situation. We will be eternally grateful for your collaboration to save the life of our father.   Because of the humanitarian crisis and the collapse of the Venezuelan health system, it has been extremely difficult to find and acquires the necessary medical supplies for the intervention. The funds of this campaign will be used for the acquisition of three (3) medicated stents, in addition to 2 guides and 2 balloons for coronary angioplasty, plus 1 kit for coronary angioplasty, through the Industrial Corporation Quifoven II CA and Angiotec.   This campaign is managed by Abraham Corona, Victor Hugo Molero's nephew, and all resources will be transferred directly to companies in the US that will provide the medical supplies for the intervention.

campaigns.title: Emergenza Covid19 nelle comunit√† masai Tanzania
campaigns.description: Siamo Cristina e Ilaria, due amiche con la passione per l'Africa e legate sentimentalmente con due guerrieri masai della Tanzania con cui abbiamo due splendide figlie.   Trascorriamo mesi vivendo in remoti villaggi della savana e cercando di dare un contributo alla comunit√† masai locale portando vestiti, in particolare felpe per le fredde notti del bush, medicine di cui hanno bisogno e aiutando nell'acquisto di beni di prima necessit√†.   Questa volta per√≤ abbiamo un progetto ben pi√π ampio che da sole non potremmo realizzare: vorremmo creare 2 pozzi per l'acqua e abbiamo bisogno di voi.   Ne vorremmo creare uno per ogni comunit√† dei nostri guerrieri che sono lontani dall'altra: la prima si chiama Msomera ed √® un minuscolo villaggio remoto non facile da raggiungere se non in moto.   Cristina arriv√≤ l√¨ nel 2015 e rimase scioccata nel vedere la fatica dei giovani guerrieri e delle donne che si calavano in grosse buche scavate nel terreno per riemire i loro secchi e li tiravano su pieni e pesanti grazie ad un passaggio di mani.   L'acqua era marrone e fangosa e purtroppo disponibile disponibile.   Qualche anno dopo venne costruito un lago artificiale grandissimo e tutto √® filato liscio fino a pochi mesi fa quando le abbondanti piogge hanno fatto franare parte del lago che adesso non esiste pi√π.   Vorremmo creare un pozzo dove la gente pu√≤ avere acqua pulita senza dover faticare e spezzarsi la schiena sotto il peso dei secchi.   L'altro pozzo invece lo vorremmo costruire vicino al meno isolato villaggio di Kiberashi, dove la popolazione comunque dove camminare ben 30 minuti ed oltre per arrivare all '  acqua sotto la calura del sole africano e portando sulla testa pesanti secchi.   Ci auguriamo di cuore e grazie al vostro supporto di poter aiutare concretamente queste comunit√† messe a dura prova dalla povert√† e dalle sempre pi√π frequenti calamit√† naturali dovute anche ai cambiamenti climatici.   Ci trovate su Instagram: @cri.ila_aroundafrica

campaigns.title: Home Repairs -Job Loss due to Corona Virus
campaigns.description: It all started in 2017,¬†the gutters on my 1960 year old house failed, flooding most of the front of my house. I was out of my home for 4 mos. during remediation. I lost my 2 part-time jobs that I had at the time, and I have been thrown one challenge after another, from an undetermined sprinkler leak that cost me over $1,500. that I had to pay to the city of Fullerton, to Lawyer fees to win back the "Property Deed" to my home.  I am not looking to sell my home, I am looking to save my home!.  I am usually the one helping others through their crisis, bringing the Joy! But, now I am having to appeal to others, who might have gone through what I am going through now, or just want to give a little joy themselves. Every little bit helps, hack away at the daily compound interest that I am now being charged by the Orange County Treasurer.  I have survived these last three years of hardship with my unwavering faith and come out stronger for it! I am a survivor, and a force for good, an, I am determined to rise up from the ashes, and reinvent my life!  I just need a little help from my team of friends,¬†community,¬†my faith, and my higher-ups.  I believe in Miracles, I see them happen all time...I am hoping for a special Miracle this year to save my Home.

campaigns.title: Wheel Chair Accessible Van For My Disabled Brother
campaigns.description:
My little brother Carter is 6 years old and was born with myelomeningocele(Spina Bifida), Chiari II malformation, partial disgensis of corpus colosum, Laryngomalacia and pharyngomalacia, bilateral hip dysplasia, bilateral knee contracture, bilateral paralysis in lower limbs and bilateral club foot and incontinence bowel and bladder. He is paralyzed from the knees down and restricted to a wheel chair. He is a light in everyone that he meets day and always stays positive and is slowly learning to look at his disability in a good way. Currently my family is without a vehicle and when we had one driving him back and forth from doctors appointments and many other daily tasks is very difficult and sometimes uncomfortable for him. A little bit over a year ago Carter and His father Matthew were in a car accident where and ambulance rear ended them and it's only made riding in a vehicle for Carter more traumatic and Matthew has just finally received the surgery to hopefully fix the injuries he acquired in the accident it's been a long struggle and now that Matthew is out off comission i was always the one to put Carter in and out of the vehicle because Matthew cannot and the carters other 9 siblings are a little to young. But now I'm in the Army and not home to help and I want them to have the eaisest possible access to mobility when needed. So that's why I'm trying to raise money to buy my family a wheelchair Accessible van. I hope Carters story inspires someone God has blessed us with him. if you have any questions or would like to hear more about his story you can email us at CarterCampbellsPurpose@gmail.com ..........................................


.......................................................................................(link to what Spina Bifida is  https://www.mayoclinic.org/diseases-conditions/spina-bifida/symptoms-causes/syc-20377860  )

campaigns.title: Coronavirus Covid19 2Seattle Residents Need Help
campaigns.description: My wife and I live in king county Washington which as you may know is the epicenter of the coronavirus covid19 in the United States everyday is a struggle and every single day it's only seeming to get more and more difficult for us and this virus going around is a big part of the problem yet there's something else my wife and I have been dealing with since before this whole epidemic even started. 2 words kidney cancer. My wife has the absolute strongest will to live and 2 overcome extraordinarily difficult circumstances more so than anyone I've ever seen. Everyday she manages to keep going regardless of the pain she feels every second of every day. I promise you the extent of which is astronomical to such a point even when shes able to sleep she tell me there's no relief from the pain she feels. We don't have the money to hire someone to help her out with doing things so I care for her the best I possibly can because I love her more than anything and anyone else I have before yet i fear its not enough especially since being there for her all the time makes it near impossible to keep a steady job. Honestly though I'm starting to feel a bit defeated and extremely overwhelmed since the beginning of our relationship I was aware because of her epilepsy there would be challenges not every normal couple faces that's perfectly fine with me. Then when we found out about the cancer it felt like being sucker punched by Mike Tyson right in the gut. After which we've had ups and downs yet as of lately there's been far more downs. Still we try to maintain some sort of positivity for the chance of a better tomorrow. With everything happening with and around us especially after finding out where we are living is the coronavirus covid 19s epicenter of the whole United States and people with pre underlining health conditions are far more susceptible and likely to die if they get infected aka my wife they say for people who get infected that already have renal conditions the virus can make some people's kidney simply stop working and fail all together so on top of all we're facing there's also now that to worry us and fact in the back of our minds none stop.... Bottom line we need help I honestly don't know what else to attempt to do but ask for help so anybody please help us anyway you can anything helps. We would be extremely thankful for whatever kindness support anybody can help us with.

campaigns.title: Help Qi√°nz√†i-el Liver Transplant Surgery/ Corona
campaigns.description:
We‚Äôre in dire need of help in raising funds for Qi√°nz√†i-el Liver Transplant Surgery 
¬†Expenses¬†like medical supplies.¬†

Currently He is fighting for his life because of acute liver failure.¬†
Our family will greatly appreciate anything you could give at all. We're currently at Jackson Memorial Ronald McDonald House while waiting on a Organ match for a life saving miracle.¬†

WHAT IS ALAGILLE SYNDROME?
Alagille syndrome¬†is a genetic disorder that can affect the liver, heart, and other parts of the body. ... This combination of heart defects is called tetralogy of Fallot. People with¬†Alagille syndrome¬†may have distinctive facial features including a broad, prominent forehead; deep-set eyes; and a small, pointed chin. In severe cases, a liver transplant will be necessary. 



Update 03/23/2020: Coronavirus 
We're also ask for donations like baby wipes, diapers, baby water while we try to survive this Coronavirus epidemic. 
I've been layed off due to the virus. 
Were not allowed to travel with because Qianzaiel is Medical Fragile and Immunocompromised! 

HOW DOES THE CORONAVIRUS AFFETS TRANSPLANT RECIPIENTS? 

Like all persons, transplant recipients should adhere to travel advisories issued by their respective health authorities/government bodies.¬† This may necessitate postponing travel to¬†countries with  10 infected patients.
Recipients should avoid travel to all locations where SARS-CoV-2 is currently circulating.

campaigns.title: Steun familie  uit Guatemala, werkloos door Corona
campaigns.description: Dear sponsor, I write you in the name of the family Esqueque from Alotenango en Guatemala.   I got to know this beautiful family in 2010. Their children attended to the school in their village that was build for the most vulnerable families who couldn't pay to go the public school. The family Esqueque attended to a program we started for the families to teach them about education in their homes. That's when they conquered my heart. In the picture you can see the father Carlos, his wife Maria-Elena, and their 4 children: Pedro, Mar√≠a del Carmen, Rosalinda and Anali. In 2010 father Carlos was strugling to find a job to maintain his family. He found a job in a hotel in Antigua, a turistic village nearby. I was very happy for the family. The wages were meager but they could increase a little bit their standard of living.   This month, the corona virus arrived in Guatemala. The hotel where Carlos worked closed his doors. Carlos got fired. Unfortunately, in Guatemala unemployment benefits don't exist. Carlos succeeded to contact me, desperate by the financial situation his family is in.  I have to trie to help them. I proposed to try to rase money through GoFundMe. They were so happy to hear that there might be coming some financial support. Sponsoring this family will mean the world to me, and to them. It will give them food on the table and the possibility for the children to continue to go to school. So they can build a better future for themselves. Carlos has build 1 room for his family where everyone sleeps together in 2 beds. It's his dream to be able to build a second room to have more space for his family. Your funding will help to make their dreams come through!  The money goes directly to the family, sent by Western Union, to father Carlos.¬†  Thank you so much in advance!  From Anneleen, Carlos, Maria-Elena, Pedro, Maria-del-Carmen, Rosalina y Anali  3

campaigns.title: #WheredowegoBerk - COVID-19 Crisis - Please help.
campaigns.description: Please donate to the #WhereDoWeGoBerk Campaign. We are raising money for tents and other winter supplies for the Seabreeze and the I-80 University Underpass homeless encampments.¬† Each of these encampments experienced increased and repeated Caltrans evictions where they lost tents, storage tubs, and their belongings. Tents provide shelter. Storage tubs provide food protection from the rats. Garbage and waste management mitigate health and safety risks. The residents of these encampments are being proactive by starting their own campaign to improve their living conditions and prepare for winter. We are asking you to help us please.¬†  KC, one of our elders, who is disabled and cannot walk, moved 7 times in 3 weeks. She lost her tent, mattress and many of her belongings. After Caltrans evictions, she had to sleep under a boat sail on a metal bed frame. Thanks to Todd Jersey, a local Berkeley architect, we purchased a new yurt for KC so that she could have shelter and get her wheelchair easily inside. We still need to weatherproof her Yurt and provide her with other needed supplies.¬†  Thank you  Todd Jersey Architecture ¬†   There are similar stories throughout these encampments and we need many more tents donated. Patricia Moore, another resident, needs a Yurt as well because she cannot move her wheelchair in her tent. She needs daily wound care so we need to provide her with fresh bandages and medical supplies.¬†  Patricia Moore in her current tent. She cannot walk and must crawl out of her tent to get into her wheelchair. She cannot roll her wheelchair into her tent so a yurt would give her accessibly and warmth in the winter months.¬†  Winter is coming! These Berkeley residents need to be self-sufficient because city services cannot provide for all of their needs. They are asking the City of Berkeley for trash pick-up, porta potties, and drinking water. They would also like to purchase heavy duty trash bags and containers.¬† Help us help them to create a safe, clean, and weather proof environment.     Our goal is to purchase 50-60 weather proof tents. Unlike when a person goes camping temporarily, these tents will be used as a temporary HOME to get someone through the winter and secure their belongings. The money raised will go toward the purchase of tents and other winter supplies including waterproof tarps. Additionally, some of the money donated will go toward waste and trash management.   A portion of the money raised will provide 30-50 GoGirl's to women so that they can easily use the restroom in uncomfortable spaces.¬†  Find out more information on the  GOGIRL on Amazon. ¬†    The donated supplies will be distributed throughout the encampments equally.¬† At the request of the residents, we will set up a donations tent so that other homeless individuals (throughout Berkeley)¬† can receive the supplies¬† they need. The donations tent will be run by the unhoused residents themselves, who will work as volunteers, keeping inventory, and equally distributing supplies to all of the individuals living in the encampments.   Our new  Community Donations tent from Amazon. ¬†Thank you Sarah W for this contribution!¬†¬†   The unhoused in Berkeley are uniting to demand an answer to the question: Where do we go? Until they ¬†can find a lawful place to be, please help them protect themselves and the most vulnerable in their community from the cold of winter. There are not enough shelter beds or housing. The most vulnerable are our senior citizens and disabled. These communities care and take care of their most vulnerable. They need our help.¬† The current solutions are not working. We need immediate solutions for this winter and community building. Please help us.    For a history of the Where do we go? movement see recent article by  JP Masser: An Intersecting Tale: Berkeley's #WhereDoWeGo Movement Stays Fast. ¬†  Please support  Street Spirit ¬† and purchase a copy of the October 2019 edition from a homeless vendor in Berkeley.  Photo taken by Yessica Prado and Article written by Alastair Boone, published in the October 2019 edition of Street Spirit.   Tent design and photo taken by Suzi Garner. ¬† We LOVE you Suzi! I cannot wait until we get Where do we go? t-shirts with your tents as the photo.¬†

Unfortunately, our loved one was heavy set which makes the costs be even higher than usual therefore with a heavy heart we are asking for donations, anything helps, we are very grateful for anything that can be donated to our family in this traumatic event. Thank you.  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  El 1/09/2020, nuestro querido hijo, padre, hermano, t√≠o y amigo fue tomado demasiado pronto de la familia Corona. Esta muerte fue inesperada para todos, por lo tanto, la familia no estaba financieramente preparada para asumir los costos de entierro que todos sabemos son rid√≠culamente altos en estos d√≠as. La raz√≥n de su fallecimiento se debi√≥ a una insuficiencia pulmonar, que finalmente condujo a un ataque card√≠aco. Nuestro hermano fue ingresado en el hospital de Homestead el s√°bado 01/04/2020, estuvo en la UCI durante un total de 5 d√≠as durante los cuales luch√≥ con todas sus fuerzas para salir de su coma, pero desafortunadamente su cuerpo no pudo seguir luchando y a las 11:46 PM perdimos un alma hermosa y ganamos un √°ngel. Desafortunadamente, nuestro ser querido ten√≠a bastante sobre peso, lo cual hace que los costos sean a√∫n m√°s altos de lo habitual, por lo tanto, con un dolor en el coraz√≥n estamos pidiendo donaciones, cualquier cosa ayuda, estamos muy agradecidos por todo lo que se pueda donar a nuestra familia en este evento traum√°tico. Gracias.

campaigns.title: Miguelito's Retinoblastoma (eye cancer) Treatment
campaigns.description: Hi,¬† my name is Miguel Zapien Corona and everyone calls me "Miguelito" (little Mike).¬† I am 1 year old from Guadalajara, Jalisco Mexico.  Just few days before Christmas my mom took¬† me to the doctor because when she took a picture she could see on my right eye a strange light. ¬†¬† After the doctors appointment the nightmare started for my family....¬† ¬†We started performing some test and examinations with the ophthalmologist and they confirmed the diagnostic:¬† "Retinoblastoma" (eye cancer) in my right eye.¬† The tumor was "large"....... The worst fear that a mother could bear is to hear his baby has cancer and his life is in danger.¬†  The doctors in Guadalajara wanted to remove my eye but we found the only clinic in Mexico (Hospital Zambrano Hellion) that can do a treatment with intra-arteriel chemotherapy (most likely 4-5 times)¬† to try to save my eye and my life.¬† ¬†  However this treatment¬† is very expensive ($16,000 usd each treatment) that is not cover by my insurance plus¬† travel expenses to Monterrey several times.¬† ¬†    I need to start treatment as soon as possible due the tumor is getting larger and could spread very soon.  I'm a happy kid and want to live.¬† ¬†There is still to much to discover and enjoy.¬† ¬†I will fight this battle against cancer beside God and my family.  Life can change in seconds.¬† Remember to Love with all your hearth and be grateful for every sunshine!  We thank you infinite for reading my story and helping us with your prayers and donation .  p.s. GoFundme donations are  dollars.¬†¬†  The fund for this campaign will be going to Miguelitos treatment: doctors appointments, test, chemio, travel expenses.¬† Thanks for your kind support       ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  Hola,¬† me llamo Miguel Zapien Corona,¬† todos me conocen como Miguelito.¬† ¬†Tengo 1 anio y naci en Guadalajara, Jalisco, Mexico.  Unos dias antes de Navidad mi mami me llevo al doctor porque vio una luz extrania en mi ojo derecho cuando me tomo una foto.  Despues de la cita con el doctor la pesadilla para mi familia comenzo.¬† ¬†Comenzamos a realizar examenes con el oftalmologo y lo confirmaron:¬† Retinoblastoma (cancer en mi ojo derecho).¬† El tumor era bastante grande......El peor temor que una madre puede esperar es escuchar que su bebe tiene cancer y su vida esta en peligro.¬† ¬†  Los doctores en Guadalajara quireren remover mi ojo,¬† pero mi familia encontro la unica clinica en Mexico (Hospital Zambrano Hellion) que tiene un tratamiento llamado Quimioembolizacion de Retinoblastoma.¬† ¬† ¬†Miguelito es candidato y necesitaria 4 - 5 tratamientos para poder salvar mi ojo y mi vida.  Sin embargo este tratamiento es muy caro ($16,000 usd por tratamient) que no es cubierto por mi seguro y necesitamos viajar varias veces a Monterrey.  Necesito comenzar el tratamiento lo antes posible pues el tumor es muy grande y se puede esparcir a otras partes muy pronto.  Soy un nino muy alegre y quiero vivir!¬† Hay mucho que me queda por aprender y disfrutar.¬† Luchare esta batalla contra el cancer al lado de Dios y mi familia.  La vida cambia en segundos.¬† Recuerda Amar con todo tu corazon y agradecer por cada amanecer.  Te agradecemos infinitamente por leer mi historia y ayudarnos con tus rezos y donaciones.  Para donaciones en  Pesos  anexamos la cuenta.¬† O si gustar donar a traves de GoFundMe considera tipo de cambio de pesos a dollarses

campaigns.title: Corona Virus - Vaccine Research
campaigns.description: Coronaviruses are a large group of viruses that can cause illnesses as minor as a cold, or as serious as Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS) and Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS), according to the World Health Organization. They often present with pneumonia-like symptoms.  The viruses are transmitted from animals to humans ‚Äî the virus that causes SARS, for example, was transmitted to humans from a cat-like animal called a civet. But in some instances, as appears to be the case with this new strain of coronavirus, they can also be transmitted between humans.¬†  The World Health Organization said there are multiple known coronaviruses circulating in animals that have not yet been transmitted to humans.  Will Donate to Biotech Moderna for help on research finding vaccine cure.  NOTE: I will keep 5% because I am looking to invest in my app (selfish reasons) but also for the cause.

campaigns.title: Funding for Wuhan Coronavirus
campaigns.description: The Wuhan Coronavirus is spreading quickly. There have now been more than 400 cases in China with 17 dead, and a case has been detected in Washington State. Hospitals in Wuhan have been extremely full in the past few days. Fifteen first responders have been infected with the virus while trying to help others, but despite the risk, all the doctors in the respiratory department are working day and night nonstop despite the approaching Lunar New Year, a time traditionally for family reunions.     If we do not stop this infection in Wuhan, in China, it may very well spread all over the world. Recently, the Chinese Newspaper published a call to people around the world to donate to Wuhan to purchase much needed medical supplies to stop the virus. Please donate to these people fighting on the front line, so that we have a chance to stop the virus before it becomes the next SARS.  I will take the money donated, purchase the materials, and ship them to hospitals in Wuhan

campaigns.title: Help Wuhan Hospitals Fight the Coronavirus
campaigns.description: I am an eight grade student attending middle school in California, and I am raising money to help the doctors and citizens in Wuhan, China, who are going through an virus outbreak crisis.  I would like to raise $3,000 to help provide approximately 10,000 disposable surgical masks to the city of Wuhan. Any donation is much appreciated, and all funds will go towards the purchase and shipping of the supplies to hospitals and epidemic prevention centers. Currently, doctors at some hospitals are only allocated one mask per day, while on active duty and treating infected patients. Furthermore, citizens are now required by the Wuhan government to wear face masks to prevent the spread of this virus.  A new coronavirus strain, a pneumonia-like respiratory virus, was recently discovered in China. The new virus is called 2019-nCoV and NBC News states that "there is no specific treatment for the new virus, and no vaccine to prevent it." In December of 2019, there was a huge coronavirus outbreak in the city of Wuhan, China. CNN has confirmed that there are approximately 2,000 infected, while the death toll has risen to 56 people in China as of January 26th. The Wall Street Journal states that the virus has "quickly spread throughout China and other countries in Asia, and . . . U.S. Health authorities expect that it will spread even further."  Wuhan is located in the middle of China and is by no means a small city, with an overall population of 11 million. It is also one of China's most important cities and is considered the political and economical capital of the country. Authorities have issued a citywide lockdown, and all public transport services throughout the city have been suspended until further notice. Main highways leaving Wuhan have been shut down, and airports and railway stations have been temporarily closed to departing passengers. The implementation of the blockade is an immense challenge to transport authorities and is also extremely difficult for people with relatives living in Wuhan. Chinese Lunar New Year is on January 25th this year, but many people cannot visit or see their relatives. CNN describes the situation as "akin to closing down all transport links for a city more than three times the size of Chicago, two days before Christmas."  Thank you so much in advance to anyone who provides a donation, regardless of amount.  My plan: After receiving each $300 worth of donations, I will purchase as many masks as I can and send them to Wuhan Xie He Dongxihu Hospital in Wuhan, Hubei, China (Jing Bei Yi Road, Wuhan, Dongxihu Qu). My parents will also directly call the hospital to ensure that they will know when the shipment arrives. All purchased masks will be shipped to China via a global courier company.

campaigns.title: Moms&Children Enrichment Services in Corona,Queens
campaigns.description: Greetings and thank you so much for taking the time to visit my page.  My heart is full and excited to share my business with the Corona/Elmhurst communities. With professional/academic experience working in Harlem, Bed-Stuy, along with out-of state experience in the Roxbury/Dorchester/Jamaica Plain communities in Boston, I am truly proud and ecstastic to share my learnings, resources and heart into my own local community.¬†  With your financial support, I will be able to provide workforce development to moms in the community, due to a variety of societal circumstances, are unable to secure FT/PT work experience and training to add financial support their families. I also provide AP/Honor Roll teen scholars and artists the opportunity to tutor and teach Arts enrichment activities ranging from Intro to Dance, Intro to Vocal and Intro to Theatre/Improv.  In addition, my business offers enrichment activities ranging from early childhood enrichment, tutoring and school age afterschool and arts-based enrichment programs for the Corona/Elmhurst community. ¬†All quality services are offered at low-cost, affordable options with proven impact on the school readiness and future career success of our community's children.   As a born and raises native to the Corona/Elmhurst area, I can attest that access to quality and affordable enrichment and tutoring has and remains completely underrepresented. Leaving our children at tremendous academic advantage by the time they reach high school/ college level.  As both a parent and native to the Corona/Elmhurst community, it is my intention, goal and mission to provide much needed enrichment and social services resources into my hometown and broader historically underrepresented communities in Queens, NY. ¬†Having worked and volunteered countless hours over the past 20 years in the nonprofit /social services / education enrichment industries, I'm determined "to be the change in the world I want to see".  Help me infuse opportunity and hope into the future of Corona/Elmhurst children and families. One Smile at a time.¬†  Donate $5 Today! Thank you for your support in the movement.

campaigns.title: Medical Supplies for Wuhan Coronavirus
campaigns.description: This virus can kill you and me once it reaches the west. The virus can be transferred from humans to humans by sneezing, handshakes or even touching something an infected person has touched. It causes pneumonia and doesn‚Äôt respond to antibiotic treatment. It has sickened hundreds and killed people in Asia. Your pets can also catch the deadly virus.  The US has confirmed the 1st case of the virus in the west. The patient is in isolation at the providence regional medical Center in Everest, Washington. If you have recently ¬†travelled to Asia and you feel sick, please quickly consult your doctor.  My name is Jude Og and I used to leave in Wuhan, China. The place is really dear to my heart. All the donations will be given to the Jinyintan Hopsital in Wuhan for medical supplies to help stop the spread of the coronavirus before it fully reaches the west and kills you or your loved ones. I have contacted the account department at the hospital. We really really need your help. Please share and donate.

campaigns.title: Mask Supplies for WUHAN,CORONA VIRUS
campaigns.description: A new coronavirus outbreak ‚Äî a disease similar to SARS ‚Äî is spreading quickly in Wuhan, China and the subsequent need for face masks and other medical grade equipment is quickly rising. Wuhan has been quarantined as health officials and the World Health Organization fear a possible global epidemic.  As such, a scarcity of these medical supplies has struck the area, leading many exposed to this dangerous disease. Death tolls are rising and we must act fast.  I am sending M3 ¬†N95 1860 and 1870 masks, respirators, Tyvex suits, and other relevant medical equipment to hospitals in Wuhan. We are contacting local hospitals and sending these items to hospitals that have put out public requests for supplies. If any hospital from Wuhan or the surrounding areas would like to receive these items from us, please contact us! All money raised from this campaign will go towards the purchase of these supplies, and we are getting ready to complete our first purchases and will update immediately!  We are also looking to partner with hospitals who may have supplies to donate. If you are connected with any hospital or organization and would like to partner with us, please contact us!¬†  Ê≠¶Ê±âÁàÜÂèëÁöÑÊñ∞ÂûãÂÜ†Áä∂ÁóÖÊØíÊÑüÊüìÁöÑËÇ∫ÁÇéÁñ´ÊÉÖÁâµÂä®ÁùÄ‰∏ä‰∏á‰∫∫ÁöÑÂøÉÔºå‰∏≠ÂõΩÂæàÂ§öÂú∞Âå∫ÈÉΩÂá∫Áé∞‰∫ÜÁóÖ‰æãÔºå‰∏ñÁïåÂêÑÂú∞‰πüÈôÜÁª≠Âá∫Áé∞‰∫ÜÊÑüÊüìËÄÖ„ÄÇWHO Ê≠£Âú®ÂºÄ‰ºöÂÜ≥ÂÆöÊòØÂê¶Â∞ÜÂÖ∂ÂÆö‰∏∫ÂõΩÈôÖÂÖ≥Ê≥®ÁöÑÁ™ÅÂèëÂÖ¨ÂÖ±Âç´Áîü‰∫ã‰ª∂„ÄÇÁóÖÊØí‰º†Êí≠ÈÄüÂ∫¶‰πãÂø´ÔºåÂç±ÂÆ≥‰πãÂ§ßË∂Ö‰πé‰∫∫‰ª¨ÁöÑÊÉ≥Ë±°„ÄÇ  Êõ¥Âä†‰ª§‰∫∫ÊãÖÂøÉÁöÑÊòØÔºåÂêÑÂú∞Âùá‰∏çÂêåÁ®ãÂ∫¶Âá∫Áé∞ÂåªÁî®Âè£ÁΩ©ÔºåÈò≤Êä§ÊúçÔºåÊä§ÁõÆÈïúÔºåÊµãÊ∏©‰ª™Á≠âÈò≤Áñ´Áâ©ËµÑÁü≠Áº∫Áé∞Ë±°„ÄÇÂ∞§ÂÖ∂ÊòØÊπñÂåóÁúÅÂåÖÊã¨Ê≠¶Ê±âÂú∞Âå∫ÂåªÈô¢ÁöÑÂåªÊä§‰∫∫ÂëòÔºåÊ≤°ÊúâË∂≥Â§üÁöÑÂåªÁî®Âè£ÁΩ©Á≠âÈò≤Êä§Â∑•ÂÖ∑Ôºå‰æùÁÑ∂ÂùöÊåÅÂú®Èò≤Áñ´Á¨¨‰∏ÄÁ∫øÔºåÁî®Ëá™Â∑±ÁöÑË°ÄËÇâ‰πãË∫Ø‰øùÂç´ÁùÄ‰∫∫Ê∞ëÁöÑÁîüÂëΩÔºÅ Ëøô‰∫õ‰ª§‰∫∫ËÇÉÁÑ∂Ëµ∑Êï¨ÁöÑÁôΩË°£Â§©‰Ωø‰ª¨ÔºåÊàë‰ª¨Â∏åÊúõÂèëÂä®Êõ¥Â§öÁöÑ‰∫∫Ë°åÂä®Ëµ∑Êù•ÔºåËÉΩ‰∏∫‰ªñ‰ª¨Âá∫‰∏Ä‰ªΩÂäõ„ÄÇ  Êàë‰ª¨ÂèëËµ∑ËøôÊ¨°ÂãüÊçêÔºåÂ∞ÜÊääÊçêÊ¨æÁî®‰∫éÂåªÁî®Âè£ÁΩ©ÔºåÈò≤Êä§ÊúçÔºåÊä§ÁõÆÈïúÔºåÊµãÊ∏©‰ª™ÔºåÊµãËØïÁõíÁ≠âÈò≤Áñ´Áâ©ËµÑÁöÑË¥≠‰π∞ÂíåËøêË¥π„ÄÇÊàë‰ª¨Â∞ÜÂçèË∞É‰æõÂ∫îÂïÜÔºåË¥ßËøêÂÖ¨Âè∏ÔºåÂêÑËà™Âè∏ÔºåÂú∞ÊñπÂåªÈô¢Á≠âÁõ∏ÂÖ≥ÈÉ®Èó®ÔºåÊúÄÂ§ßÁ®ãÂ∫¶Âú∞ÊääËøô‰∫õÁâ©ËµÑÈÄÅÂà∞ÂåªÁîüÊâã‰∏≠ÔºåÁªô‰ªñ‰ª¨Â∏¶Êù•‰∏Ä‰ªΩ‰øùÊä§ÔºÅÊàë‰ª¨‰πüÂ∏åÊúõËÉΩÂ§üÁ≠πÈõÜÂà∞Êõ¥Â§öÁöÑÈò≤Áñ´Áâ©ËµÑÔºåÈÄÅÂà∞ÈúÄË¶ÅÁöÑÂ∏ÇÊ∞ëÊâã‰∏≠„ÄÇ  ÂêåÊó∂Â∏åÊúõÂêÑÂú∞ÊñπÁöÑÂåªÁñóÊú∫ÊûÑËÉΩÂ§üËÅîÁ≥ªÊàë‰ª¨ÔºåÁªôÊàë‰ª¨Êèê‰æõÊõ¥Â§öÁöÑÂåªÁñóÁâ©ËµÑ„ÄÇÊàë‰ª¨‰πüÊ¨¢ËøéÂêÑÁßçÂΩ¢ÂºèÁöÑÂ∏ÆÂä©ÔºåËØ∑ÁÇπÂáª‰∏ãÊñπÈìæÊé•ËÅîÁ≥ªÊàë‰ª¨„ÄÇ

campaigns.title: Fight Against Coronavirus Outbreak in Wuhan
campaigns.description: Hello everyone,   You may have heard of the recent outbreak of coronavirus in the city of Wuhan in China. It is a novel virus which is very contagious and causes life-threatening pneumonia in people of all ages. ¬†Unfortunately, there is still no cure for it.   - As of 1/24/2020 8pm local time, it has been reported that  26  people died of this virus infection and  928  are infected in China.   - Numbers keep increasing  exponentially  as more cases were confirmed in Wuhan City and Hubei Province, other provinces of China, other Asian countries and the rest of the world.   - First case infected from this coronavirus in North America was found in Seattle 1/21/2020, and the second case was confirmed in Chicago yesterday 1/23/2020.¬†   - A student of Texas A M University was suspected for possible coronavirus infection after his recent trip to Wuhan yesterday 1/23/2020.  - As of today, China restricts travel of 30 million people in Wuhan as coronavirus death toll rises. City of Wuhan is currently cut off from the rest of the world. All transportation including flights, trains, subways, even personal automobiles etc., have been suspended until further notice. There is very limited supply of gas in all gas station in Wuhan. All schools have been cancelled. For quarantine purpose, no single Wuhan resident is allowed to leave the city.   Here are some reports from major media about this critical situation.     https://www.cnn.com/asia/live-news/coronavirus-outbreak-hnk-intl-01-24-20/index.html      https://www.cnn.com/asia/live-news/wuhan-coronavirus-china-intl-hnk/index.html      https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/22/world/asia/china-coronavirus-travel.html      https://www.houstonpublicmedia.org/articles/news/health-science/2020/01/23/358285/officials-investigating-suspected-case-of-coronavirus-in-brazos-county/    As a native from the city of Wuhan, I am heartbroken about this situation. I am currently a biomedical scientist in Houston; both of my parents are doctors in a major hospital in Wuhan. They witness more and more patients, as well as doctors are infected by this lethal virus. The only way that can effectively prevent this virus from spreading is as simple as Personal Protective Equipment (PPE), such as  surgical masks ,  N95 aspirators, safety glasses and goggles, and   protective coveralls . Unfortunately, there are more than 11 million people living in Wuhan; currently PPE is extremely short of supply in Wuhan, as well as in the rest area of China. Even worse,  today is the Chinese New Year of Mouse . Millions of people are suffering and their lives are in danger. Production and supply of PPE in China has no way to meet the demand in a timely manner.  We are wondering if any of you can help in any ways, such as funds donation, and/or donation of any number of PPE, and/or help with getting any PPE donation from major manufacturers in the States. I will then coordinate to have them shipped to China as soon as I can.    Earlier, Better.  It will not only help people in Wuhan, but provide further protection for people all of the world, including your beloved ones, from being infected by this contiguous life-threatening virus. I currently live in Houston. I am more than happy to coordinate and help by all means, and make it possible.    Where the funds go, and how the funds are used, will be frequently updated here with all available validated documentation.   (Update 1/28/2020)  One of our local ambassadors in Wuhan, Sibo (Bob) Hu, took this video at his home in Wuhan today 1/28/2020. He sincerely asks your help for relieve this critical situation.¬†   Here is the Youtube link:   https://youtu.be/xWtK_SjpcLI             Any help is greatly appreciated!  Happy New Year of Mouse! Wish you all the best!

campaigns.title: Supplies to Combat the Corona Virus
campaigns.description: January 25, 2019, marks the beginning of the Chinese New Year, but the citizens of Wuhan are experiencing anything but prosperity. The recent outbreak of coronavirus has devastated the population, with thousands already confirmed to be infected and climbing death tolls every day. Hospitals throughout the province are suffering from an undersupply of medical resources and are pleading for outside support. Recently, a doctor died combatting the virus because they did not have enough protection.  Many people like me have relatives who live in China and are living in constant fear of infection with no way to escape. My uncle's family and my cousins are currently quarantined in the province, and I am personally very worried for their well-being.   I have contacts with hospital officials and medical organizations in Wuhan linked to HUST, where my uncle works. This money will go towards protective gear such as goggles, face masks, and disposable coats that doctors currently need. Details are provided in the "donating" section of this document.  A famous phrase in Chinese is "‰ºóÂøóÊàêÂüé" (United as one). I believe that this community is a supportive platform for fundraising efforts and knowledge of current world issues. If everyone contributes a small amount, our efforts will become a powerful force in the fight against this calamity.

We are hoping that by helping those in need it'll also help not just them but the virus itself from spreading. We are trying to get proper marks sent into as china is in a great shortage with people selling reused masks which just help it spread faster.¬†  Any amounts will be greatly appreciated as I'm organizing to send masks already to families in China. Please give generously!!¬†

campaigns.title: China WuHan Fight Coronavirus
campaigns.description: Hello everyone, I am Bin Ni (my real name). I am from Shanghai, China. I am an international student in Vancouver BC. I am organizing fundraising to support Wuhan and China fighting coronavirus. All the donations will be donated to Wuhan Red Cross every two to three days instead of waiting for hitting the target because it is very URGENT!   I hope anyone who lives on this earth can join this fight and nib this threat at the beginning. In order to do that, Wuhan China needs help from all of you.  As we all know, the coronavirus that starts from Wuhan China is very deadly and can be transmitted through the air. No known treatment has been proven effective toward the coronavirus. The reported cases have been doubled several times over the last two weeks. Confirmed cases have reached 1362 in mainland China and other 38 confirmed cases have been reported all over the world.   Feb 24th is Lunar new year for Chinese people which means it is when Chinese goes home and unite with families and celebrate. This means that most organizations and even the government are functioning with very few staff and resources. This makes fighting this battle so much harder at the beginning and has made a time window that can effectively contain the virus much smaller.  Wuhan hospitals‚Äô medical workers are working three shifts a day for the last two weeks due to an overwhelming number of patients and limited staff.  Overworked Chinese doctor collapses from exhaustion   https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PoZHhPr9Xx8   Chinese hospital staff in Wuhan face fears amid a frontline battle against coronavirus outbreak   https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f7llqJcvkxM   Wuhan Coronavirus outbreak: pity doctor crying   https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ozpoRDm4zCA   you may not understand Chinese, but I believe you can hear desperation from his voice.  15 medical workers have been contracted with the virus and one doctor Lian Wudong has sacrificed his life in this battle. Here is a video to mourn this hero.   https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XyOXPhSsfNI   Why Wuhan needs your support and how bad the situation is right now??  If you are only reading news from western media, you may not feel as related as I do. I will explain this to you in examples you may feel more relaxed.  Wuhan is the biggest city in Hubei Province. They have the best hospital, medical equipment and doctors in the provinces. Yet they are still struggling not only because the virus is impossible to treat at this stage but also they don‚Äôt have enough medical supplies like goggles, masks, protective suits. Other cities and towns in Hubei Province, many of them are, I don‚Äôt want to say this but, are third-world and there are huge populations in those cities. This is actually the worst part of all situation. An outbreak can happen at any moment.  I will continue to add more information to this post.  If you are in Vancouver and willing to meet me in person, I will be happy to meet you. We can come together and strategize a bigger plan to prepare for the worst situation.  I will also connect universities and colleges to join us in fundraising.  ¬†No preparation will be too much until the virus is fully contained and completely eliminated from this earth.     ¬†  1.¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Donation Channel 1: All the donation will go to Wuhan Red Cross (this is the one you are reading right now)  2.¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Donation Channel 2: All the donations will be used to order a medical supply for Wuhan Hospital. The factory in China will take the order and manufacture supplies and sent them directly to Wuhan hospitals. (Will be opened in next few days)  All the activities will be posted on social media and can be monitored by anyone.

campaigns.title: Medical Masks for Wuhan Coronavirus
campaigns.description: China is facing a major virus outbreak. Now, the whole entire population have high demands for medical masks (3M). Not only does the public need these to protect themselves, doctors and nurses are in need for these masks. Medical masks are selling out in China, let's raise money to buy medical masks for the people who need them in the Wuhan crisis.  I am a high school student with a Chinese background. Having parents who immigrated from China almost 10 years ago, I still have relatives and friends living in China. There is no doubt that I am worried about them with the highly contagious virus surrounding them.¬†  With more people being admitted to hospitals, the virus is spreading, and doctors and nurses are in need for medical equipment. As doctors and nurses attempt to save patients, masks are very critical to them as they can prevent the virus from spreading. 15 nurses have confirmed to be in contact with the virus due to attempting to save others, but more have yet to come. These people in the medical field are spending time in the hospital saving lives rather than celebrating the 2020 Chinese new year, they should be appreciated and also supported. Not only in the medical field, masks are also worn by the public. These single use masks are bought and thrown everyday, and the demand for these only increase. As many places are in need for masks, I hope to raise money to support hospital facilities in China.¬†  While normal masks are good, we need to buy N95 medical masks. These masks are more safe and are used in hospital facilities. I hope to raise money to buy these masks, then ship them to hospitals in China to save lives.¬†  I hope to: 1) Raise enough money and reach our goal 2) Buy N95 medical masks¬† 3) Ship to Wuhan XieHe hospital, Wuhan Medical Treatment Center (JingYiTan Hospital)) along with other hospitals that need it.¬†  It would be so kind of you for your support, every penny counts. :)    https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/25/world/asia/china-coronavirus.html    Edit/Update: First batch ordered! Waiting for masks to arrive then I will ship them off!

campaigns.title: TO STOP CORONA-VIRUS from spreading
campaigns.description: Corona virus is spreading fast and families and friends need help this money will be spent on masks and Special sanitizers for those in need so please help as much as you can so this nasty killing virus won‚Äôt kill anymore Americans. The masks and sanitizers will be send to the Alaskan region first then nyc then Chicago for the poor or in need individuals.¬†

campaigns.title: Collegiate School CAIPA Coronavirus Fundraiser
campaigns.description: By now, many of you have probably heard of the Chinese coronavirus spreading throughout Asia and now spreading to Europe, Australia, and even the United States.   The purpose of this fundraiser is to gather money for the CAIPA Foundation, which will partner with organizations to provide aid to Wuhan. As Wuhan is desperately trying to quarantine and supply medical support to all infected, they need supplies.  Together we can aid Wuhan in their fight against this deadly disease and prevent a worldwide pandemic.¬†  All money raised goes directly to the CAIPA Foundation, which is a non-profit organization that partners with many NYC hospitals. It is the foundation for the Chinese American IPA (CAIPA).¬†  For more information about the coronavirus:¬†  As of 1/25/20: The  Health Commission of Hubei Province  reports that the total number of deaths linked to the fast-spreading virus in China is up to 41, three of which were outside of Wuhan Province.  There are also now 1,372 confirmed cases across China, though most are concentrated in those provinces closest to Hubei, as seen below.  As of 1/26/20: Canada has now reported its first confirmed case of the coronavirus, and the United States just had another case in Orange County, California. That brings the total number of cases to 3 in the united states, and the worldwide death toll has increased to 56. Worldwide confirmed cases of the coronavirus has now reached 2,019     As of 1/29/20: The death toll has risen to 132 in China, with 6,078 confirmed cases of infection as of Wednesday evening local time ‚Äî a day-over-day increase of more than 1,000. Other countries in the region also are reporting more people infected ‚Äî nearly all of them tourists from China.   As of 1/30/20: The number of deaths in China reaches 213, while confirmed infections near 10,000. The new coronavirus has been declared a global emergency by the World Health Organization, as the outbreak continues to spread outside China. (There had been 98 cases in 18 other countries, but no deaths).   There have been eight cases of human-to-human infection - in Germany, Japan, Vietnam, and the United States.    To see an updated map of the spread of the virus:    https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2020/01/22/mapping-spread-new-coronavirus/?arc404=true  ¬†  Countries and territories that have confirmed cases: Thailand, Japan, Hong Kong, Singapore, Taiwan, Australia, Malaysia, Macau, Russia, France, the United States, South Korea, Germany, the United Arab Emirates, Canada, Britain, Vietnam, Italy, India, the Philippines, Nepal, Cambodia, Sri Lanka, and Finland.    Cases recorded in Thailand, Taiwan, Germany, Vietnam, Japan, France, and the United States¬†involved patients who had not been to China.

campaigns.title: The people vs Corona virus
campaigns.description:
Hello,  If you read this you are probably aware of the current situation regarding the  Corona  virus that is making people in China sick and eventually even die.  At the moment i am in China because i wanted to celebrate Chinese new year so i am in the middle of all the problems that are occur at the moment. the sick people that cant reach out for an hospital are laying on the streets because there are not enough beds and space. But instead of only reading about all the problems i feel the need of helping out the people in the infected area.  I think that the best place to gather money for the people that need it the most is here on the platform gofundme. if anyone has any other ideas to help out the people in china send me an email ‚Äújurrys@outlook.com‚Äù  even if you dont want to donate money but you have supplies like facemasks and gloves it would be much apreciated. We need to stop the virus from spreading around and stop this disaster from getting even bigger.  lets  unite ¬†and help out the victims of this virus.  
 

   Update  4/02/2020. The victims that are infected at the moment is over 20.000 and the people that have died is 425. Those numbers are to big because its hard for al these people to get the medical supplies and protection that they need.  Ive spend almost al my savings just to hand out facemasks and gloves for everyone that wants it but its just not enough.

campaigns.title: Covid 19 - in LA. Protect our community.
campaigns.description: I am raising money to buy and transport n-95 masks and individual hand sanitizers to the homeless population in West Los Angeles and hopefully beyond.¬†¬†  ¬† As you may know the Wuhan Caronavirus has quickly made it to the United States. Recently a traveler from China by way of Mexico City landed at LAX. It was a random screening that they found this person to have symptoms of this virus.¬† CDC directed this person to the hospital immediately.¬†   ¬† Towards the end of January a scheduled flight of private citizens from Wuhan will land at SFO. We have not as a country,¬† state or planet quarantined this virus.¬† There will hopefully be a vaccine,¬† but that will take months.¬† It is a very real illness and only in it's infancy.¬†¬†  ¬† Many may get ill, but won't die.¬† It has been suggested by the CDC¬† based on previous carona virus outbreaks (SARS, MERS) that the people most at risk will be those who are most vulnerable and disadvantaged.¬† Underlying health conditions is seen in homelessness at an alarmingly high rate.¬† The lack of resources,¬† education and safety will put them at risk for catching this virus.¬†¬†  ¬†They live in our communities, we see them every day. That alone puts us at risk, too.¬† This is highly contagious and is thought to be spread via respiratory droplets, but it is also demonstrating that it can spread exponentially from a point of contact.¬† Meaning you don't have to be exposed to the sick person¬† to get the virus.  ¬† N-95 masks¬† protect and prevent droplet transmission.¬† Alcohol sanitization promotes good hygiene and is recommended by the CDC to be included in prevention measures.¬†¬†  ¬† The masks are expensive and it's not realistic to believe that the homeless could afford one if they knew they needed it. Education is essential.¬†¬†  ¬† I will go out into the community and reach out to those willing to be educated and provide them with supplies to protect themselves.¬† This to help out not only the homeless, but our community as well.   ¬† My experience to take on this project is 10+ years working as an ER/ICU nurse in¬† America's largest busiest hospitals, including those right here in Los Angeles. I have a lot of experience interacting with homeless and reaching out to meet their needs. I have also worked as a nurse educator, a pharmaceutical research developer, legal nurse consulting and most importantly a patient advocate.¬†  ¬†I get good results.¬† I want to help.¬†¬†  ¬†I have some volunteers that will be working with me as well. If you'd like to donate your time please contact me.¬†  CDC reference  https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/index.html

campaigns.title: Help Control SARI-NovelCoronavirus  in Wuhan CHINA
campaigns.description: Houston International Cultural Center (HICC) want you join us in making a difference!!  With the pandemic spread of a Novel¬† Coronavirus (2019-nCoV) in Wuhan, China, thousands of people there have been infected by this virus and suffered from the deadly pneumonia. It is predicted that this virulent virus may spread quickly in China and globally to many countries including the United States. In fact, at least one patient in Texas was suspected to have the virus infection. We, the Houston International Cultural Center (HICC), an 501C(3) non-profit community organization, is raising funds and collecting protective medical supplies such as masks for people who are infected by 2019-nCoV in China. We greatly appreciate your donations and any donation will make an impact for the people who are struggling in sickness or in high risk of being infected. We thank you in advance for your generous contribution to this humane cause. Please join us to make a difference!¬†  The Houston International Cultural Center (HICC) is committed to serve local communities in Houston and Texas through multicultural communications, arts, culture, education, and other services. We sincerely invite you to join this team effort, we firmly believe that together we can make a difference for the world!  Masks and other protective medical supplies are necessity for people's protection in such a serious virus infection. In many places of China, masks are already sold out of stock. HICC is raising funds and the funds will be donated, together with collected protective masks and other medical supplies, to the hospitals in Wuhan, China. We have arranged procurement and transportation of the supplies to the hospitals in need, and proper measures are ensured that local doctors and patients have access to the donated supplies. campaigns.title: Ê±üËãèÁúÅ (Jiangsu) Fighting Coronavirus Outbreak
campaigns.description: Coronavirus, a newly discovered illness that can evolve, infect humans, and spread between humans, is threatening hundreds of millions of people's life. The outbreak started in China, Wuhan, in December 2019. It is more contagious than SARS. Currently, there is NO cure for this illness. According to the government's report, in China, 2785 people have been diagnosed with coronavirus. 5794 people are suspected of being infected. 81 people have died. The actual number of infections and deaths is much bigger than the reported ones. Due to the lack of facilities and sickbed positions in hospitals, many people are only waiting for deaths at home.¬† Every day hundreds of people are diagnosed with coronavirus. Wuhan, a city of eleven million people, has temporarily shut down to inhibit the rapid spreading of the virus.¬† Medical facilities, food, and masks have been depleted. The only masks that work to prevent infection are n95, 3M, and surgical masks. However, they can only be used for 4 hours per mask. Thus, not even Chinese citizens, doctors and nurses who are treating the infected patients are facing the scarcity of masks. Worse, five millions of Wuhan citizens have fled to other cities of China before the shutdown, which means the number of potentially infected people is unimaginable. China estimates that the peak of the infection rate will be around mid-February, meaning the most devastating crisis has yet to come. In all Chinese cities, schools are delayed and all public facilities are shut down.¬†  Moreover, coronavirus has spread overseas. According to CNN, there are more than 50 confirmed cases in 13 places outside of mainland China, including at least five in the United States. Furthermore, people can spread the virus before symptoms show.¬†  Facing the devil himself, instead of retreating to obtain a chance of living, thousands of Chinese doctors and nurses voluntarily signed petitions to treat infected patients. Now, at least 30 doctors and nurses have been infected. Some have already passed away. Hundreds of millions of Chinese people's lives are at stake. The only way we can help them is to purchase a massive amount of masks, goggles, protective suits, and medical facilities, and transport them to China. This takes lots of money. We need your help to fight against this menacing illness.
