campaigns.title: care about corona virus
campaigns.description: we fight the corona virus together  The number of deaths due to Coronavirus Novel (2019-nCoV) or COVID-19, continues to double around 100 lives each day. Today, as of 08.20 Jakarta time, there were 44,911 cases infected with Corona Virus, 1,114 of whom died, and 4,699 others were declared recovered. It was based on data compiled by Johns Hopkins University Center for Systems Science and Engineering (JHU CCSE).  If calculated from the previous day, today has added 1,770 new cases that have been infected, claimed 96 lives, and 359 people have been cured.  Based on data released by WHO yesterday: In Singapore, there were 47 cases of someone infected with the Corona Virus, 23 of whom were traced to have a travel history from China. Whereas in the Philippines there were 3 cases and 1 person died because of this virus. Then in other nearby countries of Indonesia: 15 cases in Malaysia, 15 Australia, 33 Thailand, and 15 Vietnam.  World Health Organization (WHO) Director General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus confirmed that 42,708 confirmed patients were located in China. A total of 1,017 people in the country have died due to Corona Virus. The highest mortality rate is in Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.  "Outside of China, there are 393 cases in 24 countries, and 1 death," Ghebreyesus said yesterday.  Ghebreyesus asserted, since yesterday, the number of deaths has exceeded a thousand. He warned of the global threat of death from the Corona Virus, potentially worse than terrorism.  "Viruses can have stronger consequences than any terrorist act," he said.  The Indonesian government, until now still claims that no Corona Virus has been detected in the country. Minister of Health Terawan Agus Putranto asserted, until now the filtering pattern carried out has been in accordance with international standards.  "Everything has been checked. Our equipment has been fixed yesterday with the US Embassy, ‚Äã‚Äãwe are using kits (equipment) from America," Terawan said yesterday.

campaigns.title: AMERICAN CORONAVIRUS PATIENT
campaigns.description: Hello,¬† My son, Emmanuel, and I were evacuated from Wuhan on the 4th of February by the US embassy. My wife was not able to leave on the evac flight, because she is a Chinese citizen who only has a tourist visa and not a green card.¬† In addition, her father is infected with the corona virus and she wanted to stay to take care of him. Since we arrived in the US, his condition have seriously declined.¬† His oxygen level plummeted to 70, from 99 just two days before.¬† ¬†We are waiting for CT scans, but we were told he is dying.¬† The hospitals won't admit him to the intensive care unit because there are no beds available.¬†¬†  Three months ago, we lost her mother to a massive stroke.¬† This is just too much for us, especially my wife and son, who constantly asks where "Nai Nai" is (grandma). If the worst happens, my wife would not be able to hold a traditional funeral, as bodies are immediately sequestered and cremated, without the family being around.¬†¬†  We hope that with this money, we can help pay our bills in America for Emmanuel and I.¬† The quarantine is free, but flights out of California to family in the East coast is very expensive, as was the 3,600 dollar trip from China.¬† We also hope to be able to get my wife here with us.¬† I can't imagine her going through another funeral, all alone this time. We hope to use the funds to pay for our expenses here in American, but also to send much needed supplies to my wife in China.¬† Roads and public transport in the city are closed and medication is extremely hard to get a hold of.¬† Even face masks are being sold one per person. Now that my baby is safe, my concern is making things easier for my wife, as much as possible.¬† We miss her dearly and I know what she is going through with her father, without her family to support her, is destroying here.¬† I don‚Äôt know what to do, but I want to try anything I can. With your donations, I hope to be able to pay for these unexpected expenses. These include repaying the US government 3,600 dollars for the flight to New York, additional flights to my families home in Philadelphia, clothing for my three year old (we were told to pack light and the weather where we live is much warmer than in Philadelphia ). In addition, since Chinese banks only issue one bank card per account, we decided my wife should keep it so she can pay for medical bills there, but food, pay rent, etc. As such, paying for necessities here in America will be a challenge. Also, in the unfortunate occurrence that my son and I need medical care (I take prescription medicine) my insurance is not valid in the United States. Finally, we hope to be able to fly my wife to America, to reunite our family Thank you for taking the time to read this and thank you for any donation you may give.

campaigns.title: Face-off Against Coronavirus
campaigns.description: Residents of China have been suffering from the spread of the deadly Coronavirus. The disease has spread to many other countries with 1,700 dead globally and over 69,000 affected as of Feb. 16th. The residents of China have been experiencing a shortage on face masks, which can greatly aid in the prevention of the virus' spread. With this fundraiser, we hope to raise funds in order to purchase face masks, which we will send to organizations in Wuhan as well as other affected areas.  For more information, you can read the following articles:    https://www.google.com/amp/s/www.nytimes.com/2020/01/23/health/coronavirus-surgical-masks.amp.html      https://www.reuters.com/article/us-china-health-usa-masks-idUSKBN1ZN2H4      https://www.cnn.com/2020/01/26/asia/wuhan-coronavirus-update-intl-hnk/index.html      https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/26/world/china-coronavirus.html

campaigns.title: Blood cancer
campaigns.description: watching this child fight hard to survive blood cancer was the most heartbreaking thing for us. i could not afford his chemo and that's when i set up a fundraiser on. today receives regular chemotherapy sessions thank for the generosity of so many doors need

campaigns.title: Student Hunger Corona Virus Crisis Fund
campaigns.description: Student Hunger Corona Virus Crisis Fund   Raising money for a fantastic cause. I am a America English Teacher in Guangzhou China.   I have over 400 students in a crisis because of the coronavirus. My students are not be able to return to work and have not the money or supplies to maintain an basic lifestyle of food for their families.   My goal is to ask for help for the 400 students families, so they can survive.   Please hurry, they need help ASAP.

campaigns.title: Corona Virus
campaigns.description: We are aiming to help treat people with corona virus who can not afford the treatment

campaigns.title: Help a Teacher during the Corona Virus Outbreak
campaigns.description: Hello, I am currently an elementary teacher in Hanoi, Vietnam. It‚Äôs a very rewarding and exciting job- that is when the COVID-19 aka Corona Virus doesn‚Äôt force the schools to close. The information about the closures has come to the public schools within a days‚Äô notice one week at a time. It has been proposed by Ho Chi Minh city that schools could stay closed until April. I am on forced unpaid leave and it is likely going to last 2 months.¬† During this time of uncertainty we don‚Äôt know until when as the information comes out at the last minute.  ¬†I really miss teaching my students and guiding them to enjoy learning English through games, activities, and prizes.     Since I can‚Äôt teach my students due to the forced shut down, I would like to do something more useful and meaningful with my time. Instead of hiding from the Virus in my little apartment in Hanoi for another month, I‚Äôve decided to try and make the most of my time to go back to volunteering for a bit. So, I am asking if anyone would like to help me make it to Nepal/ or the Philippines, wherever the need is the greatest and cheapest to volunteer. ¬†  ¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† I am 100% committed to using my skills and time volunteering during this break so I will make whatever I get work! So, every dollar, penny, dong, like, share, or positive message you can share, whatever you can throw my way counts! I have already been approved to go volunteer so now I just need to get there!!! Thank you for reading/sharing  3  Some of the cost include the transportation, visa, food/accommodations, and some materials needed. If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to ask!

campaigns.title: Coronavirus emergency relief fund
campaigns.description:
The recent news of the Coronavirus spreading in ¬†China has our flights cancelled for another (2) ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†months. the best thing about flying to Beijing over the past 10 years has been getting to know kind. ¬† ¬† generous people who give their time to take such ¬†good care of us while we are in Beijing.. when we ¬† ¬†resume our flight schedules will our favorite vendors still be there? Will they be able to keep ¬†the shop open when he has no business??? For all the love and care he has given to us over theyears, please let‚Äôs band together and get him and. ¬† his family through this devastating personal and ¬† ¬† financial experience. as of tomorrow the Chinese government has said. ¬†they hope to have the virus under control and the ¬†cities back to normal by the end of April. If we ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†could band together and help him cover his shoppe rent he may be able to survive the crisis.¬†
 

 Wong ¬†Fei has always been so good to us...let‚Äôs get him the help he and his family needs to survive...  There is no amount too small....I know what he hascharged me every time I went to see him..and how well he too care of me....this month I am donating. ¬†the amount I would have spent if I had been able to fly this month..PLEASE¬†think about what he means to you and why the value of his services staying in businsss are to you....please donate what you can...and spread the word to our sisters in the sky!!!!

campaigns.title: Yesenia Corona (Jackie)
campaigns.description:
Hello family and friends, 
 

 On Saturday, February 8, 2020 at approximately 10:30 pm in Las Vegas, NV, my niece Jackie was involved in a hit and run accident. Her vehicle overturned and is now a complete loss. She was in the vehicle with her youngest son Jovanni Miraculously, my nephew was not physically hurt as of now but we worry about psychological well being, but Jackie was not quite so lucky. She suffered a dislocated shoulder, broken collarbone, shattered elbow, broken ribs and extensive damage to her hand and fingers. She has undergone several hours of surgery to save her fingers, which at one point they thought they would have to amputate. She will undergo more surgeries this coming week and will also require physical therapy. She currently remains in the ICU unit. Her husband is the only one employed at this time but Jackie would like him by her side, which is understandable. I created this Go Fund Me account to raise funds to help with her family with medical bills, expenses and child care. We are unsure at this time when she will return to work. Please help us by donating or sharing this post with friends and family members. We thank you very much for your support during these hard times.

campaigns.title: Fund Local Town Preventative Corona Virus Items!
campaigns.description: I'm a regular day to day person who just really enjoys helping others, and what better time than right now to help buy sanitizer, Lysol, face masks, food for infected ppl   their pets since they can't leave the house, thermometers, etc to help cut back significantly on the chances of the corona virus spreading. If we do not take preventative measures right now we are going to only further spread this virus thus causing people to be forced into quarantine which is going to cause financial struggles for SO many people. Our economy needs to thrive not dive! Every little bit helps   it's in everyone's interest to take these precautions. Thank you in advance, truly...‚ù£Ô∏è

campaigns.title: Coronavirus Animal Cruelty Relief Fund
campaigns.description: Please support and SHARE this effort before it is too late! The longer we wait, more and more animal victims suffer every single day. Let's stop this extremely sad situation while we can!  --   As more and more  reports¬π   begin¬≤ ¬† to  emerge¬≥ ¬† (as well as devastating  videos‚Å¥ ¬†) of the massive amount of animal cruelty happening in China as a result of the panic surrounding the Coronavirus outbreak. With the amount of attention given to the human victims and preventative efforts, it's a crucial time to give attention to the situation affecting animals as well.  Warning: Graphic Image Below    In addition to the (currently) 70,000+ person confirmed cases, reports of thousands of pets being affected as a result of the scare. People are leaving homes quickly and abandoning their pets resulting in starvation and accidental deaths. Even more shocking are the reports (and graphic videos) of the slaying of stray animals in a disgustingly misguided effort to limit the spread of the virus.  Warning: Graphic Image Below    Since the vast majority of the current efforts are focused on the human victims and preventative efforts, we've organized a plan with local volunteers already in the Hubei province and surrounding areas. Money from this fundraiser will be used for food, shelter, and caretaking for animals in the most affected areas.      We only share these devastating photos to shine light on the current reality of the situation which isn't being given much attention.

campaigns.title: COVID-19 Donation
campaigns.description: Fighting COVID-19

campaigns.title: Fight COVID-19, Stand with Wuhan
campaigns.description: Change a Life Today. Donate now. ¬† Dear friends,  COVID-19 doesn‚Äôt discriminate against our race, age, gender or nationality. Helping people in Wuhan, the epicentre of the deadly coronavirus outbreak to contain the spread of the epidemic is helping ourselves.  A plague at such scale would be disastrous for any city in the world. All hospitals in Wuhan reported low stock on medical supplies as they are experiencing an unprecedented patients intake each day.  Frontline healthcare professionals and first responders, amidst the lunar New Year holiday, are working 24/7 to treat the sick, save lives and bring this outbreak under control. They skip meals and washroom breaks in order to save on disposal of protective coveralls.  The emerging, rapidly evolving situation touches the hearts of billions of people worldwide.  This coronavirus relief campaign aims to provide desperately needed medical supplies such as masks, hazmat suits and gloves to the frontline healthcare workers and hospitals in Wuhan, to help prevent the spread of the virus.  To date, 40,000 pairs of gloves and 10,000 isolation gowns are en route to Wuhan. Protective goggles, impact-proof masks and hazmat suits worth $25,000 are being purchased.  We are proud to announce our partnership with the Crackup Ottawa Comedy Festival! A portion of their ticket sales for DASHAN AND FRIENDS on Thursday, March 26 and CRACKUP OTTAWA FESTIVAL FINALE on Friday, March 27 will be donated to our coronavirus relief. Details of the events can be found here -   http://www.crackup.ca/events  .  Crackup Ottawa will also be promoting our ‚ÄúGoFundMe‚Äù campaign with the goal of raising an additional $100,000 in private and corporate donations from the Ottawa and Canadian comedy community.

campaigns.title: Wuhan Coronavirus
campaigns.description: Hello everyone, My name is Kirsten and i am a Chinese Australian living in Melbourne. As a Chinese, I feel the need to help my people in need.¬† As you all know, the Corona Virus disease has claimed the lives of over 1000 people and over 70,000 people are affected with the numbers going up every single day.  Hospitals in Wuhan are running out of medical supplies and the money donated will go towards hardworking medical staff who are risking their lives to help fight the virus and victims affected by the deadly virus. It will also go towards buying protective supplies from around the world and send it to hospitals in Wuhan and all the small cities in the Hubei province. for patients and medical workers to ensure they are safe and protected from the virus.¬†  The money donated will go into buying N95 masks from different places around the world, these masks will go to medical workers and people in Wuhan and the other small cities in the Hubei province, those people have less access to medical supplies but the virus there is just as deadly.¬†  The masks will also go to regular citizens in Wuhan and Hubei province who may not have enough money to buy masks as many sellers have raised the price of face masks when people need them most to ridiclously high prices.  You may not know this but Hospitals in Wuhan right now are a living hell, hospitals have run out of beds for patients and medical supplies like masks are running low. People are collapsing in hospital hallways and medical workers are working hours non stop to save lives. Doctors and nurses and other medical staff have been infected by the virus and are dying every single day.  Even a bit of your money can help those people in desperate need, although this might not affect your daily lives, people in Wuhan are in a living hell right now. As humans, we must stick together during tough times and together we can help fight this virus.¬†  If you cannot donate, please share this around and help spread awareness, thank you for your kindness and willingness to help. Ê≠¶Ê±âÂä†Ê≤π!!   I will keep you guys updated :)¬† ¬†  Here are some links and videos of the situation in Wuhan right now   https://youtu.be/OSi9fCSZbgE      https://youtu.be/XAHOnZNRvZI  ¬†   https://youtu.be/2Dpf7pli5Ag  ¬†   https://youtu.be/m6S51KPWKCY

campaigns.title: Coronavirus supplies are needed in Xiangyang,Hubei
campaigns.description: Chinese health officials reported on 02/13/2020 that there had been 1,491 deaths from the outbreak and 64,658 cases of the coronavirus in China. (cnn.com) Wuhan suffered a considerable loss, China and the world focused on Wuhan. Lots of resources are shipped to Wuhan. However, besides Wuhan, the other small cities in Hubei province also suffered the impacts from the coronavirus. The growing number of patients and questioning cases put significant pressure on the hospitals of the smaller cities. Comparing to Wuhan, these cities are in shortage of medical resources. They need help from us!  Xiangyang has 5.6 million population, has confirmed 441 coronavirus patients. Because there are not enough testing equipment and medical resources, a lot of suspected patients have to isolate themselves home. Now, we are working with Xiangyang Integration of Traditional Chinese and Western Medicine Hospital, which was appointed as the coronavirus patient treatment hospital on 01/25/2020. My friend Xinhui Gao and I (Zijing Zhu) contacted a medical worker in the hospital. They are still in the condition of lacking the essential medical supplies such as masks, surgical goggles, and protective suits. We want to do what we can to help the situation, and your generous contribution will help the hospital to acquire the medical necessities. We hope that our donation will help beat the coronavirus!  Information about the account that we are donating to:    Here's a video of the current medical condition in China:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TCpQXza2mFs

campaigns.title: Help Henan Fight through Coronavirus
campaigns.description: Dear all,  The Coronavirus (2019-nCoV) is now rapidly spreading throughout China. As of February 10th 2020 , 40,265 persons were confirmed of being diagnosed with the 2019-nCoV, with 909 deaths so far. As time goes, the confirmed case dramatically emerged in Henan Province, as of February 10th (Henan local time) 1073 cases were confirmed with 6 deaths and 187 cures. In the fight against the pneumonia epidemic of the new coronavirus infection, the biggest challenge is the shortage of medical supplies/consumables which are the key to protect medical service providers, including thousands of doctors and nurses who are doing their best to resuscitate patients in critical conditions and save the lives of infected patients, some patients are their peer doctors/nurses who were unfortunately sickened by this disease. We witness that they were fighting relentlessly in dangerous situations to help cure Chinese patients and to control the spread of this contagious disease from infecting more people outside of China.   Henan University Alumni Association in the United States would like to unite our efforts to provide stronger help and charity support to the hospitals and patients in Henan Province, with the hope to save more lives and prevent doctors/nurses being affected by the virus with more needed resources.  We are here to sincerely call on for any support and contribution in any format, i.e. funds, medical supplies/consumables, medical resources and support, and so forth. Our overseas fundraising channel is now open and all-out efforts are being made to open overseas materials transportation and fundraising channels, we will ensure your support and funds are transferred to the people in need.  We appeal to all people with kindness and love. Please join us in making an impact and your help will be highly appreciated.   Plan on how to use funds: With the funds raised, we are going to purchase medical consumables in urgent needs as the following: Surgical mask, Medical N95 Mask, safety goggles, protective eyewear, protective cap, medical protective suit, etc.   We will purchase medical consumables in USA, then coordinate with major airlines to ship all materials/supplies to Henan Province in China. Charity funds and resources will be donated to the major hospitals in the cities of Xinyang, Nanyang, Zhumadian, Zhengzhou and many more in Henan Province which are more in urgent needs.   Updates and photos on how the charity funds are used and where your donation goes will be updated on this website. Our alumni will announce the fundraising amount in real time and ensure that all the funds received be used properly and at donors' wish to better prevent the epidemic from further spreading.¬†  With your help, we firmly believe that we will definitely succeed in this fight against 2019-CoronaVirus!   For any question or concern, please contact us, henanalumni.usa@gmail.com.  THANK YOU! campaigns.title: Help Wuhan and Other Cities Defeat COVID-19
campaigns.description: Keep Helping China! Keep Saving Lives! Help Reconstruction!¬†  The outbreak of the novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) is sill under way in China, especially in Wuhan and other cities in Hubei province. Wuhan and at least 15 other cities (including Huanggang, Huangshi, Jingzhou, Yichang, ... ) have been quarantined as China attempts to halt the spread of the coronavirus. That's more than 50 million people on lockdown. Plenty of stress but shortage of everything else for these cities. There are not enough hospitals and not enough beds, not enough doctors and not enough nurses, not enough rubber gloves and not enough face masks. Millions of people are suffering from infections, panic attacks, and even death in these lockdown cities. Things are worst in many small cities.¬†  Lots of families are faced with the difficult task of recovery and reconstruction after disaster. Many of them lost their family members during outbreak. Many of them have serious after-effects of a disaster, especially for children and young people.¬† Many of them are devastated by the coronavirus . They need help. They need our support.¬†  Let's help China defeat 2019-nCov.¬† We will continue to help persons in affected areas of China (Wuhan and other seriously affected cities) to overcome this crisis and build back their life. We believe unity is strength; we beliveve faith will overcome panic attacks; and we believe we can win the battle against the virus.¬†  The donations will be used to purchase medical supplies for medical staff and people who are fighting against the 2019-nCoV in Wuhan and other cities. The donations will also be used for helping hard-hit families during the outbreak and after disaster.¬†  This donation campaign is launched by our Chinese community from Greater Memphis United Chinese Association, University of Memphis, University of Tenenssee, St. Jude Children's Research Hospital, Memphis Chinese Evangelical Church, the Confucius Insititute at the University of Memphis and other organizations at Memphis.  Contact:  Xinhua Yu¬† ¬† xyu2@memphis.edu  Zhaohui Wu¬† ¬† zwu6@uthsc.edu  Liang Hong¬† ¬† lhong2@uthsc.edu  Fei Zheng¬† ¬† fei.zheng@stjude.org  Dan Ye¬† ¬† dye1@memphis.edu  Liang Zhang¬† ¬† lzhang13@memphis.edu

Whit 88,000 already infected across 65 countries and 3,000 deaths... we need to act quickly.Medical masks help prevent the spread of the virus.Gleaning has the masks... and the partners to receive and distribute the mask overseas... but fund need to be raised to continue sending these critically-needed masks! Will you please help?

campaigns.title: Wedding Fundraising for Combating COVID-19
campaigns.description: We are getting married! As we learn how to plan a wedding, we found out that we should have a registry for our guests. While we could easily put together a long list, we also noticed that none of the items on the wish list matter to us that much. The items that we would put on a registry will make our life marginally better such as a nice vacuum or a new watch, however, we believe that your money could be used in more meaningful ways - such as saving lives.¬†   Since the outbreak of the coronavirus in Wuhan, more than 70,000 people have been infected and more than 1,500 have died globally, making it a more damaging epidemic than SARS.¬†   In one local hospital in Wuhan, nearly 3 in 10 patients are health professionals, according to a study published in the Journal of the American Medical Association ( link ).¬†   Among the health professionals who are fighting against the virus, many have to   work for extended hours and isolate themselves from their families for weeks. All of these are happening whilst there's a severe shortage of basic medical supplies such as surgical masks and protective clothing. Many doctors have to reuse protective goggles that are meant for single-use and use tapes to DIY their protective clothing ( NYTimes ¬†).    Figure: A vigil in Hong Kong for Dr. Li Wenliang who died from the coronavirus. He was among the first 8 doctors to alarm the public about the outbreak but he was initially accused by the local authority as a rumormonger. (Anthony Wallace/AFP via Getty Images)  To honor their sacrifice, we have decided to start this fundraising initiative. All funds gathered by March 15 will be donated to Wuhan University Alumni Association to support the local hospitals and medical professionals who are risking their lives combatting the outbreak. This particular organization is selected because of its outstanding performance during this epidemic. It has raised over $700,000 with its own fundraising initiative ( link ¬†) and is providing constant updates on the spending of the money. Although it will definitely take more than one wedding fundraising initiative to conquer this outbreak, we would like to be a small part of the solution and we invite you to join us. We really appreciate your support.  Note: If by the time we finish the fundraising, the virus has been eliminated or mitigated to a level that there is no need to donate to local hospitals or if no reliable logistic channels can be used to deliver the supplies, we plan to use this money to help with local students who are affected by this virus outbreak.

campaigns.title: CURE CORONA VIRUS
campaigns.description: I want to cure Coronavirus and i believe that 100000 dollars will do that

campaigns.title: Coronavirus vs. Spring Break
campaigns.description: College... a time for new experiences and self growth.  One highlight from everyone's experience in college is of course spring break. We all imagine and long for it; a time of wild parties, bucket hats, alcohol, beaches, and warm turquoise water.¬†   My past spring breaks have been rainy, cold, and usually sitting in bed saddened by the lack in adventure placed on my life. College is soon going to become a distant past for me as a current 4th year.   This year I want it to be different.   I already have a group of 10 solid dudes ready to party it up on the warm beaches of Punta Cana. Everything is already planned out. However, due to the recent outbreak of Coronavirus, my extremely cautious Chinese parents will not condone nor sponsor my travel plans. They rightly fear for my safety. However, I believe it is unreasonable to think that traveling to a non affected country will bring me at risk of contracting the virus.¬†  As a broke college student, I ask you, people of the world, to help me realize my college dreams before I graduate. Lets turn that fear of Coronavirus into a cold golden drink in my hand.  Thank you, Lex

campaigns.title: International Student Stuck abroad due to COVID-19
campaigns.description:
My name is Ramone, a medical student, and an aspiring Pediatric Oncologist currently studying in China. I am a member of a core research team that focuses on Osteosarcomas, Multiple Myeloma, and the NK Cell-Based Immunotherapy, together with the Tumor Immunology of various other cancers. I¬†have co-authored and published several scientific research papers in a number of peer-reviewed journals. 

Towards the ending of January just before the Chinese New Year, I left China for what should have been a short travel to Malaysia. Within two days, I learned that there was an outbreak of a novel coronavirus in the Wuhan province. The worst was yet to come as three days later, the now named 2019-nCOV had virtually spread to all provinces in China and resulted in several deaths. 

At this point, my program coordinator had made contact and informed me that based on the worsening situation of the now viral epidemic, I could not return to China and that I should extend my travel for a few more days until given notice to return. 

About a week later I again attempted to return but was informed that there were travel restrictions and a partial shutdown implemented by several provincial governments in addition to a number of airline cancellations and that I was not allowed to return under any circumstances until notified to do so by the University. Failure to abide by the preventative measures implemented by the educational department and the government to slow the spread of the viral outbreak would result in serious disciplinary action being taken.

Since then, I have been stuck alone in a foreign country waiting and hoping each day that the situation will somehow get better, and I would be allowed to return to China as I was unable to travel elsewhere due to travel bans imposed by a number of countries. Already having spent several weeks here with still no clear sign as to when I will be able to return, I again queried and was notified that courses would be conducted online for the period, and I should return home until notice is given for the resumption of regular classes/rotations. Thereafter, depending on the progress of the situation, I can apply in advance to return, providing that the outbreak is under control.

Please, if able to donate to help me stay afloat until I can return home as well as help with travel expenses I would be grateful. I have depleted all my resources and will try traveling to Jamaica soon. 
Thanks in advance. I appreciate your kind assistance.
If you wish to see some of my published research articles, you may visit  https://www.mendeley.com/profiles/ramone-a-williamson/

campaigns.title: SUPPORT WHS BASEBALL (100-Inning Game TBD-COVID19)
campaigns.description: **UPDATE** DUE TO THE CORONAVIRUS OUTBREAK AND THE "SOCIAL DISTANCING" PRACTICE THAT THE COUNTRY IS PARTAKING IN, THE 100-INNING GAME WILL BE POSTPONED INDEFINITELY.¬† HOWEVER, WE CAN STILL USE YOUR HELP TO REACH OUR FINANCIAL GOALS AS A PROGRAM, AND APPRECIATE ANY HELP THAT YOU ARE WILLING TO PROVIDE FOR US!  The Westside High School baseball team carries a lot of momentum heading into the 2020 campaign.¬† With a year-old turf playing surface and a brand new state of the art indoor facility, the Rams enter the 2020 season fully prepared to compete at the 5A level.¬† However, there are still things that we are looking to add to our program and provide for our kids, and we need your help to do so.  Last year, we used the funds that we raised in our 100-Inning Game in order to purchase a brand new Hack Attack machine.¬† Since the purchase of that machine, our players have become much more equipped to attack high velocity fastballs, and have also been able to work on staying closed off and using the whole field on breaking balls as well.¬† This year, with the new NOCSAE certification requirements, we are looking to purchase some equipment that is essential for game day for our kids.¬† We need to purchase new catcher's equipment at the Varsity, JV, and C-Team level due to the new certifications.¬† We also need new game balls for all levels.¬† Also, with the new building in full swing, we can now direct our attention to baseball specific drills that we feel are necessary for development and improvement.¬† We can spend money on making sure we have these materials.¬† We also hope to be able to buy more apparel for our players in the future, and also have tossed around the idea of going on a team trip for the 2021 that would require sufficient funds.  Thank you in advance for your help!¬† We look forward to sharing the 100-inning game with everyone!¬† The packages are as follows (although any donation is appreciated).¬† Again, thank you for your help!  $0.05 per inning- $5.00 (Single Package) $0.10 per inning- $10.00 (Double Package) $0.25 per inning- $25.00 (Triple Package) $0.50 per inning- $50.00 (Home Run Package) $1.00 per inning- $100.00 (Grand Slam Package)

campaigns.title: Students Helping China Fight Coronavirus Outbreak
campaigns.description:
Please consider donating ASAP as this is an urgent issue!  WHO declares the 2019-nCoV a GLOBAL EMERGENCY 
 

  Hi, we are Richard Z. and Katherine H. from Mountain View High School in Mountain View, CA. We are just students who want to help in an ongoing world issue.  As you may know already, the China coronavirus, known medically as the 2019-nCoV is currently spreading rapidly in China, and hospitals in Wuhan, the epicenter of this virus, are flooded with patients while not having enough medical supplies. The image is a letter from  The Second Affiliated Hospital of Guangzhou Medical University , asking for help from the public to donate  N95 respiratory masks, surgical masks, as well as hazardous material suits , with a certified government seal. The president of the Chinese Medical Association who works at  the Guangzhou Medical University , Zhong Nanshan, played a big role in controlling the outbreak of the 2003 SARS virus. He is also a leading scientist and researcher in this 2019-nCoV virus.  Currently the supply for these medical equipments in China are depleting quickly, as thousands of people a day rush to hospitals just for basic flu-like symptoms. The government has also sent medical professionals from this hospital by military plane to Wuhan to help stop the surprisingly contagious pandemic. Hospitals are filled with chaos, with not much to do and filled with patients to infect others, some which may have no problem with them at all. Sadly, the virus appeared during the Lunar New Year season, which means that people in the city return to their rural homes. Wuhan, a city of 12 million people, may have had much more infected people than the numbers posted by the Chinese government, and is most likely more widespread, as 5 million people left the epicenter of the outbreak just before they locked down.  We will  use your donations to purchase medical supplies and ship them to this hospital (The Second Affiliated Hospital of Guangzhou Medical University) , which will either ship them to hospitals in Wuhan, or use them as infection numbers increase. Richard's mother, Dr. Qiu, works at this hospital, and  the location is a certified donation point by the Chinese government . Anything is helpful. Please help us battle this virus together before it spreads to the places around you. Thank you.  For questions about this fundraiser, please feel free to contact us using the "contact" button down below. We will give you a response as soon as we can.

campaigns.title: COVID-19  Help doctors and nurses in Wuhan
campaigns.description: Dear All,  My name is Vanessa and I am a Chinese born Australian. I was born and raised by the very mothering land of China and my home town Wuhan, as I feel the need to do something to help my motherland to overcome Novel Coronavirus ‚Äì COVID19.  As of today there are more than 74,576 people confirmed diagnosis and more than 2000 people died, predominantly (over 90%) in my home town Wuhan. The hospitals in Wuhan are already OUT OF Surgical masks, Protective overalls and Protective Eyewear/Goggles.  Doctors and Nurses are currently treating tens of thousands of infected patients using recycled (washed in disinfectant solution) surgical masks, and lab coat or even rain coat‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶. as there are NO MORE protective gear left for use!  Your donations will be spent to purchasing Surgical Masks, Protective Overalls for medical/surgical and Protective Goggles which I have already sourced from. With the existing amount funded, I have already purchased (out of my own pocket for now until gofundme allows for withdrawal) 100 Surgical masks, 50 Protective overalls. Note that there are still 450 surgical overalls, 4900 surgical masks and 500 Protective Goggles available for purchase before they get sold out, I need your support to ensure that our Chinese front line fighters are protected while they serve their patients.¬†  Please chip in and help out to the first line Hero and Angels!  ¬†All purchasing medical supplies will be sent to HuBei Charity Federation located in Wuhan TianHe airport, and they will distribute to the hospital(s) in Wuhan or other city in HuBei .  I thank you very much in advance!  Vanessa  Update:¬† Our team have already bought four cartons (180 suits) Type 3 protective overalls and sent to Wuhan on 24 of Feb with China Southern airline. Please watch 7News Sydney¬† "China Southern Airline mercy plane carrying humanitarian and and bound directly for Wuhan has taken off from Sydney Airport on 24th of February"  Update (10/03/20): there were 14 cartons Protective Overalls (420 suits) being bought and will be sent by China Southern Airline mercy plane on 16/03/20.

campaigns.title: Help Fight the Coronavirus!
campaigns.description: Mission:   As the worldwide cases of the coronavirus surpassed the 2003 Sars outbreak the situation in China is getting grimmer. More and more requests for preventative emergency medical supplies are coming in from Hospitals, Clinics, Communities, and individuals. The coronavirus being a global crisis demands international measures. We are asking you to donate money via Gofundme.  Money donated will be used to either buy requested medical supplies or used to fund the shipping of the goods to China.   We are building a mobile platform to match emergency needs and medical donations, together with volunteer teams we work hard to distribute the requested supplies to the people in need. ** All money donated will be used to buy supplies or fund the transport to deliver the Goods.  Donate now so that medical supplies can be bought and shipped out to the communities in need.  Help them to help us!!  You can also contact us here: If you wish to have questions concerning our charity project.   Coronavirus Death Toll as of 19 Feb:    More Pics:

campaigns.title: Fight Coronavirus.  Hospitals In Need Of Supplies
campaigns.description:
As we are sure you are already aware, the Corona virus is continuing to spread across the globe.¬† More than 34,800 infected so far, and is rapidly spreading through China at a rate of almost 20 % each day.¬† Due to the seriousness of this outbreak, all major retailers and medical manufacturers¬† have been reporting medical mask shortages since the start of this week. 

We at Health Goal Intl. want to do everything we can to help our friends in China in protecting themselves against the Corona virus which is why we are creating a GoFundMe account to raise money for supplies to send over to hospitals in Wuhan and Xiamen China in attempts to protect those from contracting the virus.¬† So far we have been purchasing all masks and other supplies with our own money and have the hospitals and patrons in China taking care of the Air freight expense.¬† We have now helped supply 3000 surgical masks purchased from a hospital in Las Vegas.¬† 

Today we purchased 10,000 surgical masks for $4000 and are sending them by air to hospitals in Xiamen China.¬† We want to do everything we can to help spread awareness.¬† ¬†Many hospitals are now treating victims of the virus with out having surgical masks or sub par masks.¬† We ask if you wouldn‚Äôt mind sharing our gofundme page with your followers so we can help gather supplies to send them over to China ourselves so people can keep themselves safe.¬† Our hope is to save lives even if only a few it is so important. ¬† Thank you and we appreciate your willingness to help those in need, ¬† The team at Health Goal Intl.

campaigns.title: Raising Funds for Corona Virus Supplies
campaigns.description: My hometown, Xinyang City, is located 200 kilometers away from Wuhan, the city were coronavirus had an originated. ¬†Besides Wuhan, this is the number one affected city. There are more than 6 million people who inhabit Xinyang ¬†and there just isn‚Äôt enough supplies for everyone. Masks intended for one day use are being utilized for weeks due to the shortage. The money we raised will be used to buy supplies for doctors and the people of Xinyang.

campaigns.title: Help Fight CoViD-19
campaigns.description:
Want to join me in making a difference? I'm raising money to benefit UNICEF USA, and any donation will help make an impact. Thanks in advance for your contribution to this cause that means so much to me.  More information about UNICEF USA: The United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF) works in more than 190 countries and territories to put children first. UNICEF has helped save more children's lives than any other humanitarian organization, by providing health care and immunizations, safe water and sanitation, nutrition, education, emergency relief and more. UNICEF USA supports UNICEF's work through fundraising, advocacy and education in the United States. 

UNICEF does not endorse any brand, company, product, or service.

campaigns.title: CORONA VIRUS HELP
campaigns.description: ' CORONA¬† VIRUS HELP '   My name is Duane Kibby, and my friend Richard Cavallary told me the following story.  " My friend from NYC invited me to China to experience Chinese New Year Celebrations. He moved there, and now lives in Guangzhou, China.¬† The day before my flight was to leave, it got cancelled it (Hainan Airlines, Feb 2). Many airlines decided to shut down because of this Corona Virus. I was stuck in China AND no planes are scheduled for weeks until April. My original ticket (already paid for) was $413- (r/t).¬† So, my friend takes me to an airport ticket window to book another flight to USA.¬† From $3000- to $1790- to $1296-.¬† I finally was forced to put $1296- on a credit card.¬† This airline; Qatar, was 'getting out'.¬† I was glad to leave.  My monthly income is (S.S.) is $842- and I am just not able to pay monthly bills now.¬†   Can't work now as I had a knee 'blowout' (ruptured quad tendon).¬† Yes, I am fairly broke in my 64th year of life.  ANY help at all would be greatly appreciated.¬† Thanks and God bless.  Sincerely, Richard Cavallary "

campaigns.title: Help cure the corona virus
campaigns.description: Want to join me in making a difference? I'm raising money to benefit American Red Cross, and any donation will help make an impact. Thanks in advance for your contribution to this cause that means so much to me.

campaigns.title: Georgetown Students Help Fight Coronavirus
campaigns.description: Visit our website:  www.georgetowncovid19.com ¬†  We are a group of students from Georgetown University, and we are fundraising for medical supplies and devices to support hospitals in China to assist patients infected by or under the threat of COVID-19.   Why are we doing this fundraiser?  The SARS-CoV-2 virus (previously known as the 2019 novel coronavirus) has permeated our news and conversations for the past month. Yet, no news can rightfully communicate the fear, confusion, and helplessness of those that are infected or quarantined, nor the courage and sacrifice of the doctors, nurses, and volunteers battling on the frontline. Many Georgetown students have families in China and Wuhan. They are worried and have contributed a lot of time and effort to help their families and others in China.   As students of Georgetown University, we are guided by the Jesuit tradition of Cura Personalis -- ‚Äúcare for the whole person‚Äù, and believe that it is part of our responsibility to help the members of the global community who are most severely affected by the COVID-19 global pandemic.   Therefore, we are holding this fundraiser to achieve two goals: 1. To provide funds that alleviate the immediate medical needs of Chinese hospitals on the frontline of fighting the coronavirus.  2. To empower members of the Georgetown community in making an impact on the fight against this global pandemic.    Where are the proceeds going?  The proceeds of this fundraiser will go to  Beijing Chunmiao Charity Foundation . We chose them because of their demonstrated quickness to respond, their proven ability to obtain medical supplies and devices to hospitals in need, and their emphasis on operational transparency.  Links to learn more:  Description of Chunmiao in English   About Chunmiao's coronavirus project  (can be translated using Chrome browser)  Chunmiao is a Chinese non-profit founded in 2010 specializing in public welfare projects in caring for congenitally-ill children, healthcare, education, elderly-nursing, and poverty alleviation.  On January 27, 2020, Chunmiao formed a Coronavirus workgroup that was able to raise roughly 40M RMB (roughly 6M USD), more than 25M RMB of which is already spent to provide medical supplies and devices to hospitals in Wuhan and surrounding areas.  Chunmiao will decide the specific usage of our proceeds as they see fit (e.g. masks vs. ECMO machines) to the circumstances of the hospitals they support.    Fundraiser disclosure  Given that Chunmiao is non-profit registered in China only (meaning it cannot register itself on GoFundMe), we will transfer the proceeds to a personal account first before wiring them to Chunmiao's account in China.  Stanley He ¬†, a current MBA student at Georgetown and the liaison between Chunmiao and us, will receive the proceeds and then wire them out.  We will be disclosing all financial transactions and records related to this fundraiser and obtain a receipt from Chunmiao. Chunmiao will also provide us a report on the usage of our donation to us. We are in the process of setting up a website to disclose this information.¬†   Members and friends of the Georgetown community, we hope to get your support to come together and help fight this global pandemic by supporting the people who are fighting the coronavirus and saving lives on the frontline.

campaigns.title: Save Hercules
campaigns.description: Hi! This is Hercules, he is a loving, friendly, playful and gentle dog. I am writing to you all today, because he managed to get out of the house and was caught by the pound.¬† You would think this is an easy fix, but unfortunately it is not. The pound will not release him to us, unless we pay for the impound, the board, any vaccination and license. And none of it is cheap. Usually after a certain amount of days they would put him up for adoption, but this is not the case either. One of his hip bones is not fully developed and he can't walk properly, and because he doesn't qualify "esthetically" he can't be adopted. Which is unjust and awful. And if he can't be adopted... they have to put him down... he is a beautiful creature, please help, anything helps, just because he's imperfect doesn't mean he doesn't have the right to live:/

campaigns.title: Medical Supplies - Wuhan Fight Against Coronavirus
campaigns.description: Virus has no borders   We have an urgent request for our concerned members of AMPSAA.¬† We are looking for donations so that we can purchase and send over medical supplies to Wuhan and nearby cities in Hubei province, China.¬† As you all may have heard in the news, the Coronavirus situation in Wuhan, China is critical. Worldwide over 1400 cases have been reported since the virus was first diagnosed in Wuhan on January 15, less than 10 days ago.¬† These numbers are likely low, as individuals who have sent texts and emails from the region have reported that in some cases, because there are so many people going to the hospitals and there is not enough staff, people are just being sent home. Hospitals are over flowing in cases,¬† running low or have no supplies of to offer supportive care and are lacking protective gear to protective their medical staff and contain and isolate infected cases.¬†  As of today, Wuhan and many other cities within the province have been quarantined. ¬† At least 17 cities within the province have been locked down. Individuals are not allowed to leave the cities, by plane, train, or any other means.¬† Hospitals are overwhelmed and the Chinese government is building two emergency hospitals within the city. All public transportation within the city has been shutdown.¬† Starting Sunday, use of private vehicles within the city will be banned.  Wuhan‚Äôs need for medical assistance is severe.¬† As the epicenter, with over 11 million people, the lack of adequate medical protection means that even those healthy individuals and the medical staff who are there to care for them are at great risk.¬† It may seem that this is a ‚ÄúChina problem, not a U.S. problem,‚Äù but if the Coronavirus outbreak is not addressed now, by the time it reaches the same level of urgency in the U.S., it will have already reached emergency levels around the globe.¬† We need to help China address the Coronavirus.  We are looking to send the following medical supplies, namely, surgical masks (N95 mask, YY 0469-2010), goggles to cover the entire face, disposable medical gloves, medical caps, shockproof eye masks, protective clothing (3M 4565), medical protective masks (GB 19083-2010).¬† If you can donate these supplies, or donate money for us to purchase them, or have connections for AMPSAA to appeal directly, such help will be greatly appreciated. Please forward this to whomever you think can help. Thank you!

campaigns.title: Please help. I can draw you your portrait.
campaigns.description: I was born in a country with an outdated educational system, a childhood of many incidents, and was a victim of crime. One day I decided that I only lived once, i had to live my own life, so i escaped. No one who knows me for the past 6 years knows my past, knows what I have suffered and overcome, alone. I have just started my own life for 6 years, from absolutely nothing. It took 6 years for me to build a life of my own.  Since i was a child, my dream is to become an artist. After 6 years of hard work to build a minimum life of a human being, I borrow money to study art and planned to use my monthly salary to pay off the loan. Its the bank that the company paying salary for employees through. The loan was deducted directly from my monthly salary.  Unfortunately, the COVID-19 epidemic occurred in December 2019, and the tourism industry in my country (an Indochina country, not China) is badly damaged, while I am working in a small travel company. The company has bankrupted and i lost my main job, which i supporsed to use to pay my loan tuition.   The bank asked me to pay the entire loan immediately, the deadline is 3 months later. I asked the school for a refund of the tuition fee and gave up my studies, but because I had already gone through half of the program, only half of the tuition was refunded. If I couldn't repay the loan, they would sue me and I would definitely go to jail. This will end my life, because the people who had committed crimes against me and I ran away from them, are the people in the police industry.  I have been doing a couple side jobs to pay monthly rent and expenses (I have worked ~14 hours per day all these years). Because the epidemic is still developing, my country's economy has plummeted, it's hard to find a new full-time job right now (Im still trying). Sometimes I think life is so unfair to me, but I know I'm still one of the luckiest people in the world when I'm still able to breathe everyday.  I knew that the epidemic would not end soon and the economy in my country would not recover soon, I tried to manage everything before finding the last way to seek support here. I am alone, without friend or relatives, without any support other than myself. I'm always proud of myself being my own superhero. But sometimes, specifically right now, the hero is already exhausted.  It is difficult for me to disclose all my personal information, because as I said above, my identity now is completely different from I was six years ago, and in a communist country, the publication of what I've been through can ruin my life. If you are interested, I will tell my story to you personally, please message me privately.   I know you will find it hard to believe my story, so please consider I'm begging you for a job, I know drawing and graphic design, please let me work for you, so you dont have to wonder if your kindness is being used. I would be happy to express my appreciation for your support by drawing you a portrait of yourself, or doing some graphic design like a banners or poster, anything you request - this is my firm commitment.  P/s : When I had money I used to donate monthly to a non-profit organization for the homeless and the blind, as a way of thanking life for giving me a second chance to live. When I posted this fundraiser, gofundme gave me a number of tasks to share with relatives, friends, social networking sites ... I suddenly felt hilarious for my destiny. I have no close ones in real life, and no friend on internet (I don't use any social networks - due to my special circumstances). If you come across my post, please do me a favour by sharing it on social media, because I don't have a chance to do that, and maybe very quickly this fundraiser will be forgotten. I still expect a miracle to happen here, even though I know the chances of it happening are very low...

campaigns.title: Surviving the Corona Virus
campaigns.description: The pause button has been pushed on the world, but not on our lives. Still have bills to pay and moves to make.¬†  Anything helps!!¬†  Thank you all for taking the time to check this fundraiser out.

campaigns.title: Vendedores Unidos Self-Care & Corona
campaigns.description: Hello Friends,  I've left up these photos of joy, generosity, and love from street vendors because we will return to this public practice of love, resiliency, and mutual aid one day, but in a different form.¬†   Meanwhile, we have shifted all our work to Mutual Aid Disaster Relief.  Many Languages One Voice, the non-profit I work for, has applied for a 10K grant to support the important work of Street Vendors turning into Promotores de Salud en Contra de Corona .¬† You can  read it in last Sunday's edition of the Washington Post  .¬† Every bit of the¬† money we raise for this project will go to Vendedores Unidos.¬†   If you cannot get past the firewall, sign in with UserID =  hamilton8691@sbcglobal.net  with Password =  Hsdr634k  However will take weeks for those funds to work their way through the NGO world.  So, please donate generously to this  personal request from me  through GoFundMe.¬† I have spent about as much of my personal money as I possibly can and my comrade, Calvin Jackson, has looked at my bank account and seen where I am at with this.¬† He is one of my accountability people on money and so is Preeti Kanodia, our Mutual Aid Money Mover.¬† They are both imminently qualified to do this.¬†  I have $476 in Mutual Aid Money that I started in CashApp, and $600 left in my personal bank account.¬† This is all the money I have left in the world right now.¬† Clearly, I needed Calvin and Preeti's help because they are way better with money than me.¬† I'm just an organizer and a Catholic Worker and I give all mine away, lol.  Yesterday, 3/16/2020, Colochita was being a Promotora de Salud on 14th and Irving.¬† Learn more in this beautiful story by Natalie Delgadillo about  Colochita , the Abuela of the Columbia Heights/Mt. Pleasant Street Vendors.     Genesis,  a 15-year-old girl¬† DC police pu tin the hospital for selling plantain chips, also wants to be a Promotora de Salud en Contra de Corona.   Qaadir, showing support with the Fuera ICE Coalition, will be joining us in our efforts to bring in his most vulnerable community members, especially with vendors he knows through the People for Fairness Coalition and Street Sense.   Natacia Knapper with Marilyn, one of our youngest street vendors and organizers.¬† Natacia has already donated $500 of money she raised through her efforts in creating Ward 1 Mutual Aid Infrastructure to Vendedores Unidos en Contra de Corona.

campaigns.title: COVID-19  $1 per Mask
campaigns.description: The Covid-19 has become an international issue in China. ¬†China being one of the fastest growing economic yet almost million of this population are still the poorest. The poor usually reside in the countryside and makes a earning on farming and selling In the city. No medical equipped hospitals can be found in these rural areas. ¬† Many of these people are not able to get the essentials that is needed to prevent ¬†them self‚Äôs from ¬†Covid-19 due to all the roads being blocked off. Many people are not able to buy food or even go to the hospital if needed. ¬†A lot of these people are elderly who never was able to leave the countryside. ¬†A lot of these people are now getting beaten up for not wearing mask in public because of the new implemented law in China. If you are not wearing mask in public you will automatically be quarantined for 15 days. Many of these government workers are now taking advantage of this power and start bullying the people even animals. ¬†Many can not afford mask or just not able to buy any in the countryside. Most of busses has been discontinued.¬†  This donation will all be used to purchase the following protective materials and food :  N95 mask, disposable latex gloves, ¬† surgical mask, alocohal spray, hand sanitizer, rice, noodle, preserve vegetable, canned food.¬†  If shortage of various materials, if the donation fails to purchase all the materials, the rest of the donations will be donated to charitable organizations.   $1 makes a change!  ¬†  Thank you for all the donation. Photos and videos will be updated as proof!

campaigns.title: coronavirus
campaigns.description: Che cos'√® un Coronavirus? Coronavirus sono una vasta famiglia di virus noti per causare malattie che vanno dal comune raffreddore a malattie pi√π gravi come la Sindrome respiratoria mediorientale (MERS) e la Sindrome respiratoria acuta grave (SARS).  Sono virus RNA a filamento positivo, con aspetto simile a una corona al microscopio elettronico.¬†La sottofamiglia¬†Orthocoronavirinae¬†della famiglia¬†Coronaviridae¬†√® classificata in quattro generi di coronavirus (CoV): Alpha-, Beta-, Delta-- e¬†Gammacoronavirus.¬†Il¬†genere del¬†betacoronavirus¬†√® ulteriormente separato in cinque sottogeneri (tra i quali il¬†Sarbecovirus).  I Coronavirus sono stati identificati a met√† degli anni '60 e sono noti per infettare l'uomo ed alcuni animali (inclusi uccelli e mammiferi). Le cellule bersaglio primarie sono quelle epiteliali del tratto respiratorio e gastrointestinale.  Ad oggi, sette Coronavirus hanno dimostrato di essere in grado di infettare l'uomo:  Coronavirus umani comuni: HCoV-OC43 e HCoV-HKU1 (Betacoronavirus)¬†e¬†HCoV-229E e HCoV-NL63 (Alphacoronavirus); essi possono causare raffreddori comuni ma anche gravi infezioni del tratto respiratorio inferiore. Altri Coronavirus umani (Betacoronavirus): SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV e 2019-nCoV (ora denominato SARS-CoV-2).. 2. Che cos'√® un nuovo Coronavirus? Un nuovo Coronavirus (nCoV) √® un nuovo ceppo di coronavirus che non √® stato precedentemente mai identificato nell'uomo. In particolare quello denominato SARS-CoV-2 (precedentemente 2019-nCoV), non √® mai stato identificato prima di essere segnalato a Wuhan, Cina, a dicembre 2019.

campaigns.title: Terry Bridges Medical Expenses Fundraiser
campaigns.description: Hello everyone,    Who We Are  My name is Jenna and I‚Äôm Terry‚Äôs Daughter In Law. This fundraiser will be ran collectively by myself, Terry‚Äôs son Jeremy, and his wife Lee Ann. Jeremy and I have a soon to be four year old son Ryder, who is Terry‚Äôs grandson. ¬†  Why We‚Äôre Asking For Help  Recently Terry was diagnosed with Stage 3 Esophageal Cancer.  This is a fundraiser to assist with medical costs for the necessary tests, treatments, medications, and anything else related to this difficult process, as he currently does not have health insurance. I believe asking for help can be a difficult thing to do, but in this situation it‚Äôs a necessary step in order to alleviate some of the stress associated with the astronomical costs of health care. ¬†(The goal amount is an abstract number so far, as we are unsure yet of exact costs in future).   A Little Back Story  For those who don‚Äôt know him, Terry is a loved husband, ¬†father, and grandfather. He and his wife Lee Ann are still grieving from the untimely passing of their son Trevor at 21 years old, and it has been a difficult couple years for the family and everyone surrounding us. Terry is a musician, playing guitar and singing with his band JusTed in various venues around St. Louis. That love of music seems to be passed on to his grandson, who often asks to go play drums at Paw Paw‚Äôs studio.¬†  We thank you for taking the time to read this, and thank you in advance for any help given. Times like these are not easy for anyone involved, and so any help that alleviates the stress of an already worrisome situation means more than any will know.¬†  Thank You‚ù§Ô∏è

campaigns.title: For finishing Study in the outbreak of Coronavirus
campaigns.description: Rome, 19/02/2020  Friends,   My name is Sophia Lilin Wu. I am a lay Chinese student of Theology, in the second year of the first cycle in Pontifical Gregorian University. As you all know, since the beginning of this new year 2020, China, especially Wuhan has suffered from the coronavirus. And because of this strong influence, this virus soon spread beyond Wuhan to other parts of China and around the world.  Seeing such suffering happening every day, my heart is broken. In order to help the Chinese people fight the coronavirus, especially to help my family who are living in Shandong province, I bought nearly 700 masks and sent them to China both to Shandong and to Beijing. A friend of mine in Beijing told me that even the doctors and nurses in the Hospital cannot find masks now, to say nothing of other people. Therefore, I tried my best to help them. As you see, without a mask, you cannot move one step regarding the high risks. Scientists found that the coronavirus even can influence people by air just in two seconds.   They urgently need to have enough masks in order to have at least the basic protection. I am the only one child in my family. From my childhood until now, both my father and mother tried their best to give me everything I need, to educate me in the best school, to encourage me to graduate from the best University in China (Peking University) as a Doctor of Philosophy, to support me to study Catholic theology in Rome even though they themselves are not Christians. However, the real and deep love is that whatever the decision I made they supported me. Love should repay love. So, I decide to give them the best medical supplies. From Jan.25th, the Chinese New Year until now Feb.19th, 2020, almost each day, I am looking for masks or sending masks. Finally, until today, there are already seven hundred masks going to China. Nonetheless, the ordinary shipping cannot go to China nowadays regarding the high risks, only DHL could help me to ship masks to China. But the cheapest and the smallest box in DHL cost 58 euro. In order to guarantee that they have masks in China, I must send many times and only for shipping in this month, almost 500 euro was spent. And because of the high needs, the price of masks rises 2 to 3 times. For example, before one masks FFP2 cost 5 euro, now you need to pay 10 euro, and masks FFP3 before 7 euro, now you should pay from 15 to 20 euro. But it can only use 8 hours. Though some friends also help me with some contributions, one month later, my bankcard finally has no money left. I remember in the evening of Feb. 17th, the first day of the second semester, the pharmacy called me they found more masks of FFP2. However, from my bankcard I can only buy 29 masks, then there is no money on this card. This money is the fund for supporting my living and studying in Rome, my mom transferred to me in last September. She always thought if there is something in urgent need, for example, when I got sick need to buy medicine, or want to go home, I can buy tickets. But now all of them turned to be masks. Indeed, before if I have urgent need, I can ask for support from parents. However, now China is at a standstill. I even do not know whether or not my father still has salary. Then I decided that this time, it is not they support me but I who support them. So, friends, please help me to continue my life and study in Rome. Just left one and half year, I will finish my first cycle of theology in Gregorian University. I have a basic scholarship which can support me bed and food, therefore, I ask for your help for this small part, in these seven months (from now to September). I need some money to do scan and photocopy, to prepare documents for applying new scholarship and for the summer tickets to go and back between Rome and Cracow. I have a dream that when finishing all of these studies, to work and live in Poland, so during the summer, I already planned to return to Poland to learn Polish. The scholarship for learning Polish, however, does not include transportation.  The belief for the beauty of human hearts push me to write this letter. As the song which was singing in the Beijing Olympic 2008 expressed: you and me, heart to heart, we are family.  Thank you with my deep heart, and I believe God will repay for your kindness.  ¬†  ¬†  ¬†  ¬†  ¬†  ¬†
