campaigns.title: Patriotic American seeks help evading Coronavirus
campaigns.description: I refused to study on Sunday for 2 years in college; then I refused to get on the dole all throughout the Obama economic Depression, even though I was unemployed then only 1 year.¬† I predicted the economic collapse of 2008 5 years in advance.¬†¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† I was a very idealistic but bumbling person in college.¬† I was all alone and refused to study on Sunday for at least the last two years of my time in college.¬† I was not lazy and did not have a substance abuse problem, a girl problem, or any hobbies that took up much time.¬† I've never used drugs, including opioids.¬† I studied engineering and then chemistry, subjects in which I was not talented.¬† I refused to study on Sunday because I was converting to Catholicism and was under the mistaken impression that that was a sound thing to do, though I came to realize I had been wrong when it was already too late.¬† I'm not a lazy person; I believe in hard work.¬†¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†I have been unemployed for the last eight years, and for the last 5 years, I have had debilitating health problems.¬† My health before then was also very bad.¬† After developing chronic insomnia in 2012, I went to the famous Dr. Don Colbert of Florida, an excellent holistic doctor who made the mistake of letting me take too much active folate, a B-vitamin to improve my concentration.¬† It gave me "walking disease", which forced me to walk vigorously up to 5 hours a day.¬† This could be considered a case of Akathisia, which is usually found in completely different circumtances.¬† I continued like this for two years; it destroyed my adrenal glands.¬† In November 2016, I stopped taking the active folate.¬† After two months, my body came off my "active folate high", revealing that my adrenal glands were destroyed.¬†  ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†Since January 2017, I have had debilitating and chronic fatigue.¬† I cannot just take iron pills or energy drinks to recover.¬† My fatigue is so bad that after typing about fifteen to thirty minutes, my wrists will become very painful from fatigue.¬† I cannot do office work.¬† I am even too tired to read most books that I find enjoyable.¬† This is not laziness or a lack of will power, but a major physical disability.¬† Sustainable and meaningful recover requires a long process of supplements and treatments arranged by the famous specialist in adrenal fatigue, Dr. Carrie Lam of Orange County, California. ¬† ¬† ¬†My health is so bad that in the very likely case that I catch the coronavirus, I am almost certain to die from it even though I am 36 years old.¬† This is because it affects mainly old people and those with pre-existing conditions - exactly like mine.¬† Therefore, I am desperate to find a way to recover from the coronavirus, as well as to help my parents pay my medical bills for Dr. Lam.¬† I could not accept money from strangers unless I had some pretty precise and well-thought out plans, which I am rapidly working to devise.¬† ¬†My current plan is to go out into a very sparsely populated rural area and either rent a small cabin/apartment for three months or to live in a tent if necessary in a state park.¬† I will consult multiple doctors to see if this is a sound idea.¬† I believe I could do this for as little as $2000-$3000.¬†¬† ¬† ¬† I would be as grateful as any man can be for somebody saving my life from certain death, which is basically what they would be doing as far as I am concerned.¬† Right now, I depend on my parents for all my needs, but my parents, even though I love and respect them, are not competent or prudent.¬† They will probably die from the virus too, but they are not taking it seriously.¬†  ¬† ¬† I would try very hard to pay my donors back and if necessary, I could get on the dole so my private donors wouldn't have to pay for my food.¬† I have never had an aptitude for planning, but I have a lot of talent and I am still idealistic enough that I am willing to undergo a lot of hardship.¬† I have a strong belief in personal responsibility, but I was too idealistic, unrealistic, and lonely in college to have the sense to study on Sundays.¬† I have some Presbyterian, Scotch-Irish blood in me and as a result, I am stubborn and self-reliant to a fault.¬†  ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†Now, though, I desperately need help to save my life.¬† I am ashamed to ask for help, but I did refuse to get on the dole or on Social Security disability for 11 years.¬† I could have been on the latter for five years with perfect justification, but I hate asking others for money.¬† I will try very hard to repay you.¬†¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†I am still very idealistic, but for twelve years I have been fully aware that I must match my idealism with a very strong work ethic and that I was mistaken in college about studying on Sunday.¬† In certain, real ways, I have never had much of a chance in life.¬† My idealism was based on the idea that America was in desperately bad shape and needed timeless wisdom to recover.¬† I still think America could benefit from the world's best source of not-so common common sense, Aristotle, if that makes sense.¬† Aristotle has been called "the common sense philosopher".¬† Reading him, and other old classic western books, is key to being conservative.¬† This important idea is promoted at Hillsdale College, which I deeply respect.¬† Democracy is collapsing, but that is something the founding Fathers themselves realized would happen after 1789.¬† I strongly believe that based on the thought of Plato; Aristotle; the first Duke of Wellington (the British soldier who defeated Napoleon); and Hans Hermann Hoppe.¬† While I am a patriotic American, supporting the 2nd Amendment and other bedrock American institutions, I believe America has always been decadent and doomed to collapse relatively quickly.¬†¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† I want to make the world a much more beautiful and happier place.¬† I have a lot of talent and a lot of the kind of deep, classical, western-based learning that our universities should be trying to promote instead of rampant political correctness, socialism, and other non-western ideas.¬† I even used to have great physical charisma, the remnants of which I still hope to use to get married and transmit to my children some day.¬† I would be willing to marry a woman from a poor country, if necessary.¬† Maybe my [future] children [since I have never slept with anybody or otherwise had children] can use their charisma to become famous leaders and spread a love of morality, personal responsibility, and liberty to future generations.¬† I'm not pretentious or arrogant, but very humble and embarrassed.¬†¬† ¬† ¬† Unfortunately, I would love to have enough money to head to the hills as soon as possible.¬† I would have been planning this a month ago, but my health is bad enough that I could not plan as quickly as I wanted.¬† Yes, I am goofy and very awkward, but as goofy as I am, I can do enormous good with my life.¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†PLEASE HELP ME SAVE MY OWN LIFE.

Il virus che sta terrorizzando il mondo in queste settimane, l‚Äôormai tristemente famoso¬†Covid-19, ha colpito in particolar modo le zone del Nord Italia e sta penalizzando a livello economico numerosissimi settori, alcuni pi√π di altri. Pochi, purtroppo, sono a conoscenza delle condizioni in cui versano le palestre e i centri sportivi italiani in questo momento. In pi√π, al momento il governo sta promettendo di stanziare aiuti economici solamente per le zone rosse e, anche l√¨, ESCLUDENDO totalmente questo settore. Ma i centri sportivi che sono stati obbligati a chiudere sono presenti in tutte le regioni pi√π colpite dal Coronavirus.  


 



 Io purtroppo non posso aiutarli  da sola, per questo rivolgo a tutti voi questa piccola richiesta di aiuto, sperando che possa poi ingrandirsi e raggiungere pi√π persone possibile.  Grazie mille .

campaigns.title: Helping Devon
campaigns.description: For this young man to have to go through a traumatic event like this, which could have been prevented, we as community should come together and help as much as possible. This is a page to help raise not only money to help the family with his medical expenses, but to also help raise awareness and prevent other incidents like this from happening again and maybe shedding some knowledge to some that it's ok to continue learning from those who are knowledgable and willing to help in certain areas. We want to help and allow Devon to experience life without restrictions. Please take the time to read this incredible young man's journey. He is wise beyond his years and stronger than most his age. ¬†¬†  "On the morning of January 15th there was an accident in the weight room at Academy High School which resulted in the amputation of my pointer and middle finger. As you can imagine this has been very traumatic for me and some days are worse than others, and it will continue to get worse for me mentally for a little while. Actually varies moment by moment. I expect to return to school when I am released to do so. Due to the anxiety of this situation, I am asking to please not ask me questions about the accident when I return, it may cause me to replay the moment in my head and that won‚Äôt end well. I will open up and talk when I am ready, please respect my privacy and space. I look forward to returning to my normal activities but I will be learning my new normal. While I am prepared this will take some time, I will be very quiet and sad, and at times very frustrated, please just understand I need time but I know I will be stronger and better than ever before I know it. I will continue to be in athletics of course and this only inspires me to work harder in what I do, but I do hope the school district does what they should do to make the weight room safer. I am grateful because it could‚Äôve ended in worse circumstances. I am also extremely grateful it was me that it happened to instead of any of my fellow loved classmates, this way it‚Äôll bring the districts attention to the situation and they could easily prevent it from happening to anybody else. I‚Äôm very worried about everybody, but I understand everybody is worried about me as well, so thank you so much for your support and love during this extremely difficult time. It helps me during this time. The encouragement of family and friends that have visited and checked on me mean more to me then any of you will ever know." -Devon Hulsey

campaigns.title: Minnesota: COVID-19 Direct Relief Fund
campaigns.description: A few years ago, I raised money to help kids across our state by eliminating their school lunch debt. I took action because I saw a need. Collectively, I knew we could do something about it. And we did: We wiped out lunch debt in schools across the state of Minnesota.  Today, we‚Äôre facing a bigger challenge. The coronavirus is hitting Washington hard. Unfortunately, 29 people have died and 366 people have tested positive, according to the Health. Government officials warn it could reach 64,000 in a few months if our leaders do not take the steps necessary to stop the spread of the virus.¬†  We hope and encourage our government officials to do all they can to test, treat, and prevent the spread of the coronavirus.¬†  People need immediate help. During this crisis, those with the least suffer the most. Some folks can‚Äôt go to the doctor because they don‚Äôt have healthcare. Public schools are closed for at least two weeks and some people can‚Äôt afford to take off work because they don‚Äôt have paid sick leave. Some parents have to choose between paying the rent and feeding their kids.¬†  This will get worse before it gets better. But the good news is that there‚Äôs a path forward.  You may wonder, like I have, if there‚Äôs anything we can do to help. We don‚Äôt have to sit idly by waiting for someone else to solve the problem. We can take action. We need to come together and lift up the folks that need a helping hand.¬†  I recently read about the Minnesota Foundation‚Äôs COVID-19 Response Fund. The Seattle Foundation is an important organization providing direct relief to those that need it most. They will provide money to ‚Äúresidents without health insurance and/or access to sick days, people with limited English language proficiency, healthcare and gig economy workers, and communities of color, among others.‚Äù The Fund is working closely with King County‚Äôs Pandemic Community Advisory Group to identify organizations currently providing or receiving requests for support and will use the money raised on our campaign to assist with these efforts.  I will not have access to the funds. Every dollar donated will be transferred directly to the Minnesota Foundation. Your donation is tax-deductible.¬†  Please join me in becoming part of the solution. Donate $5, $10, or $25 bucks. Every contribution counts. Let your voice be heard and let the people know that we have their backs.

campaigns.title: WE ARE THE WORLD  CURE COVID-19
campaigns.description: We Are The World   Outreach To Find   Cure COVID-19  We are raising money to test our proposed cure (clo2) for the pandemic known as covid-19. We think we already have a cure, but it must be tested on the the actual virus. All procedes will be used towards this end. CLO2 is the chemical compound that has proven to be effective in killing many bacteria   virus infections. The FDA has approved its use for many things including mouthwash, but refuses to approve it for it's health benefits. It's so  inexpensive  to buy that companies cannot sell it and make money. Anyone can make it by combining to compounds which are available world-wide.  Our non-profit group is ready to go anywhere to test the clo2 cure for this pandemic.¬† We just need the support   approval of the World Health Organization or the infected countries approval, to allow us to test it. Clo2 has been used for decades, but it's efficacy for medicine has never been proven,¬† due to the millions of dollars required by the FDA , CDC for companies to mass produce it.  The History of Chlorine Dioxide¬† ( CLO2  the proposed  cure  for COVID-19)   Chlorine Dioxide ¬†was discovered by Sir Humphrey Davy in 1844. The British chemist combined potassium chlorite with sulphuric acid. It will soon be discovered that this green gas would be a more effective disinfectant than chlorine.   By the 1930's Chlorine Dioxide  was being used more frequently for disinfecting areas. Because of it's gaseous form, it filled spaces evenly. The volitile gas was impossible to ship safely, so Sodium Chlorite began to manufactured as a relatively safe precursor chemical, and the industries using chlorine dioxide would then generate the gas onsite as needed. Because of Chlorine Dioxide's solubility in water, it starts being used as a water treatment.   In 1944, Chlorine Dioxide  was used by the City of Niagra New York, to control odor and remove phenols from the river water used as the municipal supply to good effect. The city soon changes to Chlorine Dioxide exclusively. The water is cleaner, tastes better, and has no odor compared to the use of chlorine.   In 1956 Brussels Belgium makes the switch from Chlorine to Chlorine Dioxide  for it's municipal water system. It is discovered that Chlorine dioxide will destroy algae biofilm, a feat which Chlorine could not accomplish.¬†   Through the 1960's  more cities and swimming pools start to change to  Chlorine Dioxide .   In 1967 The United States Environmental Protection Agency (E.P.A) registered an aquaeous form of Chlorine Dioxide  to be used as a sanitizer and disinfectant. Chlorine DIoxide starts being used commercially on fruit and produce as a sanitizer.   In the 70's and 80's The EPA began reccomending Chlorine DIoxide  over Chlorine for water treatment and other applications. This was due to the fact that because of their different chemical properties, Chlorine Dioxide was more efficient, and did not produce toxic trihalomethanes like chlorine.   In 1988 the EPA registered Chlorine Dioxide  as a sterilizer approved for hospitals, laboratories, and healthcare facilities   In 2001 FEMA and other government agencies use Chlorine Dioxide  to to decontaminate buildings contaminated with Anthrax. ¬†Chlorine Dioxide was completely effective against the tiny Anthrax Spores. The buildings, walls and furnishings suffered no damage from the treatment.   In 2005 FEMA again uses Chlorine DIoxide . This time to eradicate mold from damage caused by Hurricane Katrina. A restuarant in New Orleans was able to re-open after being treated for just 12 hours without major repair.   The products, uses, and applications for Chlorine Dioxide  continue to grow. More and more mainstream health and home related products are using chlorine dioxide. There are several patents issued for companies to use Chlorine Dioxide to make personal and household products.¬†   As of January 2020¬† the FDA, CDC,¬† and other US organizations continue to forbid use of Chlorine Dioxide  as a medicine because of a lack of interest for corporations to make enough money to market it as such.¬† Simpley said, the clo2 is so plentiful that anyone can make it. No company would ever be able to patent it. Therefore people die.  Will billions of people die now because it is too cheap for rich people to get richer? We suggest that one of the billionairs running for office donate clo2 to the world now!    WE ARE THE WORLD  (please save us)   FDA APPROVES CHLORINE DIOXIDE FOR WATER ¬†   FDA APPROVES CHLORINE DIOXCIDE AS FOOD ADDITVE ¬†   FDA APPROVES CHLORINE DIOXIDE FOR FOOD PREP ¬†   FDA APPROVAL LIST OF CHLORINE DIOXIDE USE

campaigns.title: Help us escape Covid19 with our dogs
campaigns.description:
¬† ¬† Hello everybody! Our names are Alan and Ceren. We have been living in China for almost 5 years as English teachers. Currently, we are in Xiamen, Fujian Province.
 

 We have two adopted dogs:      This is Munchies. He is 4 years old. We found him as a 2-month-old puppy in Beijing, Wudaokou area. He has been a part of our family since then.    And this one is our "Girl" aka Miss Paws. We found her starving on the street in September 2019, in Xiamen. We have been trying to find her a forever family but unfortunately, we couldn`t find anybody.¬† (The picture above is a part of the poster we prepared before for the adoption.) So, now she has become the newest addition to our family.  Until January 2020, everything was going nicely in our lives. But then,¬†  the Coronavirus outbreak has started and everything turned upside down.¬† We are living under a nationwide quarantine. Finding masks and supplies is difficult. People couldn`t go to work for almost a month.¬† Most companies resumed working on the 19th of February in most provinces, but schools are still closed and there is no specific starting date.¬†
 

 Out training center has been hurt by this deeply and we still have not gotten our salaries for January and February. Our management keeps telling us the only thing we can do is to wait until schools reopen, but even after that, there is no guarantee that they will pay us.¬†  Right now the only thing we are trying to do is get back to America, yet with our current financial situation, it is not possible. We need to buy plane tickets not only for us but for our pets which currently is more expensive given the situation.¬† Our options are limited by the lack of airlines flying to China.¬† Also, the paperwork which is required for our¬† dogs to get on the planes is very expensive. We had considered staying longer yet with our rent and daily expenses we are not able to support ourselves. We already used all our savings and currently, we are surviving by the money our families have lent us and need to find a solution as fast as possible.  This unexpected pandemic is hurting everybody in a different way. We¬† just want to go back home and be safe. Leaving our dogs behind is not an option.¬†   Please help us get home, we only have one month to finish everything and move our lives to America. We have lived here for five years and this has been one of the hardest things we have ever had to do. Our lives are here in China and to leave this all behind has been a challenge for us both mentally and physically.¬†

campaigns.title: HAZMATS SUITS FOR THE UPRISING CORONA VIRUS
campaigns.description: As the current rates of the coronavirus grow exponentially, higher than any other virus outbreak in history, the risk of mankind is at risk. By reducing interactions from human to human through a hazmat suit, we as a human race will be able to prevent and slow down these sky-rocketing rates. By raising these funds, hazmat suits will be donated to areas around the world currently such as Italy and Wuhan, China, to help doctors and medical professionals in need of sterilized equipment and apparel. As simple household medical supplies are being sold out and the current ones in stock have tripled their price and sometimes even quadruple, lower economy households will not be able to purchase these necessities themselves. So not only will these funds help with purchasing hazmat suits, but they will also help to give households around the U.S. simple things like hand sanitizer and soap. This is a critical issue in our society RIGHT NOW and we need to act fast, or else this will become a pandemic that people were just ignoring for the past couple weeks.

campaigns.title: Help keep my parents home for COVID-19 quarantine
campaigns.description: I love my parents.¬† They are the heart and soul of our family... and we want to keep them around for as long as possible.  Over the weekend, a Coronavirus outbreak occurred in Kirkland, Washington - a city not far from where my parents live.¬† Today, Wednesday, March 4th, King County Public Health officials urged that the following groups of people should stay home: - People 60 and older - People with underlying health conditions including heart disease, lung disease, or diabetes - People who have weakened immune systems - People who are pregnant  Though my parents don't feel like it and don't realize it, they are actually considered "elderly."¬† (Shhhhhh!)¬† Additionally, my dad has respiratory issues which seems to make him more susceptible to pneumonia and lung infections.¬† Since the outbreak, I have been urging them to stay home, but with little success.¬† They love to volunteer in the community, as it fills them up and keeps them busy.  My 15-year-old daughter reminded me that over the past month they have binged watched some shows on Netflix that kept them so enthralled that they actually stayed home for hours at a time.¬† I had an "a-ha" moment.¬†   So, this morning - after urging them to pack up their Vanagon and just go camping for the next month or two (they laughed that idea off) - I passed along a list of shows they could binge on Netflix, with the idea that this might keep them busy and help them to be more content staying home and not volunteering out in the community.¬†   They really love crime dramas, mysteries, thrillers, British mysteries and thrillers.¬† They are - at this very moment - watching Harlan Coben's "Safe"... but I know that soon they will run out of shows from my Netflix suggestions list to watch!  So, I am trying to raise some money for them to get subscriptions to BritBox, AcornTV and Hulu so that they can possibly get sucked in and forget that hours, days, weeks are passing by... all the while the Coronavirus can do its thing and my parents can remain healthy.  And while I am doing this a bit tongue in cheek, I am also doing it because I want my parents to know that they are cared about, valued and loved beyond measure.¬† Any donation you can make towards these entertainment subscriptions would be so appreciated.¬† Any suggestions or other ideas would be appreciated, too!  Thank you!¬† Stay healthy and be well out there.¬† Hug your parents!

campaigns.title: Battle Against The Coronavirus
campaigns.description:
In the first month of this year, however, a sudden outbreak of the novel Coronavirus turned the entire world into a mess and put everyone on alert. This novel Coronavirus is a contagious virus originated from Wuhan, China that can cause symptoms such as fever, cough, breathing difficulties, pneumonia, severe respiratory syndromes, and even death. It expanded rapidly after it was developed through different ways of transmission including animals to humans and humans to humans, just like how common cold is spread.  Several countries around the globe including Italy, China, United States, Japan, Australia, France, Germany, Canada, Singapore, Malaysia, Korea, and Finland were already found to be infected with this lethal virus. 

According to the Chinese government officials, this novel Coronavirus first appeared in a seafood market on December 12, 2019. Within a short month, the number of people who are confirmed to be infected with this coronavirus had already become 86,657 along with 2305 deaths. the W.H.O (World Health Organization) declared the outbreak of this novel Coronavirus to be a global health emergency. Starting from February 1, 2020, travel to China , Italy , Iran, South Correa was restricted and this would lead to huge economic downfalls in every single country. 


Currently, tons of doctors and medical workers were fighting against the Coronavirus at the front line, and many of them had sacrificed their lives. With a tremendous amount of infected patients, China and many countries were facing medical shortages. Most of the hospitals in China desperately need supplies including masks, goggles, and protective suits. Without these types of equipment, the medical workers can be easily exposed to the Coronavirus and this can make the situation worse. 

So, we need your help! We appreciate everyone that is willing to participate in this fundraiser and all of the generous contributions from you will be used to purchase protective medical equipment including protective suits, N95 masks, and medical goggles. All of these were in urgent need for those medical workers in the front line. We will ensure all funds that we received will be used to purchase these types of equipment and we will update the processes. 


Let‚Äôs all fight against the Coronavirus together

 Please help.¬†
 

 This Go Fund Me is for a collective of six Seattle service industry workers. Donations will go directly to the following individuals:   Earl Saley  ‚Äî Purple Cafe   Wine Bar  Alexandra Votaw  ‚Äî The Pink Door  Alissa Pegram  ‚Äî The Pink Door  Sean Clemens  ‚Äî Purple Cafe   Wine Bar  Trever Boykin  ‚Äî Purple Cafe   Wine Bar  Jacob Patterson  ‚Äî Purple Cafe   Wine Bar  ¬†

campaigns.title: CoronaVirus family rescue
campaigns.description: Imagine being overseas in another country with your wife and son,¬† and finding out you have been stranded!  Government travel bans have caused Airlines to cancel tickets, without refunds/exchanges.    This Journey actually Began¬† way back in 2013. I came here to volunteer and help out. I taught, and helped multiple pastors during that time. I also married my best friend. She had been in my life, although from a distance for a long time. My time for departure was arriving and I was spending the last of my money I had extra over what i would need to eat, gas in car to get to work etc.     Dengue Fever  didn't care about any of that! A mosquito bit me contaminating my body with the Dengue Virus causing massive loss, along with a deadly brutal sickness.¬†     Missed flight-2013  was a horrid disaster. My visa expired a few days after the missed flight. While I laid sick bedridden my visa expired adding violation fees to the necessary extension fees. The Missed flight was a disaster. No money, and no way out. The airline even agreed to just let me standby fly out for another $150.00 if could leave that same week. Yet my body wracked with pains and fever was not up to the task of travel even if it meant getting better.   I Survived Dengue,  and after seven more months of living on an average of around $30.00 per month, losing nearly 80 lbs, I was helped by a great fellow from a church to make it back to the states.     Another Virus, CoronaVirus seeks¬† to wreak havoc in my life. That is why I brought up the Dengue experience. I lost my vehicles, tools for my business, furniture, clothes. I lost everything the first time with Dengue Fever. Due to being destitute I couldn't file papers to bring my wife home as we planned, being destitute meant leaving finally when I was helped, by myself to work and climb my way back up.  I paid all the loans back and slowly got back on my feet. It was a multiyear nightmare. Living on a hundred dollar per month food budget, no clothes budget, car budget, etc.    My family suffered being torn apart  for two years of only small contact with phonecards and Facebook Messenger.¬† Then at three years I was able to scrounge enough to visit 2 weeks on a poverty budget. The next year I filed papers to bring my wife and they told me I needed to prove I made enough, I thought well does the asylum seekers need enough financial support? They come mooching having never paid taxes, I have paid taxes since 14 years of age and never taken even unemployment. So this seems wrong, not saying don't help asylum seekers and those that need, but don't then discriminate against your own citizens. Her being here would increase income, and keep my earnings in the country instead of the need to send a big portion to her to live.   Today I sit scared  as my wife and son were finally going to come. With our last appointment at the embassy my wife is coming home! I want her to fly same flight, it cost a lot as most seats are booked on my flight.    Flight Canceled  with no recourse, or solution in sight. ¬†I don't have enough to replace my ticket, not even a dream or fantasy I will find a way or be blessed enough to get my wife and son replacement tickets too on a route and flight not canceled or high CoronaVirus locations.     I am asking,  even though I never have been a mooch and don't even know how, and really doubting anyone will care, and finding this hopeless, I am asking for your help.     Please¬† help me get home so I can work, pay my rent and not lose all that I have worked these long hard years to get back. If possible I would like to raise $1,000 to get the ticket with aisle seat(I'm wide wont fit in economy except aisle). Yes I am cheap I fly cheap seats except for choosing aisle. I don't know if that is enough even as each day the prices change, and with more and more canceled travelers looking I expect it to become higher.¬† That is the minimum, it will get me home to work, then hopefully In time I can get my wife a ticket and son and they will get home too.   Best option  would be finding way to bring them too by raising enough to pay their airfare also.¬† Her visa is at stake as she has a window to enter the USA and waiting excessive time they sometimes wont even grant the whole window. I leave that up to you folks. I am no mooch but I am desperate as I am work injured an cannot work for the monies I used to when younger and healthier. I wouldn't recover from losing everything again.   Some Pictures Follow   One thing Great Happened while stuck in the Philippines, I watched my son be delivered.¬† It happened at a small midwife clinic in middle of nowhere. Was scary, like out of the 1800's.    Last visit i was finally able to afford taking family and extended(2 sis in-laws and niece)to eat at a American quality equivalent restaurant. Was amazing cost around $16 per person but was better than any buffet i have been in America. They still are thankful, and smile so big when Vikings is brought up. For folks who make $2 or so a day with food costs at or around Americans(to buy they just don't buy the same foods eating lot cheaper than we do), they really appreciated it. As you can see I'm wearing a bulk pack white tee, I have learned from them to budget a lot more strictly.    For years I missed Birthdays and Christmas for not only my wife, but my son too. This was really hard for him. He wants to drive a backhoe so Papa can be home more. I cried when I heard that. I work hard, don't get drunk or waste money. Sometimes I wonder why has to be this hard. Work injury took my career away where I made enough to really provide a descent(not rich or even well off)life. I made 50-65k as a truck driver OTR.¬† I switched to a local job so i could be with family when they came but the Union company turned out to be a not a great choice.  I was hurt and was their fault they even admitted as much, I am permanently injured and Doctors say unlikely to drive a truck again. The company didn't even pay the light duty work. Just refused forcing me to have to work or die of starvation and family hate me when they can't eat because I didn't send money. My injury is real, my pain is real, yet because they could force me to have to work just to survive they haven't even paid the surgery that would fix my shoulder to a point it may be possible to work again at 30% chance.  Some say I have lived a life under a black cloud of bad luck, Eric a great friend of mine says he has never met anyone with as bad a luck as I have. I may have bad Luck and it may seem like there is no hope, so what, each day is a new day it may just get better.¬†  I for one would like to believe I am done missing birthdays and Christmas presents getting opened and seeing my son smile. He is honor role and does try so hard even he has ADHD so bad like his dad(me). We are teaching him to learn to self adjust so he can function normally, something I only learned about in twenties and have learned through personal experience does work, but takes work and time.     Hopefully Last Airport parting¬† was what I thought and believed before this travesty happened. Each time I flew out we took the pic here at the plaque outside the airport. Each time it was miserable and hard. Lost my house, all my business equipment and tools, clothes, just about everything else. I didn't lose the most important thing, my family. I may lost time I will never get back, but I still have my family. If you read this far please help, even its so small a gift, or just sharing to your church Facebook page etc.¬† I have never collected a dollar on one of these, but I have given hundreds to help others, I did it even broke as I was, I knew others might be better off, but that doesn't mean they care.  Thank you all for reading my sob story, it is hard and I thank you for your time, thank those who gave, I know you didn't have to, thank you.

campaigns.title: Financial support during COVID19 outbreak in Korea
campaigns.description:
Hello everyone. I‚Äôm Skylar! I‚Äôm American and I‚Äôm a full-time student at Korea University in Seoul, South Korea studying international studies.  Currently, I‚Äôve been facing some hard ships here in South Korea due to the coronavirus outbreak. Due to my visa, I‚Äôm only allowed to work and apply for certain part time jobs after a certain point in time of living here. I‚Äôve been working random tutoring jobs and gigs to stay afloat while living here so far and I‚Äôve lost all of those students due to the Coronavirus outbreak here in South Korea. The country is in a state of emergency, and for myself and certain other expats, we can‚Äôt find work anywhere.¬†
 

 I‚Äôve worked so hard to secure my spot here in South Korea, and my spot at Korea University, an Ivy League university. School has also been delayed because of the virus, and I‚Äôm in such a state of limbo. We will start to attend classes online in 2 weeks but my lap top has been broken for months, and I have no money to fix it.¬†  My journey here in South Korea has already been financially challenging, but at this time I‚Äôm at a loss. Any donations to help keep myself a float at the moment are very appreciated. Everyone stay safe, and thank you for your kindness.  -Skylar :)

campaigns.title: Computer for Coronavirus research
campaigns.description: I have been involved with distributed computing for the better part of a year. ¬†Distributed computing is the process of taking a large chunk of computational data, breaking it up, sending it to individual users for automatic analyzation on their computer and sending the completed data back to the participating institution. ¬†There are two main COVID-19 distributed computing research projects: Rosetta, run by the University of Washington, and Folding, run by Stanford. ¬†Both have already made extremely important contributions to the understanding of COVID-19. ¬†The more we know about this virus, the faster we will reach a cure.  When COVID-19 (Coronavirus) started to spread, I ¬†brought several old computers back online to help with this work. ¬†While this does help with research, my computers are between 8 and 12 years old...they are several orders of magnitude less powerful than modern scientific workstations. ¬†They are unable perform modern heavy workloads, and combined consume roughly 2000 watts, 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.  I am looking to build a research workstation that will allow me to process heavy COVID-19 research workloads. ¬† A link to the computer build is listed. ¬†This computer will be used ONLY for COVID-19 related research and data analyzation. ¬†It will NOT be used for recreational activities, crypto mining, etc.  I am happy to answer any questions regarding COVID-19 research and the purpose of this computer. ¬†Feel free to reach out to me at any time.

campaigns.title: Coronavirus Relief Fund For Pharmacy Or Masks
campaigns.description: Summary A new coronavirus named COVID-19 has spread across multiple continents and infected thousands of people. The virus has caused more than 3,000 deaths, primarily in China. Donations to this fund will help stop the spread of COVID-19 and support response efforts. (Please note: We cannot accept donations originating from Mainland China in accordance with the Law of the People's Republic of China on Administration of Activities of Overseas Nongovernmental Organizations.)  Challenge It is critical to stop the spread of the virus and provide medical care to those who need it. Patients and front-line medical responders in high-risk and quarantined areas need supplies and continued support as the crisis unfolds.  Solution Donations to this fund will bring services to affected communities and help stop the virus's spread. Initially, the fund will help meet immediate needs for healthcare, food, and water in partnership with our nonprofit partners. As the situation unfolds, it will transition to support longer-term education and recovery efforts run by local, vetted organizations in affected regions. We will work with our partners on the ground to allocate funds where they're most needed.  Long-Term Impact We believe that organizations that are deeply rooted in local communities are in the best position to provide long-term support for survivors of outbreaks and other crises. By funding the relief efforts of local organizations, donations to this fund have the potential to build stronger response capacity so that these organizations are better equipped to face future outbreaks. EmmaGiving will post reports about how funds have been used and will email these reports to donors.

campaigns.title: Supplies Novel Coronavirus COVID-19 Chengdu, China
campaigns.description: Please share this gofundme with your friends. We need help   The " Novel Coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) " started in Wuhan and spread to the rest of China.  In Chengdu, Sichuan we didn't have many cases of the virus until recently. However now, the virus is spreading rapidly (over 450 confirmed cases) and Chengdu is now under almost complete lock-down by the Chinese authorities. It's the right thing to do, but it's causing massive problems.    By the time the virus lock-down was declared Chengdu stores had already been sold out of face masks, plastic suits and plastic gloves for many days . Now, by law, and enforced vigorously you can't leave your house without a mask, and you really shouldn't shop or do much else without plastic gloves or a plastic suit, but you just can't buy them anymore. ¬†  Workers can't work, companies can't open because only about 10% of workers are in Chengdu, the rest are stuck in their hometowns. Most stores aren't open. Without a mask you can't go anywhere. It's very bad for elderly people, they don't have the resources to help themselves.   I'm Canadian, and I've been living in Chengdu for about 4 years. I really love this city, and I want to help out. Because I'm a foreigner, many Chinese friends, and Chinese neighbors,¬† and even people I've never met before but have seen walking around my complex have been asking me if I have a source for masks and virus prevention supplies. I didn't but I have found a supply in Hong Kong.   Masks and plastic suits are desperately needed in Chengdu, for medical workers, essential workers and everyday people. People are washing masks and reusing them because of the shortage. Many people just can't afford to buy masks or can't find them to buy even if they have money.   I have found a source of masks, plastic suits, and plastic gloves in Hong Kong, and I can find a way to get them to Chengdu. Good masks cost about $1 per mask, while plastic suits are $3-4. I can get a much better price per unit if I buy more.¬†  My plan is to distribute the masks, plastic suits and plastic gloves to the poorer areas close to where I live (south Chengdu) and focus on the elderly, and people who need them the most. The more funds I can raise, the bigger area we can help. If we prevent even one person from getting infected that could prevent hundreds more later.¬†   My estimate is that $1000 will buy enough supplies to protect an entire block for a month. Of course, more would be better.¬† I'd love to raise more than that and expand the area and amount of time I can help. I do have friends who will help me distribute it, and our plans will be updated constantly depending on what's happening with the virus. I will also be cooperating with a couple of foreigner organizations here.   The COVID-19 virus is truly an epidemic already, especially in China. We need help immediately. Please help out by hitting the donate button. Every penny helps. If you can help out with $5, $10, $20, $100 it would be so appreciated by me, and by my Chinese neighbors.

campaigns.title: Fund COVID19 Action by People with Chronic Illness
campaigns.description: As we face the COVID-19 pandemic in the US and worldwide, we all are wondering how we will get through it, individually and collectively. And people with chronic illnesses need specific strategies.  I'll get to the point: I'm working with organizations and people across the country to launch a powerful national network of people with chronic illnesses.  We need your support, your wisdom, and your love -- and if possible, financial contributions.  I've spent most of my life being a part of game-changing HIV, LGBTQ and justice movements.¬† I've founded deeply-effective organizations, coalitions and national networks. I've anchored teams of staff and volunteers, and held responsibilities for budgets and strategies from individual compassionate support to massive direct action.  I am honored to learn from and work with queer people of color who are the generative leaders of disability justice¬† and healing justice movements with the power to transform our society so we all can thrive. I'm a longtime health care activist and journalist with multiple chronic illnesses. I focus on the intersection of health, care and medical systems; structures of power, information and control; and self-organizing networks to mobilize community wisdom and love.  So now -- working with national networks and brilliant organizers, healers and medical professionals -- I'm building a vital network of people living with chronic illnesses and our allies.  We may call it Chronic Illness Leadership For Emergent Times (CIVFET). But what's most important is what we're going to do:  --  We are hosting a video meeting on Saturday. Register at bit.ly/march7webinar¬† (case-specific link).  (Thanks to AIDS United, Black Emotional and Mental Health collective (BEAM), The Counter Narrative Project , Positive Women's Network-USA (PWN-USA), ME Action for your co-sponsorship of the webinar.)  --  We've planned and initiated a rapidly-scalable plan for this network based on emergent strategies and mutual aid. We need your support to move forward as quickly and effectively as possible. As you know, people living with some chronic illnesses and disabilities are at greater risk of acquiring a coronavirus, having a more severe course of it and complications during or afterwards, and higher mortality rates.  And those facing oppression, marginalization and criminalization are most affected by heightened demands on health care systems and supply chains, economic turmoil, and rising stigma and bias.  (take a breath or a pause.)  But queer and trans people have always had to find new paths for our survival.¬† Our strategies for dealing with chronic illnesses, like our communities themselves, are diverse, creative and take nothing for granted.  We are building a small but amazing team of network strategists, health professionals and healers, facilitators, fiscal managers, disaster response pros, project managers and tech experts, communicators and media producers.  Your support goes directly to this team -- which are primarily queer and trans people living with multiple chronic conditions.  Thank you.

campaigns.title: ÊîØÊè¥ÊµôÊ±üÔºÅ Help Fight Coronavirus in Zhejiang China!
campaigns.description: We are fundraising for medical supplies to support hospitals in Zhejiang, China in their fight against the recent coronavirus outbreak.¬†  3/5 Final Update: This campaign has completed.  Financial and delivery information are available at   https://onedrive.live.com/?authkey=%21ADRpcWPLDO%2DXxTA id=8802A5DE2E5AC593%214777 cid=8802A5DE2E5AC593   . Please also refer to campaign updates for more details.¬†   Who are we?  We are alumni volunteers of Hangzhou Foreign Language School. We are working to support our hometown and our country in this Coronavirus outbreak.   How serious is this Coronavirus?  The recently identified Novel Coronavirus 2019(2019 n-CoV), a cousin of the SARS virus, has infected thousands of people since the outbreak began in Wuhan, China, in December 2019. The virus has spread to a total of fifteen countries across four continents.¬†  Wuhan and more than¬† 14 other cities have been locked down and major tourist destinations have been shut down to contain the 2019 n-CoV outbreak. Despite the effort, up to Jan 27, 4581 people have been infected and 105 have died with 6973 suspected. 350,000 people are estimated to be infected by the beginning of February. Hospital services were near collapse under the pressure of people flooding in to be diagnosed and treated. Medical supplies run dangerously low.   Why Zhejiang?  Zhejiang, the province with the largest floating population, is experiencing rapid development of the epidemic and fast growing¬† number of patients. At the same time, its capital Hangzhou, has received hundreds of Wuhan passengers returning from abroad in the past few days and carried out quarantine, isolation and other prevention and control work. A number of hospitals have shouldered heavy responsibility of providing health observation, diagnosis and treatment for Wuhan passengers as well as Zhejiang passengers who flew back on the same flights.  In the past several days, the number of patients confirmed with coronavirus in Zhejiang Province increased dramatically. Zhejiang has become the third largest epidemic area in China. As of Jan 27, 2020, 173 cases of Zhejiang have been confirmed. Doctors and nurses are working around the clock with very little rest. The rapid growing outbreak has left hospitals in Zhejiang in urgent need of medical supplies such as protective suits, N95 masks, etc. We shall not leave the doctors and medical staff exposed in danger. Please join us to extend your love and help to them!¬†   How will your donation be used?¬†  Donate to help the doctors and nurses in the hospitals¬† get  sufficient medical supplies ! They are fighting to protect all of us,¬† and let‚Äôs give our support to protect them!   Due to merchandise availability, our volunteers will be making the purchase at their own expense to ensure we get the supplies, then the finance officer (Beneficiary of the campaign) will reimburse the amount as the invoices indicate. As a result, the withdrawal from the campaign will be going to our finance officer's own personal bank account.¬†   Your generous support will be first used to purchase  certified medical protective gears including ¬† protective suits and respirators  , and will be distributed to hospitals in Zhejiang, such as First Affiliated Hospital Zhejiang University, Second Affilated Hospital Zhejiang University, and Sir Run Run Shaw Hospital.¬†¬†   Our Plan to get the campaign's donations to the intended recipients  Our volunteers are divided into multiple teams: Campaign Finance, Supply Acquisition, Appraisal, Transportation and Hospital Connection.   Campaign Finance team is responsible for handling all monetary payment and reimbursement for the purchase.   Supply Acquisition team will purchase the certified medical supplies from merchants all over the world through our alumni network after appraisal and assessment by Appraisal team. This makes sure that we are only purchasing those that meet the hospital requirements and standards.   Hospital Connection team will reach out to hospitals in Zhejiang and collect their requirements on the specific protective gears and quantity needed, while Transportation team will coordinate on the delivery of supplies from our warehouses to the hospitals.  Regular updates will be posted on the progress of our purchase orders until all of our orders have been delivered.¬† campaigns.title: CORONA VIRUS EMERGENCY ITALY
campaigns.description: FOR THE THIRD WEEK IN A ROW NORTHERN ITALY HAS BEEN ON A LOCKDOWN, SCHOOLS AND UNIVERSITIES ARE CLOSED, MANY JOBS AND EVENTS ARE SUSPENDED, MY STUDENT SCHOLARSHIP HAS BEEN SUSPENDED AS ALL THE COURSES AND EXAMS HAVE BEEN BLOCKED AS WELL, THE SCHOOL WHERE I WORK AS A TEACHER HAS BEEN CLOSED FOR 3 WEEKS NOW, AND I HAVEN'T BEEN ABLE TO WORK, GYMS THEATERS AND CINEMAS ARE CLOSED AND ANY SPORT OR PUBLIC EVENT OR GATHERING IS FORBIDDEN.¬† ANY JOB INTERVIEWS ALSO HAVE BEEN BANNED OR POSTPONED, FACTORIES ARE CLOSING BUSINESSES ARE GOING BANKRUPT. IT IS A REALLY BAD SITUATION THE GOVERNMENT HAS PUT US IN DUE TO THE SPREAD OF CORONA VIRUS. NEW MEASURES ALSO HAVE BEEN ENACTED . campaigns.title: help us stop CoronaVirus spread
campaigns.description:
Hi everyone and thank you so much for your support and effort.


It is critical to stop the spread of the virus and provide medical care to those who need it. Patients and front-line medical responders in high-risk and quarantined areas need supplies and continued support as the crisis unfolds.

Donations to this fund will bring services to affected communities and help stop the virus's spread. Initially, the fund will help meet immediate needs for healthcare, food, and water in partnership with our nonprofit partners. As the situation unfolds, it will transition to support longer-term education and recovery efforts run by local, vetted organizations in affected regions. We will work with our partners on the ground to allocate funds where they're most needed.

We believe that organizations that are deeply rooted in local communities are in the best position to provide long-term support for survivors of outbreaks and other crises. By funding the relief efforts of local organizations, donations to this fund have the potential to build stronger response capacity so that these organizations are better equipped to face future outbreaks. GlobalGiving will post reports about how funds have been used and will email these reports to donors.

Greetings to you all,

campaigns.title: COVID-19 Vaccine Research
campaigns.description: This is a fundraising initiative to pursue the creation of¬†a COVID-19 Vaccine by Dr. Wilfred Jefferies and his team.¬†   Dr. Wilfred Jefferies is a Professor in the Michael Smith Laboratories and a Senior Research Scientist in the Vancouver Prostate Centre at the University of British Columbia. Dr. Jefferies is working towards creating and testing a safe and effective vaccine for the novel coronavirus, COVID-19. His approach is explained here:    https://globalnews.ca/video/6622294/ubc-research-teams-work-on-high-performance-covid-19-vaccine    In January 2020, a novel coronavirus (COVID-19) was identified as the cause of an outbreak of pneumonia originating in Wuhan, China and has since spread to at least 89 countries and territories around the world.¬†Small-molecule anti-viral ¬†therapies targeting different stages of the corona virus lifecycle may be¬†effective in treating COVID-19, however, in the absence of an effective vaccine, the probability of containment is low and the world must be¬†prepared for a pandemic. Therefore, the rapid¬†development of protective vaccines against COVID-19 has become a societal priority but remains a scientific challenge. The ideal COVID-19 vaccine would elicit highly potent neutralizing antibody responses against a broad spectrum of emerging COVID-19 viral strains; induce protection against infection and transmission; and be safe by not inducing any harmful immune or inflammatory responses. These are particular challenges in vaccination against viruses such as COVID-19. This funding initiative builds upon groundbreaking research by Dr. Jefferies and his team on vaccines against Rubella, West Nile Virus, Smallpox, Influenza, and Cancers and seeks to create and test a safe and effective COVID-19 vaccine for rapid implementation.¬†  The Sullivan Urology Foundation supports Dr Jefferies in his work at UBC and the Vancouver Prostate Centre and is partnering with this GoFundMe in support of the development of a COVID-19 vaccine.¬† The Sullivan Urology Foundation provides financial support to the Department of Urologic Sciences at the University of British Columbia for basic scientific translational and clinical research.¬†   http://www.urologyfoundation.ca/

campaigns.title: Project Corona Short Film
campaigns.description:
¬£300 Budget to be raised for location services ¬† 
 

  The year is 2025, COVID-19 has ravaged the uk and left the country in a state of despair.¬†
 

 22 year old Fern has learned to survive by travelling from settlement to settlement offering her services completing odd jobs in exchange for food, medicine and shelter.¬†
 

 As She travels the country on her deceased fathers beloved bike, she runs out of fuel and must make her way to the nearest military outpost in the hopes of finding her much needed fuel.¬†
 

 As she arrives at the checkpoint she discovers the place has been overrun with infected and she must deal with them before she has access to the fuel.¬†
 

  A Jamie Neagle Film.¬†
 

 Directed by Ruby Hamilton¬† Executive Producer Screen   Film School ‚Äò Creative producer Jamie Neagle¬† 1st Ad Christian Garnes¬† Cinematography by George Baker   Danny Barker¬† Art by Paula Pindado Grajal¬† Sound by Ieuan Lowther   Lara Bertin¬†  
 

 Once the funds have been raised they will be used to secure the location for the days filming.¬†
 

 Our whole crew will benefit from this project as it makes up 60% of our final first year grade. The project is ambitious but is the perfect opportunity to showcase our skills learned in the first year.¬†
 

 Funds to be secured by April 6th 2020

Whatever your Faith, Gender, or Political Affiliation, it means nothing when it comes to helping those in need.¬†¬†  "As of January 2019, California had an estimated 151,278 experiencing homelessness on any given day, as reported by Continuums of Care to the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD). Of that Total, 7,044 were family households, 10,980 were Veterans, 11,993 were unaccompanied young adults (aged 18-24), and 41,557 were individuals experiencing chronic homelessness.  Public school data reported to the U.S. Department of Education during the 2017-2018 school year shows that an estimated 263,058 public school students experienced homelessness over the course of the year. Of that total, 10,407 students were unsheltered, 17,299 were in shelters, 13,713 were in hotels/motels, and 221,639 were doubled up."  Source:  Homeless Statistics ¬†   If 15,000 of us in this great state of California and Great Country would just donate $10 to this organization, we could meet our goal of donating around $10 bucks for every 10 homeless people in California!   I will not drink my favorite specialty coffee TODAY and donate the first $10 to this organization.  THANK YOU for reading this!   More information about Lutheran Social Services of Southern California: Today LSSSC annually serves thousands of individuals and families in need throughout Southern California with over 50 different programs/services at over 20 different locations.¬† LSSSC is associated with other Lutheran Social Services all over the United States!   ¬† Picture Source

campaigns.title: COVID-19: Connecting People with Chronic Illness
campaigns.description: As we face the COVID-19 pandemic in the US and worldwide, we all are wondering how we will get through it, individually and collectively. And people with chronic illnesses need specific strategies.  I'll get to the point:   I'm working with organizations and people across the country to help launch a powerful national network of people with chronic illnesses.    --  We need your support, your wisdom, and your love -- and if possible, financial contributions.  --      What We're Doing:  For now, we're calling it Chronic Illness Leadership For Emergent Times (CILFET). But what's most important is what we have done and will do  --  We hosted a video meeting on Saturday, March 7 that's now a  Healing Justice Podcast episode   ---  Thanks to: PeoplesHub, AIDS United, BEAM (Black Emotional and Mental Health Collective) Counter Narrative Project, Health Justice Commons, #MEAction Network, Positive Women's Network - USA and The Reunion Project  And to our webinar speakers, facilitators, promoters, strategists and producers Kate Werning of Healing Justice Podcast, Evvie Ormon of EmergingPhoenix consulting, Dr. Crissaris Sarnelli, Elandria Williams of PeoplesHub, Emily Szklarski, Joan Dark, Kate Sorensen, Andrew Reynolds,¬† and Daisy Becerra.  --  We have materials from the webinar and resources up at  bit.ly/cilfetstuff.¬†   --  We will continue hosting and supporting mutual aid and conversations centering people with chronic illnesses and disabilities  --  We're planning and initiating a rapidly-scalable plan for this network based on emergent strategies and mutual aid. We need your support to move forward as quickly and effectively as possible.  Why We are Doing This:  As you know, people living with some chronic illnesses and disabilities are at greater risk of acquiring a coronavirus, having a more severe course of it and complications during or afterwards, and higher mortality rates.  And those facing oppression, marginalization and criminalization are most affected by heightened demands on health care systems and supply chains, economic turmoil, and rising stigma and bias.  (let‚Äôs all take a breath or a little pause‚Ä¶)  But queer and trans people have always had to find new paths for our survival. Our strategies for dealing with chronic illnesses, like our communities themselves, are diverse, creative and take nothing for granted.  We are building a small but amazing team of network strategists, health professionals and healers, facilitators, fiscal managers, disaster response pros, project managers and tech experts, communicators and media producers. We want to situate this vital network in a stable home or formation so it can do what it needs to do.  Your support goes directly to help this team do what we need to do -- which are primarily queer and trans people living with multiple chronic conditions.  Thank you.   GoFundMe has asked for people raising funds about COVID-19 to provide this specific information:    1. Who you are: JD Davids    2. Where you're from: I live in Brooklyn, NY    3. Your relationship to the parties you're raising funds for: They are for myself and a small team working on this effort. (see next question).    4. How the funds will be spent (be specific as possible): The funds will be used to donate to the small team of people who I am working with who are giving up time on other paid work or who are working with low pay to launch this important network. It includes me, and a social media and communications manager who lives in New Jersey, an artist and filmmaker in Utah, a recent graduate school graduate in New Orleans with a degree in disaster response, an organizer in Brooklyn who also works part time at a radical bookstore, and will include one of two people in NYC I am talking to who are experts in creating networks and sustainable cooperative groups.

campaigns.title: (COVID-19) crisis: basic supplies needed!
campaigns.description:
As you may know, the grave situation in Wuhan and China continue to worsen by the day. Currently, the government is mass quarantining people who have been infected in poor conditions and in places that were not designed to house large amounts of people for long periods of times (i.e sports stadiums, exhibits, etc). There is a growing shortage of basic medical supplies such as masks and medical kits for proper diagnoses‚Äîthis is expected to only be exacerbated with the continued lock down and eventually include food, water, etc. In most parts of China there is a significant shortage of masks and other protective wear, making the prevention and protection of civilians increasingly challenging.   We can not afford to allow basic protection/resources be the reason this mass spreads, kills more on a global scale and further impact the global economy.¬† In 2003, SARS cost the global economy¬† $40B.¬† At that time, China's GDP was¬† 25% ¬†of what it is today.¬†  Did you know?  Masks should be changed out every four hours in order to prevent virus from contaminating/penetrating the mask.   

Due to shortages of medical kits the numbers are currently very underreported (31k diagnosed, 600+ deaths as of 2/6) and hospitals are forced to turn people away due to these shortages and hospital overcrowding.

For those who don‚Äôt know me, my name is Alice and I am from the greater Philadelphia area. I currently reside in San Francisco. 100% of the money raised will go towards the procuring and shipping supplies from the US to less urban areas of China where they are most challenged with basic resources to keep themselves safe.  My mom is currently in a small town (Jiangxi province) and has a group of volunteers that are willing to travel to neighboring towns to deliver and donate masks and other supplies to local hospitals.   This plan is set to evolve depending on how much we are able to raise. The more ambitious goal is to air ship supplies directly there (multiple times). Cost estimates and potential impact below (based on amazon prices--will also be researching wholesalers to improve quantities):  - $8,000  can buy ~ 2,200   N95 masks  that can be distributed to hospitals and quarantine facilities (to be used to protect nurses and doctors) - $8,000  can buy  40,000 flu masks  that will be distributed for civilian protection - $30,000  can buy  7,200 8 oz.  hand sanitizers -air ship cost: TBD. Placeholder for $5k for now.  Anything helps!! Thank you in advance!!

Update Feb 13th: purchased and shipped 10 boxes of N95 masks via amazon ($1450)

Update March 6th: first two boxes have arrived!!

Upcoming plans: sending hand sanitizers to Wuhan directly to my cousins address for donations to local hospitals and schools.

campaigns.title: Do It For Liam
campaigns.description:
Liam‚Äôs journey started on September 9, 2019. The day my world got a lot brighter and joyful To be a parent. Liam is 7 months old. About two months ago he was diagnosed with Guillain-Barr√© syndrome if you don‚Äôt know what that is, it‚Äôs is a serious health problem that occurs when the body's defense (immune) system mistakenly attacks part of the peripheral nervous system. This leads to nerve inflammation that causes muscle weakness or paralysis and other symptoms. That day I cried my eyes out and my whole world turned upside down. But when I looked at Liam he had the greatest joy and giggled when I said peek a boo, your my little sunshine. It breaks my heart knowing that one day my baby boy could die. But he is stronger than anything in the whole wide world and he has a heart
Of gold. For the past two months I have been going to specialists and surgeons and doctors appoints to get some info on how it gets better and about two
Days ago Dr. Leung contacted me and said there is an experimental treatment but because he is so young it will cost a lot of money and me and my wife Lauren can‚Äôt handle the cost. The surgery is Spinal tap (lumbar puncture). A small amount of fluid is withdrawn from the spinal canal in your lower back. The fluid is tested for a type of change that commonly occurs in people who have Guillain-Barr√© syndrome. That alone cost us $18,000. But that‚Äôs not the problem the treatment is Immunoglobulin therapy. Immunoglobulin containing healthy antibodies from blood donors is given through a vein (intravenously). High doses of immunoglobulin can block the damaging antibodies that may contribute to Guillain-Barr√© syndrome. And cause it to dissipate to the point where he is clean and healthy and it cost us around $73,450. This treatment could allow me to be able to teach my son Liam how to play baseball ‚öæÔ∏è and I would truly love that just as much as he would love to go to the park and enjoy life. PLEASE HELP US MAKE PUT BABY BOY BE ABLE TO CRAWL, WALK, And be free.

campaigns.title: Corona Virus Experiment - Human Test Subject
campaigns.description: According to various media outlets, medical expert¬† at this time are still struggling and unsure just how someone can contract the Corona Virus.¬†  For these reasons, and as a way to raise awareness and funding for our weekly podcast -- "Grandmas Basement" we thought it would be helpful and informative to shed light on this issue by subjecting ourselves in different ways to the corona virus itself.¬†  As should go without saying, the experiment, will be conducted in a basement to ensure optimal safety.¬† Upon the experiment's conclusion the basement will be sanitized and disinfected with Clorox wipes.¬† As well as 2 gallons of Pure Bright Liquid Bleach.¬†  Experiment Outline:  Part 1)¬† Apply Active Virus to Floor Mat.¬† Test Subject will then touch  active virus with hands and rub up next to virus.¬†  - 24 hours later determine whether Test Subject contracted virus¬† (regardless continue with experiment to see if conditions worsen)¬†   Part 2)¬† Ingest Active Virus Droplets into each eye (approximately 7-10 droplets in each eye)¬†  - 24 hours later determine whether Test Subject contracted virus¬† (regardless continue with experiment to see if conditions worsen)¬†   Part 3)¬† Drink 50 droplets of the Active Virus by placing the live active¬† virus droplets into a Cocktail known as, "Corona fog"  i.e.,   a corona beer topped off with Tequila and lime + salt. Tastes like a margarita and it'll "getcha".   Part 4) Snort through nostril 50¬† droplets of the Active Virus.¬† Followed by another Corona Fog Cocktail with 100 stiff droplets of the Virus.¬†  - 24 hours later determine whether Test Subject contracted virus¬† (regardless continue with experiment to see if conditions worsen)¬†    All Parts above will be time stamped, video recorded, and verified as  authentic by a notary of the public.¬† ¬†  Video recordings will be released via Youtube four weeks after the time stamp of Part 4 commencement -- as soon as snorting the virus¬† begins.¬†   The CDC provides,¬†  People can fight stigma and help, not hurt, others by providing social support. Counter stigma by learning and sharing facts. Communicating the facts that viruses do not target specific racial or ethnic groups and how COVID-19 actually spreads can help stop stigma.   This experiment does all that, and more.¬†   Help us ... Help you ... and in turn ... Help the world.¬†

campaigns.title: CoViD-19: Support the retired Elephants of Angkor
campaigns.description: After 3 years of planning and hard work, we have finally been able to retire the 14 elephants of Angkor Wat. The Kulen Elephant Forest opened its doors to the public on the 16th of December 2019.  By shifting the focus of animal-based tourism to conservation and retiring the world‚Äôs most famous riding elephants, we take great pride in having been able to make such a statement. They are now in a safe haven, living a beautiful life at the Kulen Elephant Forest.   ¬†But we are more than a safe home for the Elephants, we are an opportunity for the community; to improve education, conserve the natural world and bring everyone together in trying to preserve the remaining elephants of Cambodia.  Today, this vision is under threat. The outbreak of the CoViD-19 has negatively impacted Cambodia‚Äôs tourism in such a way that we are now fearful. Fearful that we now may struggle to sustain ourselves alone. Our self-sustaining model relied on tourism to finance our basic operations, and being so new, we did not have the time to save enough for this kind of contingency.  ¬†We need YOUR HELP to care for them.   Especially our oldest elephants who need more food, supplements and medical supplies.  ¬† $1000 = cost to care for 1 elephant per month  $20 = daily food cost for 1 elephant  $10 = daily medical cost for 1 elephant.   If you would like to help, please spread the message, donate or contact us about any support you might want to offer.

campaigns.title: Deliver masks against corona-virus in Europe
campaigns.description:
Not so long ago I didn't really think about what was going on in China with the coronavirus. How many people are sick with it. I thought the media was just panicking.
 

 But 2 days ago my friend Mike got the coronavirus in Italy. He was there on vacation with his family, now doctors forbid even to visit him.  After that, I wondered what I could do to help fight the virus. What can we do?
 

 But we can do a lot!  COVID-19 is a fairly strong virus with high persistence, which increases in hematologic progression. The only thing that mankind can do at the moment is to have a vaccine that will take 5 years or more to develop (along with trials).   Now mankind can only prevent it from spreading so fast. To do so, you need to reduce contact with humans and wear masks.   At the moment, people in Europe are in great need of masks. As in Korea, especially China. But Europe was not ready for such a rapid spread of the virus, so they now have an acute shortage of masks.  That's why we want to help with our own means as well as to attract donors to buy/create N95 masks and send them to Europe. To countries such as Italy, France, Germany, and others.
 

 In this environment, many speculators have appeared. Which inflates the prices of masks ten times. Not everyone can afford these masks.  But we plan to send more than MILLIONS of masks.   Every cent is important to us.  Stop the virus spreading together!

campaigns.title: FRONTLINES COVID_19 -KILLING IT, with Kindness!
campaigns.description:
Life in the USA Coronavirus Epicenter. Killing it with kindness!! Helping others is something that elevates the spirit.¬† Uplifting your spirit makes it harder for you to get and stay sick.¬† There is proof of that everyday around the world. 

Our Mission? Killin it with Kindness: Giving and Undertaking a scary and endless task ¬†for those in need! And right now in our home state there is MASSIVE NEED!

We live in the epicenter of the Coronavirus epidemic for the USA, Bellevue Washington.¬† Just a few miles from Kirkland, Washington, where virtually all our states deaths have ensued. We are in respectable physical health and BELIEVE our immune systems are resilient. We are saddened to see so many people terrified and so few that are willing to help; do to fear and rightly so. We feel the need to do what is on our hearts and volunteer to suit up and go to Battle with this Epidemic. ¬†To start, we want to offer our services to completely disinfect areas around King, Pierce, Snohomish County, and surrounding areas. ¬†No job too small or big, we would firstly like to focus on places centered on those with already compromised immune systems, people who have self-quarantined and need some extra help to disinfect their location¬† Communal gathering Places, Schools, and Churches. Stores and restaurants 



We ask YOU to please consider a donation of even 5$ to support attainment the costly supplies needed to do this job!! These things include (but are not limited to):




¬†Powerful germ killing Steam Cleaners that can range from $300-$2000

Hot water power washers,

Industrial disinfectant, sanitization kits

Sanitization suits, a piece of personal protective equipment that consists of an impermeable whole-body garment worn as protection against hazardous materials.¬†¬†

GLOVES

Respirator with inserts for bio/ chemical filtration

Soap and antibacterial BODY WASH

Vitamins and supplements to keep our healthy team that way!!

Living in the epicenter of this virus right now is seriously eerie, when the streets of Seattle are bare and the roads are clear. People are held hostage in their own homes under this virus and its still spreading , we vow to fight this TILL THE END. We are asking for a goal of $15,000 to allow us to purchase these needed tools ASAP and get to Work!!

As long as the donations allow it we will be working nonstop going to the front lines with our weapons of mass destruction until the coronavirus has left the building! Services will be complimentary for those who cannot afford it. Period. LET‚ÄôS DO THIS.

Who are we? Just a small group of Janitorial Workers, and Property Maintenance and management personnel who are healthy and not crippled by fear, who are willing to do the job that very few are willing to do, we will update regularly on what our team is doing to help slow and stop this virus from spreading any further.¬†¬†Thank you and God bless, if you cannot donate please share!

As I am the only one who live in the states, I've been sending them as much money as I can but it's far from enough since I only make so much as I'm new to the career.¬† We weren't prepared for this.. This Coronavirus hit them with no warning.. Nobody saw this coming.. Can you imagine the whole family having no income or job out of no where especially during a disaster like this? It's so scary... I haven't seen my family for 3 years and was planning on finally visiting them on May... I miss them so much but now that's my least concern. campaigns.title: My fantastic death bed featuring COVID-19
campaigns.description: Unfortunately its all come down to this. After a 10 day trip visiting my family in Florida I had what appeared to be a panic attack on January 27th on my way back home across the country to Arizona. A shortness of breath came over me,my blood pressure rose, and my heart started palpitating like crazy. Needless to say I thought I was having a heart attack and was going to die.  ¬† ¬† I had a connecting flight in Dallas but sent my luggage through to Arizona and got taken to the hospital. They did loads of blood tests, nasal swab, the works. Everything came back normal and they sent me on my way.  ¬† ¬†The next day I woke up with a really dry mouth and a fever in the hotel, that tightness in my chest was still there and I felt as though I couldn't breathe but this time I was alone. ¬† ¬†This is all in the midst of the Coronavirus scare so I was somewhat worried especially since I was in the same hospital as the Texas first case. Before many Americans were taking it seriously. I had a choice to make; go home thousands of miles from my family or get my flight changed and get to the bottom of this.  ¬† ¬† Fast forward to now. I've been to the E.R. 4 times and saw my primary care for the first time last week. I had another fever and dry mouth and a dry cough for the first time. They tested me for the flu and it came back negative. ¬† ¬†Now everyday my breathing has been getting worse. Then I find out that COVID-19 has shown up in Florida cities away from eachother with no travel history of patients. I've attempted to get tested for COVID-19 but it all failed despite being at three seperate international airports and Florida hotspots before travel restrictions were implemented. Somehow I still dont fit the testing criteria.  ¬† ¬†Now I'm with my family who is trying to be cool and collected but I feel I'm just a burden. I have no income and one weeks woth of clothes. Whats worse is I'm seeing them getting sick as well and they're trying to ignore it. I'm now stuck with medical bills and dont think I'll be able to make it and pay them. I lost my job over this illness and just want to be able to keep my family comfortable if I die.  ¬† As much as I hate sob stories and begging for money I ask you fine folk to please get the word about this out there. I would hate for my community to fall victim to such a terrifying disease. I'll keep updates via youtube most likely. If anyone has any medical supplies they would be willing to spare that would also be appreciated. ¬† ¬† If I'm able to get tested for COVID-19 before this gets any worse I'll update you. If I find out what's actually happening I'll update you. If I get quarantined I'll update you. I just want to keep my loved ones safe. As should all of you. ¬† ¬† Any advice on where to support COVID-19 patients would be very helpful as well because I would like to put 20% of donations toward families affected by COVID-19. As a hurricane Katrina survivor I understand what its like to be in an idle position where you feel hopeless and helpless. I dont want my loved ones to be in that position ever again. Youtube updates
